content: This app is the most frustrating app I've ever seen. I dedicated so much time and even sacrifice my sleep to complete a very long course and the app started malfunctioning and my progress wasn't saved. I tried changing password and it could not even change. It is always telling me to log in again and again. Do something quickly because I can't retake the course. My progress should be brought back ASAP. I don't know why ads are hindering learning???

This app is not helpful, this is the second time am complaining and nothing is done. I have three different already finished course i have done on this app, and now i want to pay for certificates. It a now a big issue. Please someone should something quickly i need the certificate.
It does not play video, not here in the app only, even in the web, this really made me tired, please fix as soon as possible, plus we need full notes apart from deppending on video only.

Previously, I rated this app 5 stars but now am giving it 1 star. I can't watch videos anymore on the courses I have already enrolled in, I keep seeing "private video, login to watch", I had to create an account on Vimeo to login and watch the video but it tells me am not authorized to watch the video. Please you guys need to do something about this as the app is literally useless now as I can't watch the videos on the courses. Thank you

Nice app and easy to navigate, but why don't you people tell us that we will have to pay for certificates? I came with hopes that everything is free until I finished the course and only learned by then that I have to pay for certificate. Not happy
I was very interested, but I have tried several times to sign up with my email or with either google or Facebook and every attempt failed. It says error sign up failed.

For sure I have never come a such a great, easy, simple, accessible app with imergin zero ads? What a perfect courses? Infact am taking Diploma on Hotel & hospitality management.May God bless you guys.
Started a course and only 30% of the video played. I have tried several times but no luck. Such a shame because I was wanting to do several courses

I had started learning on kyc and aml, but now the application and the website are showing unable to login. I dont know why?? Highly disappointed. I was enjoying learning from this app. Its an embarrasment.
I thought it was free. short course was advertised as free. I finished it and ask me to pay. Useless platform
It's very reliable and the words are not too difficult to understand, the topics are are well being followed..Good explanation for the topics .Good work thanks.
Too much ads then keep disappearing on my notes....but not so bad if they improve....but alison courses are the easiest to understand
The app is really slow and lots of things are happening at the same time. It doesn't even look well Optimized for mobile phones. The user interface is wack too. The website is way better.
Courses are free , easy and understable. but do not provide free certificates as mention in app

Login issues: Visually displays Google login as Google+ (which hasn't existed for years). Facebook interface doesn't behave nicely with external password safes and 2FA generators, requiring you have a second computer to facilitate the login. Plus, the branding of the login makes it appear that the app has access to your 3rd party credentials in an uncomfortable way.

As a visually impaired person who would also love to enroll In these course, its a pity there is no dark mode or zoom effect to enlarge the font. So many websites don't cater for visually impaired people. Would give more star of these features are taken into consideration. The fonts are so smallü§î

Keeps crashing. It was working great for about a week, but no matter what device I use, when I attempt to sign in the app reports "sorry something went wrong." I'm unable to access any of my previous completed courses. Uninstalled for now.

It is a good app but lately when I'm in the last test I put the right answer and it was showing me that was wrong but it tells you in the bottom what would've been the right one and my answers where right it got me frustrated knowing that I was right and telling me that it was a wrong answer. So I just didn't want to continue with the assessment anymore.

It waste my time and is data consuming, I think it should automatically take me to where l stopped at the previous session. Each time I've to locate it myself. Again, when watch on phone, the rotate feature of phone dees not work well with it.

Its very slow and filled with bugs. Takes ages to load a page even after updating. Also there are not alot of options in this app as compared to the orignal website. Besides learning modules are great.
It's an amazing and wonderful app. It makes so easy to access your lessons. Very inspiring and insightful lessons

The App is well structured and easy to use and understand.The offline feature should be worked on. The courses are easy to enroll. This app is perfect for someone who prefers reading a course instead of watching a video. The App is too slow to load and it has too many ads

This application offers a number of courses, some good valuable information but, the certificates are really not worth it, one does not receive them and even when you report that, hence my three stars evaluation. Maybe some other app offers something better.

Why is the videos breaking. Tried watching the video on python programming but it keep breaking all the time and I wanted to recommend the app for my friends that wanted to go into programming and I don't how to do that now. Please try and fix this
It's a great app, but we take this courses hoping that at the end we get a certification only for us to finish and we have to pay...What's a course without it's certificate? What's free then?
Not yet done with the course but, I feel it frustrating when already taken lessons not saved and it keeps on taking you back over and over again.

UI is simplified yet there is no tutorial (trial and error). Charts are very difficult to read on mobile - many charts read like you're learning how many syllables a word contains. It's very jarring! There are also quite a few grammatical errors. There are a broad swath of jobs skills to choose from however they appear random and overly basic with no structure. Adding a goals tab would benefit. Slides, thus far, are technical and offer little in the way of example, especially the "how."

Starting with negatives: 1.you teach past perfect & past perfect continuous, but your quiz q&a confuse the two. 2.It is frequently missing course content it says it has. 3.Your courses don't practice what they preach; ex.major grammar problems within an English course; says it will teach you to be precise&concise but takes 3 paragraphs to say so. 4.Some courses are copies of others. 5.Discovered that one course took their information directly from a textbook (same words, pictures, examples,etc.)
This app is really good and offering great courses but I cut 2 stars because it stuck so much during assessment I have to re do it everytime and still not able to complete.

Easy to use, however, when lesson ends and you opened on full screen, it tends to get stuck. When his happens, I've had to close and reopen, which isn't ideal as it may repeat 2 previous lessons, unless I was making notes/can recall, time is wasted by accidentally listening to lesson previously covered.
Its a good app But if you don't use it for a day or two, it will log you out Now I can't access my account because the password isn't correct And it has refused to send a reset link.
I thought you say it's a free online courses, but for me to get certificate I have to pay... That's your weakness Anyway its a good tutorial‚ù§
It is time you add discussion platform for students. That way someone can have more insight or understanding in the course they've enrolled.
A useful tool for continuous education though it freezes sometimes when the network speed is slow.
Overall its a good app. The ads are somewhat unbearable tho. And it takes time to load videos.

Help please! First off I love this app and I would give 5 stars. But lately all the class videos say to log into your vimeo account and then say I don't have permission to watch them so now I can't take any of the course because I can't watch the lesson videos
The he worst app ever. I paid for a certificate and was debited without allowing me to print. I have been chatting with their customer care but haven't released my cert uptill now.

For now it's three stars, not because it's a bad app but for the fact that it did not allow me to drag the required text in one of my assessments in order for me to continue until I uninstalled and used the web version instead. However I did download it again and hopefully I will not receive the same issues with the new course but overall so far I have passed one course and continuing with more. Great e-learning app for a first time user, I'm happy.

The lessons are clear and easily understandable. But the experience is dissapointing. For instance, there isn't a single course material pdf to be found. So when the instructor says "download the pdf from the course materials and do the exercise; then come back to the video" the automated txt "Bot" tells you it's on the player page. Where is the player page? It does not exist... Not on the app! Or on the site! I wonder if I will get the certificate I pay for?!

App Is quite learning effective and you have just about any course you can think of, however I would appreciate it better if some courses have the text version so while you listen tou can go back to read through or it can be downloaded for study offline especially where data services do not have strong coverage

It uses a lot of data because of the small amounts of info in one click. That's an impediment to learning for us in the poor countries that experience high cost of the internet. How then, can we empower ourselves if we cannot access free resource opportunities like Alison. Perhaps consider further mutually beneficial way over this hurdle. For us who want and need and still have some years in us, while we're still able in mind and body.

Love this app if you love to learn.. some courses you get a certificate other's well you get a diploma..haha . The selection is from art , Tattooing to Pychiatry to caring for loved on.. Free learning! Some you might have a small fee ,but there's grants and scholarships as well. Most useful App! I love it! Thank you.

The quizzes within courses need some work, especially "drop down" answers, which don't drop down at all and instead trigger a separate screen to select an answer via radio button. The problem is the 'previous' and 'next' buttons for the course often overlap the 'save' and 'cancel' buttons for the quiz, preventing you from actually saving your answer. Very irritating, and too many unnecessary steps in the first place. It's a shame because otherwise the app is very good.

The app could be better on mobile. It freezes atimes especially during the final exams and you have to go forth and back to enable you finish it. It is very frustrating when you send in your answers and the app freezes and you have to move on to the next question without knowing what happens to the previous one. All in all, i was able to finish the course at the end of the day.

So far so good, have tried other apps. This is the first one that allowed me to finish the course. The final exam, was a little tricky figuring out how to properly input drop down menu answers. Yet, overall I am satisfied. Enough to purchase my certificate. Will continue, to see if other courses are as good.

Great opportunity o take free Certification courses a d learn new skills. I wish they offered more standardized Certification programs that are compatible to paid college programs. CompTIA A+ Certification is an example of one they offer, but only part of it - maybe offer the full program for $50 upon passing the intro course with 90% or better in the intro course

the instructor and the class itself were good but it's not free when you're charging for the damn certificate at the end of completion. Its not the prize but the deceit. Dude we're trying to make the best of a really bad situation,I have to choose between gas or lunch more often than it should. I understand the amount of hrs that it took to make this incredible, outstanding app,all the people, I get it but it feels like people are making line to get to the front to be told to go back to the end

It's not bad, since I'm only trying this app in a few minutes. Currently seeking for any inconveniences. Update after few tries. Update: some answers for evaluation sometimes different from what we think since it have to be "same" from the module especially written one. Suggest to give more optional answers that synonym the real answer. Like "decrease" with "subtract" since in some sense is similar. At least the course made simple and understandably easy.

I love this app. Infact I went through most of the courses and I found all the courses I want to learn. It's a very educational app good for everyone who is ready to learn. One thing I love about it too is after going through the first module. They will summarize it in a simple way for you to understand. I request you add a degree to it as well Please. 3 stars because it's uses data and you don't have a strong network, you can't study

Thank you Alison for this app. I love it and would recommend it as well. I am not sure if you take these reviews seriously in to consideration. Because i saw a 2021 review that suggested " due to network in their country can courses with an audio also have an option of reading only". We now in end of 2022 and nothing was changed. Some people change the course they are interested in because of the video. Why not have an option of reading or audi???

Very useful app and educative. One issue is that one can't bookmark the last page studied thus causing the app to reload pages everytime its reopened. I wish you could provide a save course pdf so that one doesn't have to reload an entire course to do revision before taking the course assessment. Thank you for the wonderful opportunity to learn more. Thank you.

It is wonderful app I have enjoyed my study .I have gained a lot of practical knowledge which I can use In real life. I strongly recommend it to anyone in search for practical short courses. I have Bachelor of Commerce degree so together with this courses it is a great treasure. They have given much that is, the abundance of courses to choice from.

The app satisfied my expectation. Its a very great platform to acquire new skills. However i'd love the developers to create more video driven courses than text. I observed i'd be more interested in a course where i can learn or run along on vidoe clips than text.

Actually enjoying the app, atleast it is not as stressful as learning from the website. I can leave the application and come back to meet the class exactly where I stopped. I am still finding it hard to know if there is a provision for subtopics and how to differentiate a topic, it's subtopics and little diversions

Best app to develop your skills and knowledge. I love it. My leaning progress has been 6% since I started the course, and I'm almost through with it. No progress. Please fix it because I can't risk starting it again.

Learning on this app/platform is one of the best thing that has ever happened to me...since birth...It has changed my experiences in many form and has also reshaped my life/destiny into many more beautiful folds...thank you Alison...I will be forever grateful to you...üòòü§óüíéüíù.. It happens every time when multiple tabs are opened and pop-up ads.

Alison provides a 'taste' of the course material so you can decide whether it is worth your time and money. Don't make the mistake of believing this app replaces paid tuition. There's a vast amount of courses to choose from, you can search by categories, or keywords. Courses selection is taken from a variety of degree options, including (but not limited to) certification and diploma. Highly recommend for prospective students who aren't sure about their career choice(s).

Great classes. Most are very short and to the point. They are free unless you want/need a diploma or completion certificate. Most of the completion classes are about 1.5 hours and diploma classes start at about 10 hours. Good information if you just want to increase your knowledge of certain areas. I have taken about 20 different classes just to learn a little about everything. Also if your test questions do not load correctly, this app was designed for desktop/laptop applications not mobile.

I have enjoyed learning about art and I want to keep learning. The infomation given on abstract art is fascinating and also a fine hobby of mine. I really enjoy being taught how to strategically apply new resources to my abstract art. New ways to better understand my abilities in this unique endeavor. I have been blessed learning in abstract art and I enjoy it very much. I look forward learning everything these teachers in these courses on Alison, are teaching every individual student.

Great course well laid out. Easy to learn and nice you you can take notes in the app and save and email to yourself later with the heading of the topic for easy review. It's nice also that you can retake the test multiple times if needed but not the same questions appear every time to ensure you learn. Great system free learning and if you ever need the skill for work pay a little fee and you get certificate or diploma really nice.

So far I love it. I spent hours searching for some type of free online learning that is legit and this is the only thing that came up. It is easy to navigate and even my 14 year old likes it. It has many options and I love that I can do it on my phone from anywhere. I haven't had any issues since downloading it nor an abundance of ads that cause annoying interferences.

I have severe ADHD so it's extremely difficult to focus on anything for an extended time period but Alison has helped me tremendously by keeping the learning modules short and sweet. I'm well on my way to being certified in several different areas which is one step closer to being able to help provide for myself and my children. So thank you!

the free courses are thorough &much more extensive than expected, covering a broad range of topics &delivering useful information on a number of subjects. many free courses are skimpy, but Alison's free courses actually deliver! would highly recommend using Alison for whatever it is you would like to learn; it is an invaluable resource

This is a unique opportunity to learn new skills at the comfort of your home or office or even while on the go. I love the app very much and it's very user friendly. The only BUT is that the demonstration is a bit too fast. The computer cursor moves so fast that one hardly know where it clicks for action. But it doesn't hinder learning at all. I highly recommend this app; what you are looking for is right here.

It is a great opportunity for me to learn using the Alison application and web. Very unique and user friendly interface with less consumption of data when synchronising video. The video and courses are concised with relevant information and educative, I sincerely want to say thank you to the C.E.O and designer of the application and web for giving opportunity to those with less privileged to acquire quality education. Please other means of payment should be made available in the application.

Brilliant, thank you so much for your excellent service... I bought a Tattoo kit online and just couldn't get it working properly and I found this course and am so grateful. I have learnt a lot from the online course already so I will definitely recommend it to anyone else who is interested in taking up a course...

I absolutely love Alison coursework!!! The program is an excellent for a resume building and job and career growth. The courses a tailored to many fields of study and are perfect refreshers to give insight for many fields of study. I highly recommend this this program as an on going aid to use where you can set your own time schedule. üåû

I've had an amazing experience with this app learning C++ has been great. Although something that bugged me a little was when they pick personalised courses for you. It would be nicer if u didn't need to pick to many different options especially if you just want to focus on one thing. I just wanted to do C++ but beacuase I had to be so many different things it's recommended me things I'm not interested in.

It has been a wonderful experience. The courses are short and explicit. The content is quite detailed & pinpointing. I found it enriching & easy to combine with regular work, the study is not laborious. It's great.

These is one of the best information and training app I have ever used, it is standard and direct.. I recommend it to everybody and wanting to improve on his or her ability and confidence level.. the course are well presented and summarised in its simpliest form, making learning interesting.... thanks to the Alison team, you guys are great...

I like the app Making knowledge free and accessible and it's easy to use. My only problem though is I have login issues everytime, it's always saying an error occured. It works eventually after multiple trials or probably when I try again the next day.
Fantastic app learning new things every day
best educational tool out there app wise.

Very helpful and easy to use, plus a great selection of courses
You guys u r the best keep it upp

This app is very good and easy to use

I'm basically preaching what others have said with the content being good, but the app is pointless esp if casting it to the screen. There's no functionality to fast forward, change the speed, and lectures will skip around. It's incredibly frustrating! The PC is the only experience where it's good.

Offline mode is awful and deceiving and will work for the first few videos without incident, so you're happy and you think you don't need to stop driving. Now you're half an hour out of town and the app stops playing videos completely even when closing and rebooting. If your phone manages to connect to the crappiest cell signal that can't even load MMS, Udemy will stop loading offline videos and will try to phone home and fail, resulting in infinity loading. Absolutely frustrating.

This app is still hot garbage. Udemy works just fine on a PC, but heaven forbid you try to run a lecture on Chromecast. You might get the first one to load fine, but then it goes to auto play, starts loading the next lecture and then randomly skips to the next one. If you try to click on the right one, it skips over that one and goes back to the one prior. This has been an issue with the app since at least 2020. Hot. Garbage.

Rediculously usless app!!! This app has a hard time loading lectures despite downloading it on your phone. Even when they loads, it randomly goes to the next video. Super annoying !!! I have to completely exit out of the app and restart for it to play any video. There needs to be an audio only function if you are just listening to the lecture and dont need the video. Some lectures are basically all talk that could have been an audio book. Honestly, why even bothered making this app.

This is a nearly pointless app. You can already browse and view courses in a web browser, and app doesn't improve this in any way. You can zoom in with a browser, but NOT with the app. The app crams a lot of functionality into the interface, and it can be confusing to use. I somehow triggered a download of a video, but then I could not stop the download. It's good to have if you want to download a lesson, but otherwise you're better off in a browser.

The app has an incredibly hard time playing video lectures, of which the majority of courses on udemy are comprised of. I try to download the lectures, which the app supposedly has an option to do. If you try and download multiple lectures instead of downloading them in order it will download them at random, and will frequently get stuck on downloads requiring multiple restarts and redownload attempts. It will say a video is downloaded, but when you try and play the video will not be there.

The app function is horrible when playing videos from my tablet or my phone. I am either unable to interact due to a black screen or the video will get stuck loading. The only way I have found to fix this is by uninstalling the app and reinstalling it. Then I am able to take video courses for a little while, until it misbehaves again. Frequently l must uninstall and reinstall 4 times a DAY. So frustrating. PC function does not have this issue.

The service is great. The app is buggy and it's been like this for at least two years. I'll change my feedback as soon as the issue is fixed. Like many, many people mentioned in other reviews, the app has a difficultly remembering what video you're watching. It keeps skipping videos, goes back a video or two randomly. If you go in that background play, then come back, it will often times starts playing the next video. It's a mess at the moment. Browser versions work perfectly. Never had issues.

Horrible app! What's the point of buying courses if you can't watch them. I'm a software developer so I can see what's going on. They designed the app to blame the internet connection for every error even if the network is flawless and works for other apps. It seems they saved money on development. I have reached out to them for a long time but no helpful responses.

This app needs a ton of work. You can't minimize sections of lessons like you can on the website. Every time you leave the app, it's hit it miss if the lesson plays in the background, and when you go back into the app the video is minimized and when you click to open it, it almost always goes back to a previous lesson.

The people who work on this app REALLY need to take Udemy courses on programming. Anything that interrupts the video will stop it. Trying to play again skips to the next video. Restarting the series page automatically starts a video you've already seen. Play buttons won't work, gotta force close the app. Mini player randomly crashes leading to problems listed above. Playing a udemy video, open the udemy app, video closes and video you already saw starts. Gotta figure out where I left off. Etc..

Edit 2: This app is not usable even on my phone anymore. I can't watch any videos, downloaded or not. I am connected to the internet and YouTube works perfectly. I can't put up with this anymore. Time to start using Coursera again. Edit: I can't see half of my courses on my tablet. Original: Video loading is extremely slow, much worse than YouTube. It's possible to download content, so that's good. But the app is a bit clunky. 3/5 overall.

I've been a user for several years. I love the service: courses are many and inexpensive. The app, however, is a piece of trash not fit to install. It is unresponsive, slow, unwilling to play videos I have downloaded to my phone, and unwilling to save files to the SD card, despite the fact the app allegedly has that ability. I don't know what the people at Udemy are doing but it surely isn't fixing this dumpster fire. They should take a few of their programming courses and fix the app.

I can't even experience it. The app doesnt even move out of the log in screen. No matter what I do it just circles. I've learned that I have no patience for apps that you can't even log in to. I guess I'm sticking to accessing through a browser. *response to developer - Thank you, for your quick response. Just like when you unplug the router, or restart a device, I un/reinstalled the app a few times, and triple checked my password...even changing it...to no avail. I will do the next step. üëçüèº

It won't stop. I have to open the app on my phone and click "force stop" to make the videos stop running. It's obnoxious, and I'm reluctant to open my Udemy course because it's going to be a struggle to shut it down. Update after Udemy response: The point of my negative review was that it's hard to stop the video. It just keeps running. When my phone rings or someone tries to talk to me, I have to apologize for the audio playback that won't stop.
Not able to open the app, It's keep on rotating. Plz look into it and resolve the issue asap.
The courses are really good but the app doesn't load this rating is only for the app and not the courses I can't sign in , the page doesn't load, the courses don't load. Please look into this
Video is not playing properly. Time consuming.

This app has difficulties loading lectures even though I've downloaded the lectures to my phone. It is extremely annoying I either have to completely close the app or uninstall and reinstall the app losing all of the downloaded contents in the process. It's helpful for learning . It's not working even I have fill internet
Cannot see course informations in my courses, I need to search for it. The app is not intuitive at all
Cannot login via mobile app, and web version refuses to load any videos. What is this garbage?

My offline progress hardly sync when I go online, it takes me far back to previous lessons I've already covered. Most times the app barely connects to the internet and it's difficult to download new video lessons even with an excellent internet connection. It's really a horrible experience, I've wasted more than 12 hours trying to download new video lessons on my app Totally a 1 star rated app until I see major improvements
Unable to purchase course. I 've been trying for 2 days now. Please fix the issue
Bought a course one month ago and also watched half of video but for a some reason not watched videos for a week and today udemy not showing the course
Crash crash crash , unable to download course for offline access

The content is the content is good, overall. I am very annoyed by the fact that a major tech company intentionally does not allow a user to to sort one's list of saved content content alphabetically. If you have more than a few list categories you waste time scrolling through your list trying to assign an item to your preferred category. I also think that they can make the subscription option available as an option during the checkout process. Overall I have found the content to be very good

The course videos keep jumping ahead and it's super frustrating. I have to keep going to the website to uncheck the lessons which have been arbitrarily marked as complete, even though I have NOT completed them, in order to procede with the proper lesson. This really interrupts my flow and is extremely frustrating. If it didn't do this, I would probably rate it a 4 or 5. I like being able to cast onto my TV to follow along. I'm using a Pixel 6.

The app needs lots of improvement. My biggest issue with this app is the TV casting feature. Afterall, who wants to watch tutorials on a tiny phone screen? The casting feature doesn't support playback speed selection and it constantly skips videos, so you have to close the app and start over for every video. You would think they would at least make the very basics working properly as the bare minimum after all these years.

I love the courses and content, playing videos works great but listening to the lessons on background it doesn't work that great for me. The lessons stop playing all the time, is a shame because I don't have much time to study and I was trying to use the app to learn by listening the lessons while doing something else.

Old: The content is good (if expensive), the app itself is clunky and pushes notices multiple times per day. Have tried to unsubscribe and disappear from its sight. Arduous. Update: was invited to check in and possibly revise review. Couldn't remember app login, asked for new password. No email, I probably got overzealous in turning off the contacts. Suppose I could log in to update my preferences.

I have a bought a couple of courses on udemy which have wonderful content, but when I remember the frustration of using the app (navigation, accessing saved content, sequential video playback), I become hesitant of buying any other course here. These issues have been raised by udemy users for long to this time. I had expected udemy to make needed amends. It's poor the story isn't positive. I'd still hope something be done about this.

App runs fine on phone and tablet, but I just bought a Chromebook for better battery longevity and the ability to edit code on the same machine I'm watching video offline... only to find out that the Udemy app isn't supported on Chrome OS. To be fair, that information is on their support page, but it doesn't help my situation at all having a device that I purchased primarily to use Udemy offline with. Hopefully some day they'll add Chrome OS support to the app.

I installed the app a couple weeks ago to maybe learn a new skill. Since installing the app, every other day or so, Udemy uses to the phone's notification system to spam me about a sale. It's very disruptive and an abuse of the notification system. Rather than go through the settings and see if I can shut it off, it's much easier to just uninstall.

The desktop content is pretty great. However, the app simply does not work on mobile devices. I can't log in, even after trying multiple work arounds. I just receive a notification that the user name or password are incorrect. They're not. It's a bummer, because I'm often on the go and would love to be able to bring the courses with me. Without that option, it's more or less just another wasted potential opportunity.

The actual service udemy provides is great. It's a good way to learn new skills from insightful people, for a very affordable price. That said, the app is garbage. Yes, the videos take forever to load and don't play well, just like other reviewers have commented. But what's worse is that the app is incredibly difficult to navigate, classes are difficult to search for, and there are multiple courses which I have purchased that just don't appear at all on the mobile version.

I like how you can download lectures or whole courses easily to either the SD card or internal memory. Changing the play speed is a great feature - I use it all the time. As my number of courses increases, it's getting harder to manage them. There's simply no way to organize or group courses effectively. This is getting so frustrating, I'm having to drop a star. Also, the app has difficulty playing consistently when my screen turns off or I move between apps.

It seems as though I have to start my new courses on the desktop site because I get a blank screen when trying to do so from the app. Also not the biggest fan of how accessing resources works, especially considering some of em just don't even come up. The app is really only good for watching videos and keeping track of progress. The rest of the features leave much to be desired.

The course material is okay and the web site works well. However i have had problems with the mobile app. I have experienced freezes and crashes when watching videos on my phone. Also the video list for my current course takes a long time to load. This course does have a very large number of videos and that could be what is affecting the so performance... but if an app can't do it job without crashing, it is a bad app. Also the Udemy app users notifications in Android for frequent advertisements

If there was one word I would use to discribe this app, it would be "slow". Slow to pull up, slow to buffer videos (even when they are downloaded). After particularly slow moments, the app tends to crash, telling me that it's much more heavy weight than it needs to be. I can't cast the videos to anything, so no learning on TV. If udemy didn't have such good content, I'd give the app 1 star. I would expect a much better app from a company that has so many programming teachers and students.

Content depends on quality of course. Choose wisely. App is a bit of a mess. Try to connect on weak internet? App won't open. You can download the videos, but if you try to open them while connected to slow internet, they won't open. Not clear if it's actually trying to stream, or just slow. If you have unlimited high speed data this wouldn't be much of an issue though.

No purchasing power!!! The app only allows you to pay through google pay????? We should have all the options to pay on the app. I now have to use my laptop to make purchases. So the app is basically no use.
Lots of issues with video buffering. I can't barely stream videos
The app doesn't work well for Chromecast. Everything is messy.
Kindly please develope a fire stick application. So user can learn and visit the courses from fire tv to.

This app is frustrating to use. My biggest complaints: 1. no search feature like the website has, 2. does not mark downloaded videos as completed after coming back online, 3. no option to disable auto-play when you open a course, 4. does not always sync current video to sidebar so a lot of scrolling is required.

very bad ui. is designed to just buy courses. you can't use your courses properly, in a course with more than 300 videos it will always start from the 1st video and you can't go to another video quickly, as you can't collapse the modules. you don't have the transcript window either

Very bad user experience. I recommend Udemy to watch a few courses on its platform for mobile app development and rebuild this app. The courses on Udemy are very good but the mobile app experience is the worst. Sometimes when I open the app it hangs and keeps loading. Even if I have downloaded some lectures they won't play it keeps loading (Why loading when they are downloaded on the device for offline viewing?).

Feel fraudulent about pricing. The price in app and site with same user id is totally differ.... The same is completely low when using new user id. Feel irritate. I bought one course for 449 in my app the same day same course my friend bought 325 rupees.

This app doesn't play videos on my phone, doesn't load content and I have reinstalled it like a thousand times, it's incredible how you teach people how to code yet your own very code is terribly failing.

The courses I purchased are good, but the app is quite buggy. When casting from my phone to my tv it is all over the place. The videos start at random places in the timeline when casting with very clunky controls to get back to where I need to be. When not casting, everything works ok.
Works well in browser, but hangs a lot while using the app!
Like every other Google product, Udemy is also getting worse and deteriorating. Numerous issues, some reported long ago but never resolved.
always crashing and buffering
They should upgrade their backend infra. Videos just won't play consistently. Worst kind of frustrating experience.
Rated from 5 stars to 2 stars. Not working from days , automatically network goes it seems and automatically just buffer and buffer . I can't opem the app now .

This use to be a really good app for PC/laptop. But I am finding now, that I have to close the app and reopen it in order to move forward with lessons. With in the past 30-40 minutes I have had to close the app down twice and restart. No fun. Please can we fix the bugs with the app so the flow of the lesson doesn't get interupted. In respond to developers: ok makes sense why the app would be buggy on the computer side when using it. I'll just stick with brower when it comes to the computer.

On phone app is fine, nothing amazing. It theoretically has Chromecast capabilities but they work horribly. About half the time you'll get audio and no video. It doesn't auto play. And you have to tell it to turn captions on every time if you want to see them for every individual video.

The service itself is great, but the app is buggy in ways I wouldn't expect from such a respected commercial company. The splash you get at the start never goes away so you scroll thru but the splash remains, making it difficult to navigate. The courses don't pick up quite right, often bringing you back a video or two. It doesn't jump to your current slide so in large courses you have to scroll far to recalibrate. I give it 3 stars because it does display my courses, but it's a generous 3.

I love the concept, and I love the classes, but the actual app often frustrating. Almost every time I pause and restart a video, or close the app and come back, it starts to play the wrong video, skipping to the next one instead of where I left off. I also wish the list of lessons within a class skipped to your current place when you open it, so that every time it started to play said wrong video I didn't have to scroll down through hundreds of lines of text to find my current place.

overall, the platform is a good experience, but the app is really buggy for me. lots of hangs where I can't restart lectures until I force stop the app even after clearing cache and user data. I'd like more features for jumping back to current lectures and things like that. end up doing a lot of scrolling trying to find the correct lecture in the series

I dislike autoplay feature. I just pop into a course to read some quick info and it starts playing, causing me to jump out of my skin. Now, I have normal autoplay off in the settings but it seems it has nothing to do with standard app function. I should be able to shut this off vs turning down my volume before entering a course so that I dont give myself a heart attack.

They fixed it so it doesn't crash & freeze anymore. What I wish for are some refinements. Make the sample videos play like a playlist as on computer. To see all the samples all the sections have to be opened manually to see the samples then each has to be played separately. Would be nice to have an expand all sections option. I no longer buy off my phone for this reason. Also, regarding computer version, please make 360p videos available for download like on phone. I travel with my laptop.

Hit or miss, great when it works, useless otherwise. You can download courses for offline use, listen at various speeds, play in the background while you use other apps or just have your phone locked, but it crashes randomly and becomes unusable. Also if you download a course and have this problem, then the app seems to forget you've downloaded anything and it will not be available for offline use. So you basically have to download possibly 20gigs more than once

Overall, I'm a fan of this app. I love being able to watch courses on my phone or cast them to my TV and it has many of the features that I liked with the browser version. But it still needs some work. The autoplay is random at best. Sometimes it will play several in a row and then suddenly need me to click on the lesson to load it. Other times it doesn't autoplay at all. Worst is when it decides to start an episode several minutes in and I have to go in and fix it. A decent app but not perfect.

A very good platform to learn new things, I passed my Comptia exams with the Total Seminar courses. I highly recommend Udemy.  My issue is with the app itself and the ads that pop up. There's nothing more annoying than a pop-up ad in the middle of a lecture of a course I paid for.    This seems to only happen on the App, I would recommend that anyone using it just download the lessons and play them in Airplane mode or just access them through a browser.

Udemy is an excellent service and company that I am very grateful for (5/5). However, the app itself is insanely buggy. It's trash. Simply getting to the list of lessons in the course requires me to go back to the home screen and select the course all over again, which just ends up bringing up the video that's already playing. Then my video player will get locked in full screen mode. I literally have to close the app and reopen JUST to select a different video in the SAME course. So stupid.

seriously guys there are a lot to improve in the app. 1. with the cast connection to a smart-tv it doesn't start a new lecture in order instead it repeats the same lecture. 2. why do I have to navigate to control the video and navigate again to search another video? it should be all of it locate easily from menus in the video. 3. I would like to control the speed of the video, some guys speak really slow and it's annoying to follow a complete lecture. 4. I'll continue exploring the app...

Good format but odd bugs tend to ruin the user experience. When I watch lectures through the app, they tend to start halfway through the video. Other times, it can't play the video at all and then will move onto the next video, and keep cycling through videos it can't play. This screws up the ordering of the lectures and what is marked as complete.

I've had this app since Nov/Dec 2018 and it's been working fine. then suddenly, within the last couple of weeks, I can't watch anything! It keep telling me there no internet connection no matter what WiFi I'm on. it will only run when the wifi is completely turned off. so frustrating as i don't want use all my data when i should be able to use my wifi.

I love the platform, and have purchased many courses.  HOWEVER the Android application has been working TERRIBLY. The application freezing constantly, sometimes even crashing and going unresponsive. For the Dev Team: My devices are Samsung Galaxy S7 edge, with all the latest updates, and a Galaxy Tab A 10.1" also with the latest updates. Both devices are experiencing these problems.

Good content but there are SO MANY THINGS WRONG with the app. Hogs 20gb on internal.can't download practice exam courses. Nice
[bug]When opening a resource document inbetween the lectures, it autoplays the next lecture while we are still at the document resource page

dinged a star because I downloaded a course offline so I can focus off the Internet. Turns out you can't really take a course off the grid because things like quizzes don't work. tells me the feature might have been implemented to save data - but in my case, I'm trying to save my sanity by not being distracted when taking courses :-)

Would be nice if it included a certification test extensions for the developers, so they can easily whip up "multiple choice", drag/drop, or other typical test items. I'm not a dev and I'm seeing people make great quiz content but having to work around not having these features and it would be great if they had better quiz features I think.

The app has a flaw, which is that if you pause a course, or if you leave the app temporarily and come back, it starts on the NEXT lesson instead of continuing with the one you are on. I'd love for the team to fix this, and if so I'm happy to update to 5 stars. Finding courses and buying them and going through them has gone well so far. Love all the great content available for purchase at reasonable rates.

Excellent interface, videos work well, and all around good e perience. The only reason I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that I have to jump to a PC to review course documents or to take quizzes. I understand that, depending on the topic, some content requires a PC, but I think I should be able to read notes/documents and take quizzes on my phone.

I like the Udemy app. I can be improved by moving the video control buttons from the middle of the screen to the bottom when I place the course video in pause. This would allow me to read the content and complete practice questions given by instructors. Additionally, when the screen is paused it gets darker and then returns normal when the I play the course again. Overall, I'm pleased and wanted to give a rating of 5 stars.

Great way to learn concepts and products for an affordable price, especially individual subjects. App has an issue where on auto-play, sometimes it will default to a different position of the next video. For example, if i start video #1 at 4:30 but havent watched the next video, when the auto play skips to vdeo #2, it will start at 4:30 even though I've never watched it before. Takes a minute to skip back to the beginning but can be a little annoying if casting and phone's in a different room

Overall, I've had a pretty good experience using Udemy. It's straightforward, has a pleasant user interface, and there's a plethora of subjects to learn about, for the curious mind. There is one issue I have with Udemy, and it relates to the video playback functionality. I'm not sure who else is having this issue, but whenever I enter full screen and let a video play until the next video starts, the next video endlessly buffers and never plays until I exit full screen, after which it resumes.

I really enjoy Udemy as a platform, it came quite out of nowhere when I was looking for art tutorials, and it's method of paying for what you use instead of a monthly subscription that we all seem the be used too at this point seemed almost to good to be true. Especially at the prices most the courses are, but after going through several I can say with confidence that there is some valuable stuff on here. I only give it 4 starts because the app can use some quality of life improvements.

The app is great; easy to use, can sign in with google, different options for video playback and the sales get sent when they happen. Can listen on phone when driving. The only issue I notice is that it doesn't play in the back ground when you're not in the app for very long. If I could listen to the courses in the background longer that would change my rating to a 5 star. Overall great app.

The app overall runs great no crashes or video failures that I've noticed so far. My only concern is that for my classes when trying to submit an assignment under the Q&A section, basically an image to be exact, it doesnt give me the option to upload anything. When I go to the website on my computer I see the option but not in the app and I follow the same steps. I'm unsure if this is a glitch or not correct me if i'm wrong, aside from that the app is wonderful & I still reccomend it.

It's a great App and it works every well. It's very similar to using the web version. The one problem that I have is, when I receive a message from and instructor, I doesn't show up on the app (there's not option to even look for messages), I would have to go back to web versions to read it and reply back. I knew I would have gotten a message was due to an email notification, I don't know if this Is just my App or just the app.

Overall very good app. the quality of the courses varies, but if you catch a sale you can get some very good deals. I love the ability to speed up video play. There is a small bug where sometimes I shut off the program and it starts playing again in the background. It could be trying to play through my car speakers??

Update 01/29/2020: This app is still plagued with playback issues. I've had to completely reset the app because it just fails to play anything halfway through the videos. When I cleared data and cache, the videos are out of sync with the audio, causing the audio to cut out midway through a talking point towards the end of the lecture. Old review: Great until latest update. My downloaded courses don't play properly and usually jump me halfway through videos or just skip entire sections.

This app is really great and I LOVE udemy just for the service it offers and the high quality of a lot of their courses. The only reason this isn't getting 5 stars is due to minor, convenience issues within the app, such as not having a built in notepad to take lecture notes, or a way for educators to make their lectures interactive with in-app, work-along course materials, etc. There are several apps available that are quite similar to udemy but this one is definitely the best in class so far.

Love the content. The prices are a little gimmicky, but hey, gotta make money somehow right? Most of the information is solid but you really have to research the instructors because (I feel) the vetting process isn't deep enough. It's on you as a student to ensure the quality of your course. Interface of the app and desktop site is solid, but the mobile site could use some work. Overall usability and accessibility on the user-end is good.

Oh, and you can wait until they put your course of choice on sale and get it up to 85% off!

So far, so awesome! Just started my first course. Life coaching, no real direction in mind to use this practically, just wanted to know more about the subject. Great layout and lots of information. I'd say it pays to do side research on the instructors prior to purchase, as I did see some "quacks". Be smart and think about the content before just jumping into a course.

I like udemy, I think it is a good place to learn stuff. I am learning trigonometry and my course is going well so far. As for the the app it is smooth, well tuned, and very ergonomic in my opinion. For instance if you want to pause a video to work a problem out, the pause button doesn't stay in the middle of the video blocking your view like it does in youtube. You can also play your course videos while the app is closed which is just simply wonderful.

Probably my favorite learning app so far, I've completed 2 different courses and honestly I wish I would have found Udemy earlier. One of the things I like is the fact that I'm not hit with ads like most learning apps, it's straight to the content. One other awesome feature is that I can start watching a lecture on PC then go out and resume from where I left off on my phone. That may seem small but when when you have a class full of lectures, it's a must have feature. There are also free classes

Amazing app. So far the app seems to work perfectly fine for me. Courses are available for cheap but the quality is good (although I do recommend reading the reviews of the specific courses you're looking into because I have heard that some instructors aren't as good as others). The courses I bought include several bite-sized instructional videos so I can view them anytime, anywhere. Perfect for when you need a refresher on the go!

I loved the app - before I hit upgrade. Now when I open a class it goes straight to the video of the class. Before, I could look at the curriculum and download a few lectures at a time for when I'm not online. It's made it hard to pick and choose some lectures that I want to watch again. Upon further review and redownloading the app- all is good. I do love Udemy. The variety of courses is great and I'm happy to give 5 Stars!

This class is upbeat and fun. Every detail is covered and the class segments are short to allow time to understand and try out the concepts. I am advancing from cell phone pictures to camera. The first couple of classes and also jumping in the middle to the "camera anatomy" section has really given me a clearer understanding of how things work. The ease in which the information is offered has removed my fears of photography as being too complicated to try.

I love how you do me makes information and learning very accessible to anyone and even more it's very affordable. I've had really great courses and I've had okay courses. It's really good to review the reviews but most importantly I would encourage people to look at the question and answers to pay attention how the course instructor responds to questions.

The videos play fine and the quizzes also work well. Exercises are a little harder; if you're using a mobile device you need other apps. So I watch the videos and just note the exercises I need to do on my computer later. So far the information taught is accurate, understandable, and relevant to the course I'm taking.

Udemy Platform is amazing!! I bought so many courses and learn so much from them. I would suggest improvements on app stability. When many courses are downloaded, the app crashes more often. Also sometimes, the course videos are slow to load even in PC web browser even though I have 1 Gigabit connection. Some of the fastest you can get in 2020

Edit: Changed my rating after fixing a bug listed below. Thank you! The udemy app lets me watch course videos, download course videos for offline viewing, play videos in the background (listen to course videos without unlocking my device), cast course videos to my screen, and buy new courses. Edit: This bug listed below was fixed after the first review (thank you): The course progression doesn't save very well. This causes confusion when I return to courses.

The course I am taken is great. I can pick up were i left off easily. If I don't understand I can back up and view again. I go at my pace. Extremely adorable courses. Once I complete the course I will more than likely find another interesting one. I recommend taken a course in the subject you are interested in prior to going to a school to get an idea and ahead in the subject. You may find that you want to continue to pursue or find its not really your cup of tea.

Old dogs can learn new things! I love this app, take any number of new courses. Some instructors are fabulous teachers! My suggestion; download the app, take one of the many free courses offered. If you hate it, delete it! If you LOVE IT! Pay and download your course! Youll be certified in many fields at the end of some courses. Try it!!! What do you have to lose?

I've been using udemy for a while in the browser but have only just downloaded the app. I prefer the browser because I get a larger screen. The app is fine if you're stuck on your phone without your laptop, and that's the only time I use the app. The app works fine, no bugs for me, saves my progress in my courses, etc.

love the app. love being able to take my lessons from the computer into the kitchen while making dinner. it saves the progress and I can hop right back into the same spot on the computer again. the knowledge base, course selection, all top notch and I've learned a lot and plan on learning more. the sales are very frequent as well!

One simple feature would make it 5 stars. Allow me to put videos on an sd card. I can't believe that this isn't a feature already; that's a standard thing. Almost all of my apps already support that. I was astounded when I found out that this app doesn't support putting downloads onto mounted sd cards. This will stay 1 star until this is added, because otherwise I'll just watch on my computer and save battery power and data.

Update removed scratchpad! We use this regularly in our house, but we are all used to being able to make notes or write out problems in the Khan scratchpad. It was essential. We have had to break out notebooks because the latest update removed the ability to use the scratchpad in a math problem. The button is no longer there. I didn't see removing this feature in the release notes either. Very disappointing.

A wonderful foundation. But the app have problems: I've downloaded items of bookmarks and still not shown while I'm offline, the app is really slow even if I'm online or offline, sometimes it closes by itself, when i try to scroll on algebra (all sections) it lags and glitches a lot preventing me to enter a specific part of lessons. I've used this app 10 months ago, but i didn't have so much problems like now. I hope you fix these problem ASAP. 5 stars for the academy. 0 stars for the app.

Would really like to give it more stars but it won't even open on my android phone. I've tried uninstalling it and reinstalling it several times and it's still crashing before it even opens. I hope you guys can roll out some bug fixes on the next update, but I'm not even able to use it so I'm uninstalling it for now. I'm still able to use khan academy through the browser on my computer. But it would be nice to have it available on my phone. Update: still doesn't work. :(

I had this app eons ago and it worked. The system is horrendous. After you've reached 'proficient' on all topics you have to take the unit test to level up. Also, if you get one wrong towards the beginning there is not option to restart, you just have to do the whole thing knowing there is no point. (Also i am required to get all the mastery points for school)

Downloaded so my son could do something educational while waited for things. Got to a question where it seemed like the answer was 10=5 x2, but the keyboard wouldn't let us enter an equal sign. So dumb!

I hate this app with a burning passion and I hope it stops being used. Sorry not sorry.

such a poorly optimized app. you will be typing on a page by page keyboard that dosent have options for functions such as secant, atleast when i was doing derivative practice. then you see that greater than, less than has more priority taking up a good chunk of the 2nd page and realize youre better off actually playing for a service that wont make you want to eat your own hair (or probably just use the desktop version sadly)

The app does not work on chromebook most of the time, which is of course a problem. However, I have just logged into my acount online, and I must say, Khan Academy is amazing! It has content on about everything and many practice problems for math. It's really easy to use, the lessons are short and easy to understand, the teacher is good at explaining the concepts. The main problems is that once you've watched a lesson 90% of the time it doesn't check that you finished it, and there's no way to manually check that you finished it, so it can be easy to loose track. The other problem is that the app struggles to even work, it wont work out of wifi, and it sometimes won't run the tests even on wifi. Otherwise it would be 5 stars

For people with OCD or for perfectionists, this app is very frustrating. Unit tests should not make your score go down in previous topics. It's bothersome to do the work all over again for a tiny mistake. It would be better if you did corrections to your answer and recieve half credit as you would do in school. Just a tip to be more inclusive to people who struggle with these things ü§ó. Otherwise, great app. Learning is fairly easy and there's no homework so it's a win!

I like it, especially if helping me relearn math I forgot. Unfortunately, it's extremely buggy and actually makes me really angry to have to deal with it so often. Sometimes when I leave a math exercise and come back later, none of the exercises load for the longest time. This wasn't a problem when I started using this app back in October, what the hell did you guys do to it? Also, can't use a hint during a quiz or unit test without it crashing. Please fix these issues because it's really difficult and frustrating to deal with.

The program is fantastic and the lessons are fun, easy to follow, and very informative. I've learned a lot; however, the app leaves something to be desired. The answer box is too small and impossible to scroll, after a certain length, making checking your answer, and even answering, difficult. Please extend the answer box and make it more intuitive!

Love the website, but the app has bugs. I have no problem with videos loading, but when I try to do a quiz, unit test, or course challenge, I usually get the "error making task progess" message about 10-30 times before it finally loads.Yes, I've uninstalled and reinstalled the app, it didn't help. Also, I've noticed that when there's a mistake in a video, a correction will pop up on the website videos, but the correction message doesn't pop up on the app videos.

So, as a 13 year old (about to go to highschool) I have used this frequently in my school, as well as my friends and teachers. Teachers love it because we learn, but the students don't really enjoy it (myself included) but, if you do want people to enjoy it more, make learning fun, like prodigy, or other learning games, maybe have a game show, where you need to multiply fast to beat the computer or your friend. It is really a great platform but it is still by far better to study in a computer browser than in app. There are a lot of functionalities that is missing in the app such as the profile view, easier navigation/searching of courses, etc. Just like what others wanted, it would be better if you could add the discussion feature. It is a really a huge help in learning since the author (or other knowledgeable) people could elaborate more on the topics. Hoping these features would be added someday.

the content is so good, but the content navigation is so confusing, too many categories, too many different ways to study the same content. there should be a simplified way of ordering the content, I remember back in 2013 when the math content was so straight forward, now it is such a convoluted, humongous, overwhelming, neverending path that it becomes hard to bare, and I find myself discouraged to even attempt to resume my learning

Great for students, not for teachers -- no way to make or check assignments. Would love to see more of the website functionality so I could assign topics to my classes and check student scores. It's a very great app, but the Browser version offers more than it. (Please add in-app practice for Tests like the SAT, it can't be that hard.) Other than that, it functions well and is a great tool for students.

I was so excited to find this app. I've always wanted to learn about a lot of different subjects and now I can/am! Some of the ancient history time line is a little off, it's based around the Christianity/religious timeline. (Which I thought was super lame.) I was super impressed with how much education app has to offer. It's not all just boring, having to read 50 pages in order to finish one section of a section. You go by your own pace of course. Highly recommend.

Excellent easy to follow and understand. I've been out of school for 30 years and needed to relearn/refresh my memory to help my middle school son and this worked wonders. I was an expert in literally 20 minutes after 5 videos. Took a 4 question quiz after and got a perfect score.

It's great. I am using it to brush up on Grammer for my field of work but I found much more. Upon exploration, I found useful learning concepts for both my children and myself in mathematics, history, science, arts and humanities. After going through a few videos, I see that they focus on multiple learning styles. Each video has traits of visual, read/wright, and auditory. After the video, they provide quizzes for hands on. It's an amazing resource for anyone wanting to learn.

For the platform itself, 11/10. The fact that such an amazing website exists that is completely free with no subscription ever, is absolutely incredible. For the app, I find it somewhat difficult to find and access profile settings but that's probably on me, and I kind of prefer the previous app layout. I love being able to learn subjects I would otherwise never have access to, and I would love to see language courses incorporated eventually! Great job all around. Have been using for years!

This is a great educational app! I do three of my school subjects on this, and it makes learning easy. They have great informational videos, and quizzes to apply what you've learned. I also think the app layout is great as well. The ability to pin courses is really nice. One thing I wish they would have kept was the jump to the "up next for you" lesson/task button that would allow me to get to my course material faster without having to scroll through all of it. Regardless, still a great app!

Great app of course, this is free education so I can't complain about that. The computer version is much better and easier to navigate however. I have a lot of difficulty entering answers into the quiz on the mobile version for Algebra. So I find myself redoing problems to try and get a better score. So if you have access to a computer I think you'd get more out of the course but nonetheless this is a good app overall.

This app has helped me quite a bit. I feel like I can stay on track and have a free tutor outside of my college classes and refresh what I forgot in highschool. The English and grammar lessons are easy to remember and well built, and although the math lectures can be slow, they make it easy to understand the material and focus on harder concepts one at a time. You can work on the go without having to have a computer standing by, or at a PC at home. Perfect for my needs!

Tried deleting and reinstalling. I'm on an up to date Samsung Galaxy s8 plus. Tried restarting my phone. Still doesn't work. The website works fine, I know I like that. Update: Contacted the help desk. In less than 24 hours, they looked into it and made an update. It works perfectly now. Prompt attention and correction to the problem.

Very convenient for math (or any subject) on concepts you have trouble with, but I do wish that I could work out problems without having the need to physically write things down (I just solve problems in my head). If you could add a notes tab on quizzes (where you can tap/slide from the side of your screen to bring it over if you want to use it to type notes down, and to tap/slide it back to to the side of the screen to consume less screen space), this app would be even better :D

So easy to navigate and the courses offered seem endless! The structure of the courses I've started is very similar to the college courses I've taken and I can do them at my own pace! The political science class I'm taking right now is debatably better than the calsses I took at the University! The instructor does a great job at simplifying and expanding in areas that seem confusing.

I absolutely recommend this app. I had teachers before that couldn't explain things well and I always stayed up studying with Khan Academy. They're very through with subjects and give the best demonstrations on how to do things. it's awesome for both visual and auditory learners. It also has a lot of languages and a very neat and organized setting. You can just download this app, search up what you need and you're good to go! I have definitely aced a few test thanks to Khan Academy. Bless Y'all.

Love the app, no complaints whatsoever. I do have a suggestion though. The youtube app has a pop out video feature that allows the users to browse other apps or parts of their phone while the video/audio still plays. Would it be possible for the Khan Team to program a feature like this into the app? I think it would greatly enhance the user experience for the app. Thank you for your time!

This app is phenomenal! They have a wide variety of subjects, teachers who are truly enthusiastic about the subject they teach as well as encouraging, practice quizzes, tests, and a clear outline of what to expect in each course. Some subjects I study to learn; others I study to brush up on and the structure of Khan Academy allows me to do both easily. I have downloaded many educational apps over the years and this is by far the best. I HIGHLY recommend!

Absolutely brilliant! I've been struggling in math, and find this app to be extremely helpful; everything is explained in a way that I can actually understand. The content itself is great! However, the app takes forever to load videos and is pretty unresponsive. It seems it's just stitching web views together to show what would be shown in a browser anyways. Just try to look for the youtube playlist/videos for the course you're interested in, it's a much smoother experience.

The EdX app remains less than user-friendly and some bugs persist. Course progress is not intuitive on an individual course's menu. Lessons completed are not differentiated from those yet to complete (such as with checkmarks on the Coursera app). All courses, both completed and in-progress, appear on a single courses tab. This is cluttered if you've taken several. Also, course progress isn't always captured when lectures are viewed on the app; I frequently have to redo them on the desktop site.

Good concept, poorly executed. A lot of the courses are presented as powerpoint presentations, this would be alright if each 3-5 sentence slide didn't take nearly 10s to load. Every few slides there is usually a short video which has about a 20% chance of playing, otherwise you can read the transcript which tends to be loaded with grammatical errors(a lot of the text slides weren't much better and I think this program would benefit greatly from having course submissions reviewed by a pro writer)

Great courses. Unfortunately, that's not much help. I'm currently running off a slow mobile internet plan, and had been hoping to run though some of the interesting courses edx has to offer. Unfortunately, the fact that you can't adjust video resolution/quality means non-infuriating realtime playback is impossible. This wouldn't be a problem if mobile downloads worked. Unfortunately, any attempt to download just queues the file, never completing it. In this state, the app is simply unusable.

Great for lifelong learning and continuing education in any field! edX is one of my top 3 fav courseware apps for learning something new, especially from scratch. edX courses are also great for keeping your existing knowledge and skills up-to-date with the best instructors from some of the best institutions in the world. There are orientation courses for people completely new to online learning, and you can even create your own personalized learning path based on your own interests and goals.

Great interface! Negative: 1) Drag and drop feature is not always easily manipulative when using a smaller screen [phone] but ok on larger [tablet]. 2) The Notes feature is not intuitive or easy to use. However, I have not reviewed any tool usage training as of yet, so it may be covered there. Positive: I absolutely love everything else! Supremely easy to use and very easy to provide feedback on content of training and research previously entered discussion topics. I especially appreciate being able to have written [cc] dialogue that I can review and specifically go back to through selection of the text when video is used. In other eords, I don't have to go try and remember video time stamps! I look forward to utilizing this tool for additional topics outside of my current focus.

Everything you want in online learning. The app is always stable and has an incredible variety of subjects. You'll find offerings from top universities and software developers. You can take most classes for free and at your own pace but the option to get a verified certificate of completion is great for career development opportunities.

I'm currently taking a CS course on here and nothing so far in the app has distracted me from fully absorbing the information in the course. This type of learning is pretty much meant to be for both desktop and mobile, not for a purely mobile experience, but it has been useful when I want to watch lectures away from my computer.

Just used the app to enroll and begin my first course provided by edx. And just WOW! After perusing the course info, watching the welcome video and taking the pre-course survey I am excited. The app so far seems reliable on my Android phone so lugging around a tablet or notebook/laptop doesn't appear to be necessary at all when on the go. In addition, everything about the app is clean, simple and easy to navigate. Definitely 5*'s

The app is fairly well-designed and the edX site as a whole is phenomenal for following up on any sudden interests you have completely free. There are courses on almost any general subject you would want to learn in-depth and there are also several engaging activities, assignments, and tests even if you're only auditing (free). You can also pay for a certificate for your resume or LinkedIn to show that you completed the course, though it is usually between $50 and $300 to do so. Would recommend.

Love it. The content I've experienced so far have been largely very helpful, informative, and more importantly, engaging (not boring). The pace is great for casual learners while opening the door for deeper diving into the subjects. Highly recommend for everyone from highschool kids to grown adults. No prerequisite required - all education levels can benefit.

Great app, just having one small issue. Sometimes for my course I need to use a web function that doesn't work on the app and it offers to open the site in my "browser". Except it wants to open it in the EDX apps web browser (which can't handle the web function either). Would be great if it would allow me the option to open it in a completely different browser (like Chrome or Edge) that can handle the web function.

The edx app provides a variety of courses in many faculties at a high quality of excellence, accessibility and with more than adequate resources to help equip you as you navigate your way through each course. I would highly recommend the app to anyone looking to remotely upgrade their skill set or for anyone interested in growing in knowledge of a particular subject.

This is singularly the most powerful tool I've come across! I'm exited to learn and have access to this! With is app, you skip the core 4 and get right down into it. I started with the Marketing course and just from the intro video, the Professors are personable and enjoyable to watch! I plan to learn the free course while saving up some money to return and get certified soon. Thank you for this learning tool!
So far, I am having an amazing experience with this app. Finding courses is easy, and the instructors are amazing. Five stars from me. I would highly recommend it to my fellows.
edX is just awesome. Its intelligent feature allows you to start your lesson on the video from where you left. The video and text (subtitles) are seamlessly synced. 5-star rating, no doubt.

I always love learning and this application allow me to learn more on my specific field. I am currently learning anatomy because I am a personal trainer, so I am handling people's body state. It is fun and challenging, thank you harvard. Appreciate everything you had done, love ya and god bless.
This app is wonderful and easy to use. And a lot off free course which add some great skills which helps you to achieve your goals.
This app is super cool. It helps me get my course material pretty easily. I even can download the materials so I can deal with them at later times where ever I am at.
Marvelous
This app is really amazing..you can learn alot.
