My app's interface keeps getting dark even though I've tried really hard to find a way to fix it. This has had a huge impact on my experience. How do I restore it?

So far, it's an easy experience. The app is easy to navigate, and the lessons are a cool "at your own pace" style. The biggest issue I have is not everything (especially tests/quizzes) is viewable on tablets or phones. Not everyone has access to computers these days, as portable devices are what people prefer. It'd be really cool if the app got an update to support small screen viewing on everything the app has to offer.

This is a very nice app, that allows to do almost everything one needs to do in order to complete a Coursera course (with the exception of writing, submitting and peer grading peer-graded assignments). There are a few bugs though, that seem to be easy to fix, yet are infuriatingly annoying, because they pop their ugly heads every single time one opens the app. The first one is that once you open an app, it keeps refreshing a couple of times, and you can't do anything until it's done, because no matter what you do, it will bring you back to the main screen. The other one is that videos you've watched do not appear as completed until after you've reset and restarted the app. The third one is that progress within a video is not retained across app restarts. If you fix just these 3 issues, it's a 5-star app.

Following my course was made smooth sailing thanks to this app. Only problems that I had was that the Android version doesn't sync immediately if I were to continue the course on another device. It can get frustrating if you don't remember the last video you watched. Another is that the app doesn't keep track of how long you watched a video, only if you completed it or not. I can watch 14 minutes of a 20 minute video, quit, and then come back to have the timer start back at zero. I did love the video quality, though.

While it has some very useful features like downloading courses. It also has issues with how it frames the videos. These cut off important buttons sometimes along with other issues. However given the usefulness of Coursera in general, I'm willing to overlook these flaws for the convenience of being able to take a part of class anywhere.

I just started using this app I'm so far happy with it. There are four modules that I'm expected to complete all of which are outlined in the beginning therefore there is no surprise do any of the modules. Is lays out the time frame in which each module should be completed and even counts down by the hour and minute. The videos are easy to understand and it's an interactive course meaning they asked the students questions you answer and then you could see the results usually in a percentage.

I have had an overall positive experience. Some courses are better than others, I have thoroughly enjoyed the Google IT Fundementals course. I do think it would be great if there was an option to switch the background to night mode so its not so bright while your studying at night. Thank you!

Love using in my free time. I like the app setup and doesn't generally glitch on me. Nothing I've run into has been incredibly difficult but is very useful for introducing topics. Improvements it could use: - Display all achievements/completed courses (limited to 3) - Be able to view more recently viewed courses and terms (limited to 3) - Be able to favorite courses to take later - Have Agricultural/Biological Sciences categories/topics - Make specializations easier to search and navigate for

This app is really something, I love all the features and knowledge that I enjoy. But recently I am facing an issue where the various options that appear on the video for a second or two and then disappear, are not disappearing anymore, it's really difficult to watch a lecture like this,I put the phone really close to my eyes so that I can understand what's happening in the lectures. Kindly solve this problem. Otherwise it's such a great app.

Hi I am doing courses on Coursera from last year, everything was great except for some minor issues few and far. From this month, the app is not working properly. The video player button(accessibility button) doesn't disappear when playing video. Kindly solve this issue . This is wasting time. Thank you.

This app is great, but am having problem with the videos. It kept the play button, and other buttons on the screen, even when I try to tap for it to disappear it kept appearing over and over again. I plead to the developers to address this issue. This happened with this recently updated version.

The app was working good before this new update. Now the video control buttons (Pause, Play) always stay on the screen. In other words, the buttons stay on screen and don't disappear. Please fix this issue as soon as possible.

The mobile App is actually get, but the Bug in the latest updates is too much. You are watching a video on the app, it pauses on its own, and you can't continue till you exit the app and open it again. Really stressful, since the last update.

I should have rate 5stars cause the app is just too perfect and good üëç easy to use the offline aspect is superb but recently alot of things change after the update no subtitles underneath under offline mode and the video icons like pause, next and others are showing throughout the video, thats really bad the developers should act fast.

Coursera has all the course you may wish to persue, or include in your career path and it's provide good and readable courses at your own time and pace. I will highly recommend it to everyone who may wish to add something to their studies or to improve their skills in their career.

This app is phenomenal. Who needs to pay to learn something when you can do it for free? If you do pay you're paying for a certification/degree. I love the app and I'm sure it will end up saving me time and money. One thing I wish you could add though is like a "For Later" playlist so I can keep track of courses without enrolling in them right away. Amazing app.

This app and the courses are fantastic. You can absolutely earn certificates, but it also allows you to audit courses for free. This is an amazing and invaluable app. As much as I would love to go back and finish college, I would never be able to afford it and I don't want a degree in anything that justifies the cost of college, so this app is perfect. Thank you so much to the app developers and the colleges and instructors who have their content up.

I was and still using Coursera on my PC. I couldn't get my PC everywhere and hence, I was sometimes unhappy because of my conditions. I personally loved the platform. But the app has some limitations and it's okay to have that. Coursera courses are really organised. Coursera is amazing. I think the write ups could do better in terms of grammatical and spelling errors, but it helps you learn despite where you are starting from in easy and fun ways. for the past decade I have used smartphones, this app by far stands out to be the most resourceful out of thousands whether of a similar kind or different. I've been using Coursera for awhile now and I really like how you can learn at your own pace and having the ability to reset any deadlines if you miss due dates for tests. It is a great learning platform, where you can learn anything. and the instructor and Techer is so good they guide us perfectly. If you want to learn something new then it is a best platform. It is for all beginners, Intermediate, and Advanced level person.

Excellent quality courses, excellent selections, never had any bugs or crashes - this and LinkedIn are the only two I use now (i take similar courses in conjunction, as sometimes one app has some information the other missed) This is by far my favorite platform to use through and I'm thankful to the State of Tennessee for providing its citizens free membership to allow us to evolve (Currently doing a complete career change myself)

New interface is atrocious. Everything was smooth, and easy to understand. Now everything is stretched out too much, and nothing is labeled. They also reduced lesson "experience" across the board in their ranked system to encourage people to buy their "Super" option (do not, it is not worth it). Probably going to switch to another place to learn if this change is not reverted. It really is impossible to navigate now, and not a user friendly update.

Not a fan of the new layout at all. This is truly a case of fixing something that wasn't broken. Previously, I could focus on specific topics, jump around, and got a good variety of content. The old interface felt considerably more engaging, while the new single track UI makes the lessons feel more forced. Unfortunate that they couldn't offer both UI options. I'm likely going to look at some of the competing apps at this point.

Ruined by an update. I really enjoyed the sense of control and feedback I got from the old UI. It let me choose what subject to practice and showed specific progress. Now everything looks the same and I have no choice what I practice. I can't focus on areas I know I'm lacking and there's no sense of progress and accomplishment. I made it a goal to get all lessons to level 3 in my unit before starting the next one but now those milestones don't even exist.

I really liked Duo setup. But then they forced a really horrible update. It finished things I hadn't done. And rather than having alot of freedom to work on what I felt like changed to a system with very little choice. It's horrific. I ve had it for a couple years but will be cancelling as soon as my annual subscription is used up. Please have an option to go back to the old way.

I used to like Duolingo. Then they changed the app format and now it sucks. I wish they'd give you the option to revert back to it. I had made so much progress on it and when they made the switch it erased so much of my progress. I liked that we could go back and do a little review to refresh your memory on units that had already been mastered. I have had the app for about a year and a half. I will be deleting this and find a different app to learn french on that isn't as frustrating.

The new update with a "path" style is an absolute disaster and a horrible interface. You have sections like "introduce yourself" but exercises for ordering food. Doesn't make a d‚òÜmn bit of sense. You have to click on each button to see what the heck the lesson is, and some of the buttons don't even do anything. I'm switching to any other app with a better UI. This one was the best and now it's probably the worst. Canceling my subscription, do not recommend this app.

The app was great until the recent overhaul. They had a nice system that let you review up to 3 lessons that needed practice without using up mistakes and an easy way for someone like me to customize my learning experience. Now it's all streamlined into a one size fits all model that no longer helps me. I've had the app for years but I think it's time to let it go since it isn't helpful for every free user anymore.

Since the app automatically updated itself to the new "learning path" it's no longer fun. I had a system with the old layout, repairing the cracked lessons, doing the fun little stories, etc. Now it's no fun and I think I want to cancel my paid subscription. Please give us the option to go back to the original learning layout, this one is horrible and changed for the worse. I used to genuinely love opening the app every day.

Used to love the app. There are annoying apps and lots of ways to spend money to make it 'easier' but overall I felt like I was learning. Now that they have updated the software I don't feel as though I can review the basics as easily as I could before making them not stick and the new layout is too spread out. It makes it chaotic, making me consider taking my business elsewhere. I wish we at least had an option to condense it down as well as chose the old layout with the broken egg challenges.

I've put up with a lot over the years from Duolingo, even bending over background to turn off their annoying cartoon characters and animations whenever possible, but with the new update I'm just done. It doesn't make language learning easy or fun whatsoever anymore, and has completely changed the way progress is presented so that I no longer have any idea where I am in my course. I'm giving up after nearly 10 years of learning and a (current) 1200+ day streak. Just not worth continuing.

It's so frustrating with the new remapped course. I doesn't fully save your progress and now you have to do the stories which was something I barely did before and now I have to it. I also like being able to back to pass lessons doing a little lesson and getting rid of the crack but now there's eight and when you finish those eight review lessons, it doesn't come back. I'm very sad and disappointed Duolingo didn't allow something so we could keep the old format. Hopefully they change it back.

The new UI / learning path leaves very little room for flexibility. It used to be you could choose to work on more than one conversation topic at a time, but now you have to master the highest level before getting to work on another, which is much more monotonous. It's also a lot more difficult now to find & practice previous lessons. You have to scroll for ages to find the earlier lessons. Very disappointing.

It's awful.  1. Their grammar tips were an excellent feature and are now basically gone. You'll have better luck with a verbose 80s grammar book. 2. Going back to review lessons? You can't do that now. Why would they eliminate a helpful feature like that? The ability to review previous lessons is a key feature in language learning....and it makes me think someone is pulling an Elon and destroying the app on purpose. 3. I loved doing this every day. Now? Never again.

Not sure what you folks were thinking with this latest update. You removed the ability to study and focus on individual topics. Now, whatever the next lesson is that we're forced into, it is so broad that we're being taught too many words too infrequently. Let's not forget how visually redundant and endless the path through our language course now looks. This app did make learning a foreign language easier and more fun than I ever imagined. But then you changed that. I canceled my subscription.

I really loved Duolingo because it gave me a way to better connect with my grandfather. Although the new update's difficulty of the lessons severely lowered and I feel like I'm not being challenged anymore. I've been using the past few days to do try and catch up with my old skill tree. I hardly feel any motivation anymore. I think the new update can be good. However, let the users who prefer the old layout be able to switch back.

Please return the app to the way it was. The new update makes everything complicated. It's not very user friendly and it's not enjoyable anymore. If the app remains the way it is I don't think I will be renewing my subscription.

This was a great app but the new layout is terrible. I can't even find the point I had reached so have to start at random points. Also only 5 points per lesson instead of 20. Note to devs: New design is terrible, please change back to old design
So uncomfortable after update.

After purchasing the family plan only last week I am deeply disappointed by the new update. I would not have paid ¬£89 for this new version, all of us hate this format and some family have left the plan. As others have said, not having the choice to select your lessons, losing the option to unlock stories and lowering xp for revision and new lessons is frustrating and quite frankly demotivating! I wish I'd waited a week as I would have uninstalled this app and had ¬£89 back in my bank account! üò°
Please remove the bootleg candy crush saga update, it's confusing!!!

Same as everyone is saying, good app messed up by the update, you can't practice properly or easily revisit topics nor pick what you wish to do. New app erases progress. I have close to 700 days logged in and was on level 4, now with the change I'm back at the start and don't know how long it will take me to get back to where I was. The app was great before, but the last update has ruined everything, I complete the Turkish course and I used to revise my lessons from time to time along with the Spanish and Italian course, now I can't really tell where am I, everything is so chaotic , I've been faithful to this app since 2018, if you don't do something about it I guess I will switch for other apps. I'm sorry but I hate the new design. And the new points. It's absolutely awful. I am not motivated to do much per day now. Just enough to keep my streak. The new update ruined everything for me. it was so much fun and easier before the layout change. can we return to the old layout or atleast get a setting for it? please.
This update is ruining my progress and I can't review my previews lessons. Pls change it back, this isn't helping. Edit: It's no use, I'm uninstalling this app, I'll wait until they change it back.

I was enjoying doing and getting good practice. They have changed the pathway of learning, which alhas not enhancedynlearningnor enjoyment. It's less intuitive to use. Before when I was tired and making lots of errors I could jump in and do stories or start a different set of lessons. Now it's completely not optional what to do. When I'm having a bad time, I'll just stop instead of trying something different.

I changed my rating from 5 stars to 2 after the total restructure. It is not nearly as enjoyable and you have FAR less control over your own learning. Wish they would have left it the way that made it so popular, or at least made the change a choice. I will now go look for a new language app. (Old Review) Fun and structured to bring you along at your own pace. If you miss some answers it revisits the areas you need to work on. If you're killing it, it gives you ways to jump ahead.

I HATE this new update. I've been doing duolingo for about a year so far, and it's just been a very convenient way to learn French, but this new update- the layout is ENTIRELY different. I would understand if they updated it to look better, but it doesn't even look better. The concept of units as a way to track your progress? Entirely out the window, they changed the numbering system a lot. The check button when you're in lessons? Half covered up with the home/back button. I'm disappointed Duo.

I've been with Duolingo almost since they started; if you're just starting out this won't be frustrating. Whenever they do an overhaul change if you're in the middle of course it saves progress but it's all jumbled up in ways where the app doesn't seem to know what you've learned and haven't learned yet. This is the second one in a year (it was just the particular course I was in that reformatted before). I've stopped using Duolingo before, hopefully they'll fix things again for me to return.

Well, they changed it to a themed linear track format. Because if it isn't broken, break it! At least that's what Duolingo decided. Unfortunately a linear themed track, while easier for basics, doesn't really allow you to practice or learn in a not on the rails way. Which for some of us, who are re learning a language, or have a different way of learning, is pretty lousy. Oh, and any more advanced progress you may have had? Gone.

Loved the old version; hate the updates. The new look is confusing. The point system is messed up. They're always randomly changing things without a heads up. As for learning, it helps me identify certain words or read in that language at a VERY BASIC level, but I still find it hard to have a conversation. It was more or less like a learning game I use to play, now with the update and format it's too confusing.

Been using Duo for 2 years, not a fan of this new update at all. Some things aren't easier to find and it's all mixed together. The layout doesn't look as good and is more tedious to navigate. It takes forever to scroll through lessons if you've completed a lot of them and want to go back to certain ones. And if you want to complete ones as practice like before, you'd have to do all the subparts to get the same amount of xp instead of one comprehensive lesson. Please bring back the old format

My review went from 5 to 2. I am (soon to be was) a yearly super member. I really don't like the restructure. I feel like i need to redo all my lessons. I miss stories being their own thing. I didn't think the app could be more straightforward then it was but now i feel railroaded down a path. If I didn't want to do food, I could do routines, and having that freedom was really nice. The pictures in the circle was better. I thought the app was great before this. I'm probably uninstalling soon.

I've been using this for 2 years, have a 700+ day streak. I've been getting on twice a day for the double xp boxes. Yet this new interface absolutely SUCKS and takes away from learning. I do not like it the slightest bit. Tracking progress and being able to "earn" more hearts seems next to impossible. I dont get it. Bring back the old version

The new path update makes it much harder to go back and review exercises, and going back to old exercises isn't worth the XP it was worth before. If this is aimed at preventing those who XP grind, it seems effective, but now I don't know exactly what I'm learning now that it's not the tree format. It also takes forever to scroll anywhere with the path. I would suggest making each unit collapsible to enhance maneuverability, or at least a scroll bar on the side.

I used to love this app but the new update is awful!! My progress didn't transfer correctly and the path is not fun!! I like choosing my own progress in different areas and repeating old lessons but you can't really do that. I tried to do an easy lesson and it was full of words I've never seen before. The icons aren't labeled, its confusing. I think this linear path is meant to keep you pushed on so you keep making errors so you use up your hearts and make you have to pay $$$ for Super

Not sure what they were thinking with the new design. It's really annoying to go back to review old lessons and I can't find the stories. I prefer the old lessons system instead of grouping everything into units. Also they made it really hard to earn XP to stay on the top of the leaderboards unless you spend money. Everything about the new design feels discouraging and demotivates me from learning a new language. I guess it's time to uninstall this app.

The new layout feels like a huge step backwards. It was nice to be able to easily repeat topics in the old format. With the new single path it's much harder to find topics you'd like to review. Having stories in the path is fine, but bring back the stories tab. It was nice to take a break from the normal lessons with a few stories. Can't really do that anymore.

I hate leaving a bad review for this because it is such a great FREE educational resource. But the new update reminds me of a children's game. Finding the books was confusing too as they've been added as part of the trail on the main page. It feels seriously simplified. I was motivated to learn daily and comfortable with the way things were.... I understand one opinion doesn't mean much, but it seems pretty unanimous that us Duolingo-ers prefer the old, more organized and mature version.

The new format is awful, I hate the pathway. The tree was better. Everything is much more confusing now. It's not as easy to go back to previous lessons if I feel rusty in an area. I'm less motivated to do more than one lesson a day so I feel like my progress has stopped. The stories being integrated instead of in their own tab are jarring and I have trouble finding my favorite ones again. I wouldn't recommend this app to anyone anymore, who knows what enormous bad change is coming next.
I used this app dayly but the new layout after the update is really hard to understand as I see for much others too so could you please change it back?

The update is awful! I lost several weeks of lessons as it sent me to a much lower level than I was on yesterday. My gem count also decreased significantly. Their claim of keeping your progress intact is false. I have to spend hours taking a dozen tests to return to where I was. Unless you're an absolute beginner, this app is now very tedious and boring.
Was great now it sucks. The update traps you so you have to do the same lesson mod until it's complete which is hard for me to learn with and they took away the stories which I really enjoyed doing.
I don't like the new updated i feel lost n i can't chose wt i want to learn.. it's sooo much worse

Usually LOVE and pay for Duolingo. Give me an option to turn off this childish new kids home screen and you'll get 5 stars back. I just don't want to use the app. Did you guys not think to carry out some testing with users in beta first? I don't want gamification. I have a strong feeling you'll give people a setting to use new child version or old adult version of home page very soon. #DontChangeWhatIsntBroken!!! Also want an option to turn off and hide all that leaderboard rubbish PLEASE!

I have almost 150 days series and I've been enjoying this app until the last update. New design of the app is not as useful as it used to be. Since i cannot choose which exercise that i want to do. It's just annoying. As far as I can see the evaluations made here, i am not the only one who thinks in this way. Please, revert it. Thank you
This app is so good üëç phele mujhe nhi aata tha hindi or ab Mai Sikh gayi hindi kaise parthe h so....I like this app üëçüëçüëçüëç

I truly hate the new update! I have a nearly 900 day streak going, and I have loved using duolingo all this time. I was passionate about making progress in Spanish. And the update has pretty much ruined all of that and thrown me completely off track. I've now lost my place in the course, it has dumped me in a part of the course that is way advanced past where I had progressed, and it is practically impossible to find where I was previously because the way progress is tracked has changed!!!!!!!!!
I don't like the new look, I don't know which lessons I still have 1 or 2 to complete. It's confusing.

Prior to the latest app update, I had given Duolingo 5 stars. Now its a 2 at best. I really don't enjoy the new format and miss being able go practice lessons so easily. Thats how i learnt! Now it seems to be so much scrolling to go back and it's much harder to keep track of what I have learnt and what I want to practice. I preferred the previous format much better. I have several language apps and Duo was where I easily spent the most time. I imagine I will be using the others much more now
The new version is not good

Changing from 5 stars to 2. Now lessons are generalized, and waaaay stretched out. I was able to go as fast as I wanted and now its such a drag to make progress. Hope they revert back or I'm gonna have to find a new learning avenue
new layout is horrible - upgrade lost some of my progress, the learning path is inflexible and boring.
like this app but some features would be improved
Why on earth you did such a terrible and unnecessary update????? I can't find the specific lesson titles that I wanna practice. This is totally messed up.

The app WAS (previously) amazing. The new update is absolutely terrible. The WORST decision ever. The animations and path not only look terrible, but they force you to do a specific lesson. It is the worst thing I've ever seen. It's hideous, and I very much believe that it should be removed. The old version allowed you to take multiple lessons, not necessarily in order. It was all around much better to learn from and so much easier to navigate. Please consider removing it before I have to quit.

This used to be a REALLY good app...now, not so much. I've been using it for almost 2 full years. However, they recently "improved" it so it would be more like a game--not an improvement at all. Now instead of easily finding lessons on particular topics to review, you have to scroll thru the entire history. Also, it won't record your lesson/progress sometimes. It doesn't seem to even want to work now without an uplink--which wasn't an issue in the past. I'm back in the market for an app. ):

Following the mandatory update to "the learning path", progress has been poorly ported, features are missing (e.g., text to speech, the ability to test out of skills, etc), and the experience is radically more limited. If you are picking up a language for the first time, it's probably fine -- but if you have any background in the language, DO NOT PAY FOR THIS. Find another platform.

Interesting.. to say the least. I really loved Duolingo and all of it's features. The interactive style of the app was amazing! Until.. the update. I really don't like it. It makes learning a bit harder, and you can't even make stories optional!? I used to love the freedom we had and it was FUN using Duolingo before the newest update. I really hope they bring back the old layout.

The app is fine, I've learned well from it. The update is awful though, it got rid of my progress on some topics so I had to redo them to get them mastered, and the layout is much less intuitive. I'm not a fan if how the lessons are now put in such a weird order and not bulked together in a way that makes much more sense. It would be better if it just stayed the same.

It's OK but the voice recognition feature is spotty. My main gripe is making it more about point-harvesting than learner, leading to clear examples of people spending hours to elevate their standing. I highly doubt they are really taking the time to learn, and those who do are penalized for not point-harvesting. It also often introduces a new concept or word with very little introduction, which would be fine... except you are penalized for mistakes. Otherwise, it's pretty good.

Very good app, I really enjoy using it. However, it updated for me and I received the version that uses the heart system. I must say I'm not a fan. Making mistakes is an important part of language learning, especially since Duolingo often introduces harder concepts in exercises without explaining them. That's fine as long as you aren't penalized for messing those up. Still a pretty good app, but I really don't like this particular feature.

Before the change in the format, i was almost to the next Checkpoint. My goal had been to reach the checkpoint by the end of the year. But because some of those learning units were at lvl 4 instead of maxed out to lvl5, i didnt get credit for them. I am only on unit 11 now when i have learned material thru to unit 16. I wish they had given us an option to test out of them at least. It feels like I've lost so much progress, very disheartening.

This app is ok. I like how many options there are and the use of challenges & levels. However, I find that the efforts of the app in political correctness make it a bit more difficult & confusing when learning languages with masculine & feminine words/articles. Also I liked the older version that would suggest & give extra points for practicing old lessons rather than the new, more linear format. I would like to see more details on the rationale for sentence structures and conjugations. Thx!

I've been using Duolingo to learn Spanish and have been very happy with it. I think it provides a good learning experience and it's enabled me to make a lot of progress in Spanish-4.5 rating. I recently decided to start learning Italian too and am not nearly so happy with Duolingo for it. Frankly, it's a mess. It spends a lot of time covering animals very early while neglecting more valuable topics. AND it throws advanced topics--like possessives--in very early in a very disorganized way.

I have been a Super member for two years, learning German every day. It marks you down for being a letter off, but then let's bigger things slide. The sounds, the notifications, and character voices are annoying. It's difficult to learn the actual rules of a language, but it's okay for vocabulary. After two years, I feel like I don't even have a basic understanding of Deutsch. Deleting it at the end of the month when my plan expires, because there has GOT to be a better way to learn languages.

The app is great! We have beem using it for over 250 days without a gap. Just love it! However, after the recent update (showing completion stats after a lesson), it ALWAYS hangs.‚Ä¶a black screen with a spinning circle. Have to close the app entirely and reopen it to continue. Update...the new interface is terrible! I like the old compact home page. Now it's just drags on and on with meaningless flashy icons. And where are the classes that need to be restored? And the stories?

Prior to the new design being implement for French I was making great progress and had a great understanding of the lessons. Now that the new design is in place, it's having me do lessons in things that I've never learned assuming I've already mastered it and provides little assistance. I feel like I need to start all the way back at square one because I have no idea what I'm supposed to know with the new structure, and the place it put me it automatically isn't appropriate.

I used to do quite a bit of practice every day, doing one lesson in each of 3 or 4 units, then reading a story. The new format is frustrating. You are now expected to do all of your work in one unit, unless you choose to do review or read old stories for minimal points. I find myself doing less work, only getting through one lesson in the new unit, then maybe reviewing one old lesson. And some of the speaking tasks won't record, which is super frustrating. I just want some variety back!

I used to love this app. I've made more progress in learning French in the time I've had the app then years in other attempts. It even inspired me to try learning 4 more languages. But the new path set up is confusing and more then disheartening. I'm sure the set up is fine for new learners, but for those of us who've been on the app it feels like I've lost all my progress. Yeah I now have more gold stars, but that feels more like pandering then progress. Also it looks like a video game now.

Before this app deserved 5 stars, now unfortunately I should rate 3 because of the redesign. It became less user friendly because: Now it takes one eternity to scroll through all the units Topics used to be more explicit. If I want to revise something now I have to try hard to find it. So punish your ui/ux designers please :(

Super app pour entretenir et s'am√©liorer en langue. Mais ne remplace pas la pratique √† l'oral! Update : √©tait tr√®s bien avant (5/5), mais la nouvelle mise √† jour est nulle... (On ne choisit plus sur quoi on travaille)
The latest update puts you on a prescribed path making it harder to find and practice topics you want to. Not really liking the change but will stick with it for now
Was 4 until the new layout. I prefer the option to interact with a story over completing a lesson for my daily task. My 1170+ streak is going to suffer/cease to exist.
Used to be very good app but, the latest version story reading no longer available. Previously Story books is fun and motivated. Also provides good setences. Hope you can keep the section

Great app, easy to use. If you're just learning for fun, you really don't need to pay for it. You just have limited time to learn. We have the paid version and some of my family is using it. We have fun competing with one another. That being said, I hate all the in-your- face homosexuality. I won't let my children use this app because of it. I actually plan on dropping Duo and plan to try another app.
Good

This app used to be fun and easy to use. Ever since its current incarnation with the "Trail of Garbage" format sections that were previously separate and easily improved are now tossed together with other things you don't care to or want to learn just yet making learning anxiety inducing and annoying. Yet all the annoying things about the previous Duolingo are still there somehow like getting boosts when you don't want them or need them.
Some translation tasks do not accept valid variations (even some obvious ones)
IT'S SUPER LAGGY. though I have learned alot- BUT LIKE IT SOMETIMES PAUSES :(
Where are the stories?? If you don't have alot of time to do an entire lesson I would do the stories but now I'll have less time to do lessons.
Everything was great until recent update. I can't continue my lessons cause it stated that i'm offline when I got connection 24/7.

It is overall good but guidebook needs to be updated and there should be a list of words learned till now pls add this features and thats the reason i have given 3stars and in the guide book pls add explanation
Update ruined my pattern
After the last update there's too much scrolling, and also you can't do any more 'hard practice' exercises.

The app has been mostly fantastic. However, the new design overhaul is horrendous so far. It's very clearly not finished, with some buttons on the track just doing nothing, and the message tooltips on others staying stuck on the screen occasionally. Past that, it's a huge change from the previous layout, and finding old lessons again is a pain. Overall, it feels like a huge downgrade, and it either needs to be improved or reverted to the previous version.

This has helped me a lot with speaking Spanish and the new format is pretty cool. However, before, I could follow people and there was a cool feature; friends quests. I loved that! However, once my Duolingo changed, so did the friends option completely. I know people who have had their format change, but they still have friends and the quests. Why don't I!? Please fix this. Also leaderboards are gone and all but one of the achievements. The speed challenges. It's more difficult to get it now.

Loved the previous version. The new upgrade seems to be a beta version. More difficult to scroll down and view lessons. More difficult to follow. Also making my 10 unit french section is now about 100 units makes it seem a lot more daunting to finish. I would like it more if the original format was restored. That being said, I love Duolingo and think the lessons are easy to get through individually. The animations are adorable. The leader boards are a fun challenge.

Previous issues have been addressed, but I am not really a fan of the new layout. It makes out harder to go back for refreshers of older lessons, and removes the ability to pick which progression you're going to do next. Now it's just one path, period. Also, I never really liked doing the stories, so having them forced into the main lesson plan unread of being optional is not a plus for me.

I've been using this app since 2019 and have an almost 1000-day streak. I love it, but the old design was better. I liked studying one subject at a time and retaking old lessons to refresh my memory. It's not easy to do that now because you have to scroll forever and everything is in a different order. They also reduced the reward for replaying a lesson to 5 xp. I understand that others may learn better this way, but can we at least have the option to choose between the new and old format?

I love this app. It turns language learning into manageable, bite sized sessions so it isn't as intimidating! Depending on how quickly you want to go, you can be learning new languages within weeks time (not fully, of course). My only gripe is this- I have streaks going! I can't be on all the time, but I try. And when I fail a lesson- it automatically removes my progress. I tried! It just didn't work, and I wish that didn't count towards losing your streak :((

Great way to learn a language for free at your own pace. The online version works fine and has no advertisements or hearts. I also recommend turning off the leaderboards feature. I got too frustrated with the competition. I don't mind the big update because I am actually more focused now on learning new lessons than repairing old ones and am making considerably more progress each day than I used to. It does have it's bugs though and I lost a streak due to one, but the team did fix it for me.

I'm totally loving this app! It teaches very well and it's actually pretty fun to learn another language. This app covers every aspect of language learning. I only removed one star for inaccessibility for the handicapped. It needs to consider those who have disabilities. I'm hearing impaired and listening is difficult. I rely much on lip reading. Having video clips of real speakers would help. It would also help to disable the return key for entering. I keep getting errors while backspacing.

Update: forced into the path mode. I hate it. I really like this app, I haven't updated to the "path" version yet though and hopefully I won't. I honestly wish they'd get rid of the leaderboards too. Unfortunately, there are hacks on the computer that allows people to get 20k+ xp in a matter of minutes which takes all motivation out of wanting to try. That said, while still able to pick what I learn, I do recommend the app, but that could change with update

The lessons seem too repetitive. I miss having more control over what I'm studying. I can test out of a level and skip ahead, but I think I miss out on some stuff by doing that. Also, I was on the Beta version of this new format for a long time before they switched everyone, and it stopped letting me have friends in the app. My friends can't see my profile when they search for me, and I'm not sure why. There used to be animations at the end of each lesson, but now it's a stationary picture.

I love Duolingo, as it is a very easy way to learn a language, while maintaining how you learn it everyday. However, I have had multiple bugs where my streak is reset when I've done lessons everyday, and I had the streak freezes equipped. Other than that, it is a great app, and highly recommendable for those looking to learn a new language.

For the most part this app is very useful. It does have some translation issues that they need to address. For the most part they want direct translations but at other times they use phrasing and not actual translations to be translated. I also believe there needs to be mini lessons to focus on important topics such as present tense conjugating. It would be helpful to just focus on that topic until you are comfortable then do the full lessons.

I've been using Duolingo for a year now and overall I've been a big fan. So far I'm not enjoying the big new update though. I like the idea of incorporating stories into the units but there's too much scrolling and it doesn't seem as intuitive. I like how the old version reminded you to refresh your skills on old lessons. Time will tell if I get used to the new version but for now I definitely miss the way the app used to work.

I was really enjoying the app however the new update is awful. There seems to be no logical flow of lessons and now. Additionally in the previous version you could chose specific areas to revisit more easily. If they reinstated the previous version I would not complain. One thing I do like about the new version is the matching challenges for the leader board.

I've been using Duolingo for two years straight and I've loved every minute of it. I'm getting more fluent in my chosen language and the ease of the app has really been a game changer with that. With Duo, I've accomplished what two years of high school courses couldn't do. However, I do have issues with the new update. It's messed up my tree and, contrary to what is said in the app update description, the stories aren't easier to find. I actually haven't seen them at all since the update.

The app is good, but the new layout is bad
Really good just use, ive used a lot of hearts at the moment haha, but really enjoyable
A very fun app for a beginner to any language right now I am learning Italian and I'm getting better everyday

Used to be a huge fan. 1100+ day streak. One update last year started timing how long each lesson takes. For whatever reason that totally destroyed my motivation to use the app by adding unnecessary time stress.
New menu is much more less comfortable and informative than the old one. Forces to scroll a lot if you want to rehearse old units. Please, give the possibility to change it back in options.

I agree with the other comments that with the latest update, the stories became lost between lessons and there's now way more scrolling. Also previously, the tips were better - they would actually explain grammar rather than just show phrases from the lessons. In my family, there are three people who are using Duolingo and two of them (including myself) would like to go back to the previous layout. Please add the choice button between the two versions. And please remove the Google surveys as ads

I like the app a lot, it really helps to exercise my brain and learn something new. But i'm very disappointed by latest interface changes: the color scheme, the "trail" view of lessons and the merge of stories section with general lessons just don't seem right.

I love learning languages; Arabic, English and French, I've been learning them for years, however, I hadn't any chance to know anything about German, but with Duolingo, I knew and learnt sehr gut about it. Thanks a lot Duolingo.
It's definitely more convenient than going to class everyday :) Sometimes I find the spoken word quite hard to understand, but I guess that's part of the challenge.
This is a very good learning aap I like this app
The app is amazing but the recent update is really confusing how do I get to read stories on my Spanish courses ...please fix it thank you

I love the app! The only teensy tiny bitty problem is that I'm half Filipino and I need to learn Tagalog cause no one wants to help lol if you guys could put tagalog as one of the languages thank you thank you thank you!
Dear Duolingo, please add Belarusian to your platform üôè
Noice

Better than a phrase book! I'm not sure if I will get fluency just from Duolingo, but I've already learned a solid base vocabulary, basic phrases, and some basic grammar. The app interface is good, and they've recently made changes to improve it, which hopefully they continue to do. The ads aren't bad, and the hearts system they use instead of a timer is a real nice feature, but you lose ads and get unlimited health if you go premium, which helps if you're looking to learn.

There's pros and cons to the new update. I like that the courses feel more like a journey. I also appreciate having an expanded view to see the tasks I've accomplished and having short stories added to core lessons. The cons are its not as quick going back and forth between lessons. Especially if you're farther along and want to look back, there's a lot of scrolling. Overall I'm happy with the change. It's good to try new things and not stay stagnant. Duolingo feels fresh with the new face-lift.

Great tool to informally learn a language I'm your spare moments. There is no substitute for actual conversation in a new language, but Duolingo is a fun and effective way to get the formal "classroom" aspects of the language rules and vocabulary. The lessons are well designed, the app has good incentives to keep you motivated. The ads are tolerable to a point. Eventually I found them enough of a waste of my time and I was invested enough that I decided to subscribe to Super.

Don't bother paying for Plus - offline doesn't work. I am using Duolingo to study Spanish and Korean. I definitely like the Spanish one better because I think there is more content and it has gone through more rounds to make it better for Spanish learners.  However, Plus drives me crazy.  I purchased it so that I could study offline since I study on my commute and a good portion of it is underground with spotty signal.  I can complete the lessons, but it doesn't save my progress.  This results in me having to do the same lessons over again and sometimes, losing my streak (heartbreaking!) I've complained to Duolingo about this and here is the response I got:  "Our team is aware of this and is working diligently to fix it as quickly as possible. If you're ever in a pinch and you lose your streak because of offline issues, don't hesitate to reach out and we will update your streak right away. In the meantime, I suggest making sure that once you do connect to wifi, that it's a super strong connection. If you're on a weaker connection, it might need some extra time to update." My first email to them complaining about this was in October and it's still happening.  Disappointing.

This app is easy and fun. I only wish I could sign up for the paid version monthly and not for a whole year at a time. I am not paying $80 to use this app for a year I would rather pay monthly to get the super duolingo but until thar is an option (or someone shows me where the option is, if it is an option) I will continue to use the free version but obviously not as much since in the free version you're limited in what you can do without spending money.

I have been using Duolingo for years and it has absolutely made learning a language fun and easy. The lessons are short enough that just a few rounds of basic practice translates into useful conversational language. That being said, this new update on 11/15/22 absolutely sucks and I completely hate it. They have completed remade the learning model and if you make a mistake, you lose a heart and I have not yet found a way to replace the hearts yet. Bring back the old "tree" model please!

I have been using duolingo for a longgg time, back when there was no paid option and no ads. Even with that factored in, (ads are a little annoying) it is a great app. I love learning languages and it is well designed and very affective for learning. I also think the ads are kept at a tolerable level and I understand why they have them. I have used duolingo to learn Spanish, French, Japanese, Chinese, Arabic and more and enjoy the app very much üëåüòò

The repetition is spot on, Without being too repetitious if that makes sense. The lessons are staggered yet hits on the habits of vocabulary and word placement to have a true result in learning a foreign language. I appreciate this learning aid. It's fun and challenging. I also find the message boards to be very insightful. Great job Duolingo!!!

Took Spanish in college. Not sure how I passed with a c+ because most of the time, my teacher was facepalming and saying "what am I going to do with you" but duolingo is so easy to follow. If it can teach me, it can teach ANYONE. I've always wanted to learn Latin. Think I'll do that when I'm finished with the Spanish. So many languages to choose from, although I did laugh at one of the options...... Klingon. Overall, great app, easy to follow, speech, reading, typing,would definitely recommend.

Learning & practicing French. Entertaining but building vocabulary. Generally it is fun, but it calls the lack of a comma a mistake. An issue is learning the articles. Duo doesn't always tie the correct article to the word. It shows le table at one point, later it shows a group of pictures with one just saying table. Makes it difficult to marry them together for me as an English speaker.

absolutely love duolingo, but i really dislike the new user interface (the path). the tree not only was easier to understand but it made language learning look less daunting with how it broke down units. id love to see a setting where users can choose to either view the tree or path style interface! i dont normally leave reviews but wanted to say something about the update since it is important to me :) have a nice day!

Exceptional app! If I could give it more stars I would. This app is very well thought out and the strategies for enabling self taught language acquisition through this app feel natural and allow me to control the degree of assistance I need. Extremely user friendly and fun. Notifications keep you motivated and ads keep it free. Ads are brief and offer rewards that are used to maintain your learning streaks. It runs like a well oiled machine. Great job and kudos to the programmers and designers!

Its amazing but you should add widgets! Definately one that shows the leaderboard and then maybe one with words of the language that show the other definition and it changes every 3-5 seconds to another word. That would be super cool! And on that note, it would be super cool of you had a vocabulary for each set! Say you tap "Home 2" then there will be a vocabulary button and when you tap it, it shows all the words youve learned so far in "Home 2" as well as their English meaning!

Easy learning if you commit to daily use. I love that different speakers are used, i.e. male, female, adolescent, using regular speech and a slower cadence option. You learn in a variety of ways: with pictures, English to Spanish, Spanish to English, matching words, filling in sentences, etc. As you progress stories are offered and you are asked questions about what you heard. You're also given the opportunity to speak Spanish.

The free experience is pretty good. But sadly there's some limitations that interrupt your learning with the free tier. (Hearts, few options to test out of a level you already know). The free tier should work for most people but the paid experience is much more time efficient. Great app overall and i am well on my way to learning a new language.

We absolutely loved Khan Academy Kids for our preschooler until one of the stories made us wonder if KAK was trying to normalize lgbtq+ values for preschoolers. For us, introducing 4 year olds to trans concepts is inappropriate and unacceptable. I recently reinstalled this app after a time without it to support learning in my 5 year old and 2 year old. The reason for my star rating is due to the amount of silly song YouTube videos that are played in the lessons. In my opinion it is excessive and overstimulating for younger children. I do hope some changes can be made to limit video watching and be replaced more audio interactions.

This has potential, but needs a few key features like the ability to curate offline content, open to the offline content if the user is offline, change the font size and highlight color in the books, and turn the background music off. The cartoony characters are ok, but the whole thing feels like baby talk, which is condescending and encourages bad communication.

I love that this app is free. I wish that there were more features making it easier to use for a class, such as being able to move students from one class to the other, being able to assign multiple lessons at one time. It's great that there are more advanced phonics lessons.It would be helpful if the books had their lexical or guided reading level to make them eaiser to assign. Also - would be nice to have it available on windows devices.

It keeps asking for TTS. it's great for young toddlers. Very exciting app and has the kids keep trying when wrong. There are no ads and absolutley free, but it keeps shutting out every time the "surprise truck" is presenting something. Also, everytime we get off the screen accidentaly (because thats a common thing for a toddler to do) it doesn't continue where we left off and need to starts a new activity.

Most of this app is great, but there is a big problem with the drawing section. The letter stickers make phonetic sounds when tapped. However, the vowels do not become long or diphthongs when the word spelled requires it. This is very confusing for my youngest, who is learning to read, because the app is not following the rules of phonics that he is learning.

This game is super fun and my girls love it but so far all they can do is play in the library because it only tells me, oops, ask a grown-up to check your internet. I have tried uninstalling and re-downloading several times with other problems, all leading back to it telling me there's a problem with the internet even though everything else I do with the internet on our tablet works fine... please fix this and I'll for sure leave 5 stars!

The constant background music is awful and distracting. Seriously, how can you play background music of a nursery rhyme whilst reading and expect a child to concentrate on the story being read. Give us an option to turn the awful background music off!!!!
Good for younger kids. Mine are 8 and 10 and unless it gets more complicated as we go along it seems better for ages 5-7. It is a bit too slow pased as well.

Overall cute, but a bit too much cartoony shouting over every little thing. I'm afraid such an approach reduces kids' attention span in the long run. Also, there are two things I wish one could tweak: 1) being able to skip videos/songs in the middle of tasks (I know they're related, but sometimes they're not necessary at all, as the content is easy) 2) being able to turn off Cody's constant reminders to tap him if we need help. :)

My 2y.o. daughter is the only one out of my 3 youngest(5 total) children that's used it but she's LOVING it so far. I think it'll be a good addition to our homeschool routine and make it more fun for ALL OF US! It's DEFINITELY the best FREE LEARNING APP for 2-8 year olds. I SUGGEST YOU TRY IT...

Description says 2-8, but the app states its only for 2-7 (goes to 2nd grade)

Pros: This is a great resource, filled with excellent learning activities that the kids love. Highly recommended! Cons: 1) Often we have to restart to use the app. Don't know if this is a problem on the Chromebook side or KAK app side. 2) As a teacher, it is frustrating to have to use the app to assign activities. I would appreciate a web interface on my computer. 3) Finally, it would be very helpful to have a co-teachers option, or another way for teachers to share the same group of students.

It is very engaging, my little one loves the content and the characters. I wish you could test out of skills since it doesn't seem to adapt as fast as we wish. Also, it would be great to be able to limit the different kinds of things you find in the library, right now it is all of it or none, but this can be overwhelming for young learners. Finally, a browser option would be a good addition.

First of all, I must give my gratitude to the Developers of this app. My child loves it and is learning lots from it. And the Super Simple Songs integrated with the games are really great. But the app tends to have some seriously glitchy behaviours. It often shuts off in mid-game and takes the user to the phone home screen. It freezes at that point for some time with a black screen and when trying to getting back into it, it resets the game so my child loses where the game left off. It's a real test of patience at that age. I have had to restart my phone in order to get it to work again sometimes. On another note, certain things that are required to be either clicked or dragged are placed way to close to the top of the screen, which oftentimes causes my child to activate the slide-in menu from the phone during some games. Also a minor thing, when there's a song involved, there are moments where the song is paused in order to begin an interactive game. But the songs are often paused on odd times. It's really not so crucial but it triggers my OCD to some degree. I would suggest to try to tackle that with a little more finesse :) I realize it's in beta but I hope they pay attention to these things when the time comes to launch the real thing. Other than the things I mentioned, we really love this app!

The graphics and voices are great and most of the games are as well. It's wonderful this app is free. But the main flaw is that there isn't a way for parents to customize it so that the child doesn't just skip to the easy bits and the videos with little or no educational value. Khan, please enable a 'locked' feature so the kids can't just back up to the home screen and access the full library or navigate backwards to the not-challenging content.

this is a great app! I would change 1 thing! When my 3 yr old doesnt know how to complete a session or doesnt like it, she will just hit the back button and the the play button again and it changes the session completely. I feel she should learn to work through those problems and not just change them because she feels she cant do. I would EXTREMELY suggest that hitting the play button take them to the last session they were on. and I would give this app a 5 star!

Pretty good app and keeps my son engaged. However I do wish that it automatically adjusted the skill level to keep it challenging for him. I did the initial set up by his age, but his skill level is way beyond some of the things the app ask him to do and I don't always feel like it's challenging him or even teaching him new concepts/skills. It's really easy to keep kids engaged using the cartoon characters, but I really want it to be more of a learning tool instead of just entertainment.

Have this on Both kids' tablets from Christmas. My son started picking up lessons faster than his older sister!!! I've learned that it's basically their learning types but I was really impressed! I agree with some previous reviews about the screen timeouts. It is annoying with the videos but my kids now know it's necessary so it's not a huge deal and they just tap the screen every so often. Only suggestions would be to make it easier for parents to follow progress. Possibly an optional automated email on what they are learning and Progress (like mastered, showing improvement and challenging ratings on the concepts.) Other than that this free version is absolutely amazing and sometimes I feel it's better than ABC Mouse!!

Great mixture of play and learning. Plus it is free. My daughter loves it. A lot better option to over priced ABC mouse. One thing that is irritating about the app is how it resets to home screen when you go out of the app. most as will pick up where you left off at when you open from recent app on Android. If I get a phone call and have to leave the app it will go back to home screen is the app when the call is done.

Great app for kids. My son is two years old and has been using it since 20 months. There are songs, stories, and interactive activities. NO ADS!! It's awesome! edited to 4 stars 7/2019 - the app saves progess once you finish a level, but doesnt save progress when it gets toggled to another screen and the app is still running in the background. This is incredibly frustrating when he accidentally pushes the home button and we have to log back into the app and it chooses another level.

Fantastic curriculum and activities for my two year old, and it's fun for me to guide him through the interface. My only issue is that the app screen doesn't expand the whole length of my phone screen but the touch interface does, so when my two year old is touching anywhere on the large black borders of the app, his taps within the app screen don't get recognized. This means the app only really works for him when he's not holding the phone.

Almost perfect - I love it, the kids love it. Very educational & helpful with learning math, reading, etc. Multiple profiles is great! Maybe possible to add some more science? And can can't find the prizes that my kids picked anywhere. My only real complaint is that it doesn't override my phone's sleep mode, so I either have to change my settings every time and then change them back, or I have to train my 2yo to tap the screen every time it dims. Neither is a great option.

I set this up for my grandson and its practically perfect in every way. except I would like to see once a child has mastered an activity that it could be hidden or removed to keep the child moving forward. I understand repetition is somewhat necessary for some kids. but the in app ability to master a task and have it hidden once mastered would be good for progression for those kids ready to learn at a higher level.

I love the app, however 1 thing ive noticed about the kids apps, is there is no way to essentially, choose to lock the phone back button, home button, and all apps button so they dont close out the app. Idk if thats a possible thing, but from my experiences, if its possible to have a on off toggle for your phone controls that would be amazing!

Best learning app for children I've found!! My children love it! We love all the books! The kids love being able to choose content from the "library." The learning path is creatively designed. (: The kids love the "gifts"! (: I'm happy we can turn the music off - some apps don't let you mute the music, which can become distracting when trying to learn. The interface is very intuitive! The best part - it's free! My only wish would be for the learning path difficulty to be more customizable. (:

This is a go to app for my kids. One of the few apps I don't have to monitor because of content and/or ads. It keeps them interested They learn plenty all while having fun. My absolute favorite thing about this app is how I can set up can set up Separate accounts for everyones Individual needs in age. Setup is clear and easy and I'm able to set up and move through it with ease.

It starts a little slow, but give it at least ten lessons before you give up. Also, I realized you can pick whatever lesson you want from the Library icon in the upper left of the home screen. It feels like being in a kids' tv show and getting to answer questions along the way. The animal characters are cute and friendly. I used it for several hours, and it seems completely ad-free, which is great.

This app is great, really engaging for my 4 year old preschooler. She loves that she can do it on her own, without any help from me. There's a good mix of activities, songs, and stories, and it goes over so much curriculum like letters, numbers, colors, comparisons, phonics, etc. Really phenomenal for any app, much less a free one. Highly recommend!

So far so good. We've only had the app for a few weeks and my three year old is very intrigued. She loves the library section because she likes to pick her own books. She can also navigate the app very well by herself (big plus). No ads (bigger plus), I can safely leave it in her hands. I like the quick learning segments. It is a fun way to learn for a few minutes or longer quiet times.

My kids (ages 3 and 5) thoroughly enjoy this app.  The activities are varied enough to keep them interested but repetitive enough to give them a sense of mastery and success.  My 5-year-old can navigate his way through the app without our intervention because of the intuitive interface and helpful audible** prompts.  (**Unfortunately, because my kids still can't read, we can't use this app in situations where the device has to remain very quiet/muted... too often, the non-text-based visual cues/instructions don't sufficiently explain the task at hand.)  It's a valuable resource for our family.  Thanks Khan Academy!!

Love this app!! I've spent so much time downloading, trying out, and deleting apps while searching for something appropriate for my toddler to use. I'm impressed and love that it's geared towards learning, as opposed to just mindless play. It has so many different important, and in my opinion, usually untouched (by other apps,) subjects and lessons. It seems that most apps for kids 5 and under only include shapes, colors, or letters and numbers, which is nice, but my child has those mastered already, so I was thrilled to see the range of learning topics covered. Between the content, the lack of ads, easy navigation, I'd say Great job! Keep it up! I'll definitely be recommending this app!

I love Khan Academy and their mission of free, quality education. As a frequent user of it over the years, I was excited, but hesitant to see their app for children. Most other education apps geared toward children are filled with ads or are limited/extremely basic unless you pay. Khan Academy contains none of that. It's filled with fun, interesting games that are age appropriate. My daughter loves the songs and activities. I like that you can select different levels based on their age, and it's easy enough for her to navigate (she's two, almost three) while my hands are busy doing her hair. Thank you, Khan Academy!

My daughter's almost 18 months but she's obsessed with phones and she will hand them to us when the screen is off to turn it back on. All I really wanted for now was an app she could use where I wouldn't have to worry about her sending messages/changing settings etc. but I figured I'd try to also find one she could actually use properly once she's a bit older.  I tried a few of the most popular ones and wasn't too impressed. The Khan one is so much better and she's clearly already learning from it and trying really hard to understand what's going on to use it properly. I don't think it will be long before that happens.  I love the wide range of different content on there and it all feels like useful stuff for her to learn about. The music and voices and animations are all great and not annoying like many kids' things can be. We will be getting her a tablet for her 2nd birthday and this is probably the only app it'll have on it.

I downloaded this for my 2 and 4 year olds. They love it! There is so much variety and I never have to buy a new pack of something or tell my kids they can only play on certain unlocked parts because it's all free! My kids love being able to switch between listening to books, watching videos, and playing games. I love that it's all educational, can be tailored to each child's age/level, and that you can link the account to different devices by via login and they can be at the same spot on all devices! Great app!

Familiar with Kahn academy in my own schooling, I had an expected a high caliber of effort and effectiveness and overall quality. This app exceeded my expectations. My daughter(2) gets lost in the songs and books. She has learned multiple tunes and words while I do the dishes, drive the car, or shop for dinner. Obviously it isn't a replacement for working with your kiddo but it's MUCH better than the apps that trick her into buying things or letting her run wild in the matrix of YouTube. The only problem I've experienced: sometimes the loading screen gets stuck for minutes. Being in Beta this is highly understandable. She brings it to me and I close the app and she restarts. Overall an amazing app. I'm eagerly anticipating each update and highly appreciative of the most recent one :)

My 3 year old daughter and I both love this app. It has adorable characters, just the right mix of songs/games/interactive features, great learning content, and it lets the kid choose a game over and over again, which is what kids at this age love to do :)   My only complaint is with switching to other apps. I don't see the home/back/menu buttons while in the app (I use a Huawei Honor 7x), so I have to press the power button to get out of the app. And when I switch back, the app restarts, not allowing the kid to continue what she was playing.

Great educational app. Started with my 2 year old. The content is advancing as he is learning more and is able to do more.  I love how it teaches more than just letters/reading and math - it teaches about weather and feelings, and even more. We are able to incorporate things from the app into our discussions of every day life, which helps him make connections more easily. And no ads or paid stuff! Perfect for a little kid who likes to tap everything to see what happens!

I am so grateful for this app. My two year old daughter loves it. She is speech delayed and loves to learn and this is my favorite app for her. The only issue I have is the tapping and dragging feature is a bit difficult for her at with her age & capabilities. She taps the screen several times and it won't work and by the time it registers she's tapping again and it's undoing it and saying "uh-oh" so she is thinking she chose wrong. This gets her frustrated so we end up moving to another lesson.
This is helpful for all ages which makes it perfect for a grandmother!

Excellent app! Awesome way to access your course studies on the go! Literally just did a Quiz on my phone! Update: The app sucks. It's not as good as I thought it was. And it BUFFERS all the time for some reason, compared to the website which never really buffers. In comparison, the mobile site is EXCELLENT. The app is just "okay".

At least for my class, the learning platform is very one dimensional, consisting of a video lesson and a quiz. When I had a question the help I received was very poor: the response did not accurately relate to my question, and now my question status is listed as rejected. That was a frustrating experience. I find this to be very expensive for what it offers.

Allegedly free to sign up according to the website, only it's not. Basic account is 39.99 which is worth it if you want to learn independently and you're not already paying college fees. If you're just brushing up on one or two units in a module, it sure isn't worth it. Upside is you get to watch a tiny excerpt of video! Yaay! There are better alternatives.

Technical support terrible. I contacted then regarding Proctored exam not available to take. Three days later and still no one seem to know what I am referring to. All quizzes and assignments has been completed, final Proctored Exam is deactivated from two of my courses.

They pull a bait'n switch telling you the 1st month is free but charge you $200 for the 1st month anyway. App is not modified from the desktop site so it shows language for features you can't access (ex: submitting assignments), you can't access billing info on the app. If you contact support, they only commit to responding within 2 business days. Most people do this on the weekend so you're basically stuck until the following weekend. I've never felt so scammed. Schools shouldn't be referring.

It will ensure you reach your destination, but expect turbulence along the way. Pros: ‚Ä¢ Impressive variety of courses on just about anything ‚Ä¢ Great and easy-to-follow systematic course structure ‚Ä¢ Each lesson is broken up into digestible chapters ‚Ä¢ Love the option to test out of material, cutting down on study time Cons: ‚Ä¢ Painfully delayed and clunky system ‚Ä¢ Not cheap - $60 a month ‚Ä¢ Typos are surprisingly frequent ‚Ä¢ Sometimes fails to save progress ‚Ä¢ App feels cheaply made overall

Very clear, straightforward and versitle in terms of education approach. Only reason this is not 5 stars is because the quizzes are too easy and answers are too obvious. They should make the quizzes and exams more challenging to match the difficulty of the REAL exam(s).

I've been using these lessons to study for my Ohio educator assessments exams and so far they've helped me pass 2 out of the 4 exams I have to take. Currently studying for number 3. I like that I can listen to it and not just read it. The only reason for 4 stars is I would give up 5 stars if I could cast it to my big TV. I've had a few lessons that are text only but over 90% of them so far have been on video which is very important for me for me as I'm a visual learner.

Some of the lessons are in text form, which is fine. some of the answers to test questions are duplicates. When I passed the chapter not all of the chapter progress dots turned green and I'm a little OCD so it bothered me. overall a pretty good study aid.

If money is not an issue then I highly recommend this app for anyone studying in general. I studying to become an Earth/Space science teacher and I'm getting through these lessons in a hurry. It is a bit for $45-60 a month but it's worth it if you can do it. They have a 30-Day free trial but I was charged after a week I believe so contact them if that happens to you. Other than that it's great.

So far any subject I want to learn has been available without all the extra unnecessary verbage or details. They're up to date on most lessons. They include great examples and for specialty courses, they also include up to date test preping. So far this app has helped me remain confident in succeeding in my courses.

It is very good, it has dozens of courses available for you to pick from. From Business to Interior design. My only gripe is that you are not able to drop courses you are not interested in. Please get that fixed!
