It's a great app so far! If you're looking for the price, like i was, it's tricky to find. 3 price tiers at 30, 50, and 200 dollars. Despite the lack of pricing info, its awesome! The videos are super helpful and educational! You can take as many classes as you want and at your own pace!

I'm a very visual learner so textbooks just don't cut it for me. The videos help me retain the info more efficiently than just reading a textbook. The quizzes reinforce my understanding and shows me what I need to focus on/review. To top it off, I can download videos to watch on the go when I'm in an area without wifi and/or poor cell signal.

Great value. Really expensive. Very helpful. But really...I haven't compared it to alternatives, so are there good alternatives that are way cheaper? I don't know. Classes have exciting videos, interactive activities (I think), you can transfer your passing courses transcript to most community college and universities, I think you can watch videos and attempt quizzes instead of any reading, cool fun quizzes to test your understandings, SO MANY subjects and topics. Like a database for learning...

I love it! I find myself just wanting to do more!! Its currently 11:40pm and im still watching the lesson videos! It's easy, I learn the essentials and the there are different option to do while doing lessons such as, reading the script, listening and taking notes and watching the drawling and pictures they use to visualize what your learning!

I'm working towards a teaching certification in my state. I was hard pressed to find a good study guide so that I could pass the state test. This app is hands down the best course I could find. It has a dashboard feature to help you stay on track with your goals. The lessons are broken up into digestible parts and most are presented on video by experts. Each lesson is followed by a short quiz. The instructional design is very impressive. It's well worth the money.

Just about all the videos are very helpful. If some seem redundant, I read the lesson summary, but mostly this helps to cement the information. I like the quizzes and unit tests because they help me see where I need to do more work or make me feel comfortable that I know the material.

WOW! WOW!! WOW!!! Using this program helped me successfully pass my exam that I had prevously taken three times without success; plus I had purchased three other different study programs that were not as user-friendly, nor necessarily capable of helping me to help myself. Bottom line is this - based on my experience - if you want to pass tests and exams on your first try, USE THIS PROGRAM.

Works great! Yes it's expensive but the lessons are well thought out, way to understand, with quizzes for each section, and they have a 30 day refund, so if it was too much you can get your $60 back, so it's like a 30 trial, if it will help me pass my praxis exam then it's worth the price

Very clear, concise lessons. I love how the courses are organized for easy and intuitive use. The tests and quizzes are very useful tools for learning the subjects. Overall very happy with my experience.

First time I've paid a lot of for an app (really for the website log in) but worth it. I can listen to my study materials or read them, take short quizzes after every sorry video, download the content off-line, and it covers exactly what I need it to.

Well organized content. Excellent for autodidacts - takes the guesswork out of pedagogy, logical progression of subjects within a domain or discipline. Great for subjects where lacunae exist due to uncertainty about which books to read on a subject in which order. Also has tangible benefits for misanthropes - learn all you want without ever having to engage with a human.

I thought it would take me MONTHS to prepare for my exam.. I need a 70 to pass and made a 20 on my practice,, after a few hours on this app/site I took another practice and I made a 55! I will recommend this app to EVERYONE!! Its easy to use, quick, and very well put together.
This app allows me to take college level courses reliably, and at an early age! With it's easy to take courses it's super easy to work on college classes, and get your college hours.

As a teacher, the resources here go a long way a supplemental material for my classes to learn new concepts at their own pace. As student, the app affords the opportunity to not only learn at my own pace, but also to tap into areas of study I previously did not have access to.

I'll be honest, this rating is not for the contents (which seem good) but for the app itself. Discounting other issues, the one that's the most problematic is the fact that the cast function is moody and its always a hit or a miss when I try to cast the videos to my Chromecast. I'm immensely disappointed as it puts a damper on what I signed up with the app for.

Content is great, but this is about the app. The app is terrible. I have been trying to use the cast feature, which worked back during the great courses days, but now just doesn't work. When attempting to watch between multiple devices, your spot is not always saved. It sometimes just starts the lecture over.

I really do not like this app. When it works it works well. When it screws up it does a great job! If your multi-tasking with this app you can forget about it. I paused my lecture, used GPS for around 15mins then went back to lecture and my lecture was gone. I had to restart and it doesn't restart from the beginning but it also doesn't restart from where it was initially paused either. That problem is bothersome but the app will aslo go as far as freezing up and will become unresponsive.

Edit: reduced to 1 star. After more than 2 years and hundreds of hours of lectures, I'm removing the app and canceling my subscription. Audio streaming has been failing to load with increasing frequency over the last year, and has now become entirely non-functional. Same issue on iphone X and Samsung S20+. Verizon, tmobile, wifi, all the same. I have one course to finish in video mode and I'll be canceling my subscription, and it's a real shame.

Content looks promising. But it's plagued by a faulty app. I've had this app for a day and the number of times I have had to close out and sign back in to restart a lecture because their playback feature doesn't work is aggravating, but dealable. But now there is no sound.. making this app completely useless. I have restarted my phone, deleted and redownloaded the app, and tried playing on just my phone and by casting it. Nothing. Silver lining? Happened during trial period.

Do yourself a favor and use the website instead of this app. The new web app is actually quite good, and the new android app basically provides a slower, glitchier, crashier, more battery-intensive version of the same experience. If you really need to download content to watch offline, you might be stuck with it; otherwise, don't bother.

The great courses does well with their courses but the app is shockingly terrible. Extremely buggy and unpleasant to use. Downloading videos for offline viewing seldom works right and I had to Uninstall and reinstall several times to get it to work.... And yes I checked the settings to make sure I can download on cellular data plans as well as wifi. When you stop watching a video, it's hard to get the app to resume where you stopped. Also offline cannot be used in audio mode only.

06/25/2021: Video plays for only a few seconds, then stops- as if "paused". To resume playing I have to click the video and press the "play" icon. Then it plays a few seconds and pauses again. This infuriating behavior occurs for both live streaming and downloaded video playback. This doesn't happen on the iPad, only on Android on my Samsung Galaxy S9+. Update: 02/12/2022. No resolution. This apps completely sux on Android, and no help from Wondrium. Just lame responses.

App is absurdly buggy and years behind other steaming platforms; especially given the cost. Most problems occur while casting to Chromecast. For example, if you begin playing a video and try to browse other videos within the app, the video stops. That's very irritating. Also, it's extremely buggy- routinely causing videos not to load or videos stopping mid-stream; forcing the user to start the video again from the beginning. C'mon Wondrium! Ridiculous in today's technology!

If I could leave zero stars, I would. Since becoming Wondrium we can no longer stream through Roku to use our subscription or access our previously purchased great courses. We tried reloading, changing the password, etc. Nothing worked. We contacted customer service. They apologized for the inconvenience, confirmed that we had paid our subscription and it is paid for the next 3 months (quarterly billing plan) but offered no help in fixing the problem. Used to be a good service, now it is a scam. Nov 17th Update: Thank you for trying to help. Yes, we knew they were two different Roku channels. When you go to the Great Courses the channel tells you to go to the Great Courses Plus channel. Then when you try to load Great Courses Plus, Roku says there is no such channel. The Great Course Plus channel is what we had that worked fine, until it switched to Wondrium.

The 1 star is for the app only. Since the new update it's been very buggy on my Galaxy S8 with the latest Android version. Crashes a lot and slow to respond. I have to restart the app several times a day, and usually after I finish a lecture. No issues with course content or GCP in general. Content and teachers is top notch and worthy of 10 stars!

I LOVE the content - but I had huge issues with the playback stopping every few minutes. I also have Android, and I worked with tech support for over an hour on this. They escalated my case because nothing solved the problem. Instead of receiving help, I received a dismissive email about clocking my internet speed. I asked the tech to look at the case notes to make relevant suggestions. No one ever responded back. Beware if you use Android or if you have any tech issues. You are on your own!

The app is terrible since the "upgrade". It plays for 2 minutes and then stops. Trying to watch on computer in browser is just about as bad, every 5 minutes or so it pauses to buffer. Honestly, it is sad because i love the content. If things dont improve soon, i will have to cancel my subscription as it is basically unwatchable now.

Not that great of content or look. I'll add courses to my watchlist and it will automatically take them out. Honestly there isn't even that many courses. There isn't always all of the episodes for a course. It gave me flashbacks of the videos my teachers would put on when they didn't want to teach. The app over all was less than satisfying.

This is absolutely the worst app I have ever used. The videos pause every 40 seconds or so making them unwatchable. Today it paused 3 times in 2 minutes. It pauses with my phone sitting in the counter so it is not that anything is touching it. I did email a week ago as they asked others to do, but have received no response. I paid $30 for something that is unusable. Stick with You-tube - it is free and it works.
Horribal
It no longer plays any videos after the last update. The app just reboots.
I've just installed the Wondrium app update and now it doesn't work. When I click on any episode the app restarts. Until this is fixed I'll have to watch lectures via my browser.
This app is not compatible with Chromecast.
Great service, terrible app. I can't even login to the app, it kept saying my email/password is wrong. But I can login to my account on PC just fine.
Fix the app please! It's a shame that the content is great but the app is terrible!

Software have issues!App content cannot be seen many times and the screen is completely blank when open! Even at the bottom of the screen where there is a display of prrsentor s other programs, when you click on it, nothing happens and it doesn't react

Content keeps pausing inexplicably and randomly, whether I am using video or audio or whether I am streaming it or already have the content downloaded. This is incredibly frustrating. Update: IT'S STILL PAUSING RANDOMLY MONTHS LATER! I keep hoping one of these updates will address this issue but it still hasn't. This is the only media app I use that does this.
For a brief, shining moment, the app worked. Now, I either can't sign in or the app hangs at startup. Save yourself the frustration an DO NOT INSTALL.

I'll be honest, this rating is not for the contents (which seem good) but for the app itself. Discounting other issues, the one that's the most problematic is the fact that the cast function is moody and its always a hit or a miss when I try to cast the videos to my Chromecast. I'm immensely disappointed as it puts a damper on what I signed up with the app for.

I've had this for a year. The programs are interesting. I pay annually. they attempted to bill an old card and it did not go through. they emailed about it and five minutes later, they notified me that my membership was cancelled. I would have fixed it but if they are in such a hurry to get rid of me, then that's what they will get. very disappointed that they handled this so poorly. it was a good service.
Constantly pauses audio even if downloaded. I have "allow to run in background" turned on but it is still buggy af. Content is pretty ok for history overviews
The app is a mess since the last update . . .

Am a long time subscriber and love the content. However the app is really poor. Content issues like interruptions, or when it won't autpplay the next lecture. Also when you listen a course again, it doesn't play the next lecture from the beginning. Some menus don't always work. My watch list seems to be the worst affected. Wondrium please sort it out!

The content is good, i came for "the great courses" but the app(Android and IOS) are so buggy it's insane. For future reference: Step 1: Develope a working product. Step 2: Sell it. Doing this in reverse makes people hate you.

Great content, buggy app. This service has great educational content from science, hobbies, history, technology and art. But the app is terrible. It randomly stops during vidoes and you have to tap it and hit play to get them started again. If it happened a couple of times it wouldn't be such a big deal but it happens every few minutes making watching a miserable experience. I've updated and reinstalled the app with no improvement. It also doesn't allow for easy landscape viewing.

This is specifically about the app. Casting video to Chromecast has always been awkward at best - it would have to be restarted if paused for too long, for example, and trailers wouldn't work, only episodes - but now it simply won't work at all. You can still watch on the phone, but that's not how I want to watch.

I love the Great Courses, and based upon the content, I was planning on extending past the 30 day trial. However, I'm not sure I will. On my Samsung phone, it pauses every couple of minutes and gets really annoying to keep pressing play. This could be very dangerous for those that try to listen and drive. Also, on my phone, I have to exit the app a couple times in order for my content to appear. The roku app won't keep you signed in so it takes a while to sign in and it's really annoying.

The content is great. The app is a little slow and buggy sometimes but that's not a huge deal. The problem I had was strange and was never resolved. I did the free trial with intensions to renew and pay full price the next month. The next month rolled around and I was charged for the subscription, but my account was deactivated. I emailed the team to try getting this figured out and they still haven't fixed this. They refunded me, and they told me they'd fix it but it's been almost a month.

Love the great courses but the app is terrible! Every single time I try to go back to where I left off it locks up, just loading forever. Occasionally I can do a search but cannot use the back button so no way to navigate to the menu, I just have to restart the app and loading in general is very slow so I'm never quite certain if I need to wait it out or restart. Once I actually get to the lectures playing audios/videos seems to work well.

The service is awesome but this app is an exercise in frustration. I will start a lecture and listen as I clean the house but invariably playback will stop and I have to pull out my phone, pause, then play again. It also never goes on to the next lecture without me having to do the same. It often stops playing new lectures altogether after two or three. Then I have to actually kill the app and restart it. This happens when downloading the lectures, too. It is pretty to look at, but I wish they had put more effort into smooth, reliable operation.

Great content. Horrible app. Audio courses will play for 20 seconds and then stop so you have to keep pressing play every 20 seconds to get through the lecture. I thought the newest update would fix this, but it actually made it worse. Too many times I've opened the app to listen to a course and it simply wouldn't load. For a few days the app said I wasn't a member and didn't have access to the content. Really disappointing. I paid for a 3 month subscription and can't access anything.

I love the Great Courses and was excited to subscribe to the Great Courses Plus. The content is excellent and the app is nicely designed. Unfortunately, I am unable to actually watch any video using the App. I have an app that runs in the background and updates information on my pull down menu every 5 minutes. Every time it updates, this App pauses the video or audio that is currently playing. Please try to fix this. If the app would automatically resume playing, it would be better. Thanks

Can't say I'm thrilled with the app. Yes, it allows you to access your Great Courses stuff (the primary function is fine). It does not allow for screen rotation, so video presentation is limited to whatever the width (not length) of your screen is. It has an option for audio only, so you can cut back cell data usage while you're just listening. While using cell data, it also unexpectedly pauses, skips, and decides that you're done with a lecture while there are still several minutes to go. I haven't noticed this with WiFi data, but also haven't given it a thorough testing. Probably the second-most annoying part is that the app wants to launch every time I unlock my phone. I have absolutely no idea why. TL;DR? Sure you're going to be able to get your Great Courses stuff. Aside from that, it needs a lot of work. I'd say "one star, would not recommend" except that the primary function works.

The content is wonderful. The app is not. It rarely remembers where I am in a lecture series, both within a given lecture and where I left off between them. It says that you can save the lectures to your SD card, but you can't. Also, the opening screen should be my watchlist, not some random collections of lectures in which I have no interest.

As the others said, the content is great. The lecturers are good, and the topics are many and interesting. The applications (be that on Win 10, Fire or Android) leave a lot to be desired. There is no consistency across the board (which happens when someone hires different contractors to build them without having an overall standard), and unfortunately the android app is just useless in my case because I cannot listen to the lectures, only watch them. Cancelled my subscription after an year.

Great content let down by a bad app: * You can download content, but you must be online to access (why bother?). * You cannot download audio only for many lectures, leading to needlessly big downloads/data. * When you download the video and let your screen sleep, the audio stops. * There's no easy way to see where you left off. * Way too much focus on video for what is great audio content. * No Android TV support at all. All in all, there's a lot that feels poorly thought out and woefully executed. The inability to play content offline is absurd. All the major streaming services have that figured out, but here it's a mess. I still kinda recommend the overall product, but the app makes it absolutely painful. It's a mess.

I am a few days in with ny subscription and I love the courses offered but the app, buffer buffer buffer, it keeps buffering repeatedly despite a strong internet connection. It is so infuriating! I have no problems with any other streaming apps except for this one. Please fix, I hardly ever use the PC at home so having the app work is a must. Once the problem is fixed I will gladly up the review.

Messy App. While the content is great, the app has several shortcomings, there most annoying of which is that though the control elements (i.e., the timestamp, play, pause, forward skip, etc.) buttons are programmed to disappear when watching the lecture, they continue to be actionable when you invisible! Any touch of the screen meant to get the buttons to show again may make you lose your progress on the lecture, and that's about as disruptive as it gets for this kind of app.

Before they upgraded/updated the app, I LOVED Great Courses Plus. It was worth every cent of the monthly subscription. Once I was prompted to update, I can no longer access. I get a blank gray screen that eventually times out. Big disappointment! Fix your app or revert to the working version and salvage your customer(s). Really - how many subscribers do you hope to lose before you take action? The old saying goes, "Don't 'fix' what isn't broken," but now that it is - fix it! -Android user
Doesn't cast to my samsung tv. I will be back when it does.
crashes at every click- app and on browser-- didnt get to end of trial- not coming back.

App seems quite badly integrated with android in general. No support for Android auto. Does not even show what you are playing in the drop-down on your phone. Quite disappointed by this... It works more or less, but that's the only positive thing about the app.
I emailed cancellation request and they took my $$ anyway! Cant find contact numbers eithet? Thats one way to rip people off
A lot of the content is white supremacy

Please fix this app it continues to pause it's self while I'm listening and I have to completely restart the app th get it to work right again I just want to listen with the screen off or it in the back ground
Videos repeatedly play twice, doubling up audio and with no way to close or stop the hidden one. The content is good but the experience of the app is horrible.

Long term subscriber, great courses but this app needs work, it doesn't rotate according to my ipad, can't use it while lying down, it has its own rotation which is very annoying, I have to sit up to watch
Doesn't remember the last location that was played Sometimes won't show me my list of downloads until I reboot the app

I signed up for the 14 day free trial and since then I have been rittled with repetitive attempts to withdraw money from my cash app account... I cannot find anyone to speak with to make these withdrawal attempts to come to a hault!!! Overall the app has wonderful programming but it's impossible to stop emails and at this time I cannot afford to pay. I gave 2 stars only because I'm feeling frustrated with no customer service and all of the 20 or so attempts to take my money ...
It's a good app but when you are going to watch a lesson it says that you need a membership to watch it

The App keeps pausing my video around every 5 minutes, it's not buffering or throttling, all I have to do it just click play again to start where it paused, but it's very VERY distracting to be listening to my video and the break immersion by having to click play again a million times.
Wonderful content, chromecast seems to work again, now you just need to make it so you can press 'start' on your bluetooth device, and thereby make the lesson actually start again after pausing it..

Great content, buggy app. This service has great educational content from science, hobbies, history, technology and art. But the app is terrible. It randomly stops during vidoes and you have to tap it and hit play to get them started again. If it happened a couple of times it wouldn't be such a big deal but it happens every few minutes making watching a miserable experience. I've updated and reinstalled the app with no improvement. It also doesn't allow for easy landscape viewing.

This is specifically about the app. Casting video to Chromecast has always been awkward at best - it would have to be restarted if paused for too long, for example, and trailers wouldn't work, only episodes - but now it simply won't work at all. You can still watch on the phone, but that's not how I want to watch.

The content on Wondrium is fantastic, and full of a wide range of interesting topics to learn about. However, the app itself does not always work properly. The app will just randomly pause whatever lecture you're listening to, and then when you go back into the lecture to continue, it has you back about 5 mins from where you were. If they can resolve this issue, then I would happily a give them 5 stars because I really love the service. TLDR: Great content, poor app.

The courses on this app is phenomenal, but this app has awful connection. I can have 5G connection, and it will take over a minute of loading to play a lecture. Not only that, but you can't even back a lecture up 10 seconds without the entire thing freezing up. With all the negative feedback they are getting lately, I believe that Wondrium needs to consider the reliability of the app. You would think that a bunch of phd geniuses would at least have an app that doesn't freeze 99.99% of the time.

I was a heavy user of the previous version of this app and it was great! I love The Great Courses Plus and the app was simple but effective. Now the new version, I'll admit, is certainly more aesthetically appealing. Being able to collapse different course titles in the "Downloads" view is helpful, and I like having quick access to the PDF course guides. However, this version also took a few steps backwards: 1) Why can't we store videos on SD card anymore? Will TGC bring that back or has it been permanently removed? The videos take up a LOT of space and I was running low as it was. 2) Now all videos play with the status bar and button bar permanently visible instead of in full-screen view. Could you please at least provide a setting so users can choose whether they want full-screen or non-full-screen playback? 3) Whenever I'm downloading a video for offline playback all the images on the screen start flashing. Not a problem but annoying and looks unprofessional.

2020-04-16 (revised to 3 stars) The folks at Great Courses Plus are obviously working on improving the user experience and have made a significant progress over the past 2 weeks. The latest version of the app (version 5.2) times out less frequently and hasn't crashed on me yet. Therefore, the original 1 star review is no longer warranted. There is still room for improvement, but kudos to TGC for the progress so far. 2020-04-04 (original review) The 1-star review is for the new release of the Android app and the lack of support for it. First general problems: The app hangs, crashes, and will go into spinner mode until you exit and restart it. This happens multiple times daily. And when it's not doing those things, it can be painfully slow. I suspect much of the slowness is due to a new back-end system implemented by the Great Courses. Things have gotten substantially worse after the upgrade to the new system (when all of the device passwords were reset). Specific bugs: 1) Speaking of passwords, the Android app has a 20 character limit for the password, even though the website will allow you to configure a longer password. There's no warning about this website. I had to figure it out the hard way. 2) The app allows you to download content so you don't have to stream and incur data plan charges. But inexplicably (I think because they never tested this), when you start to play downloaded content while not connected to wi-fi, you get a pop-up warning you that you need to change settings to allow data streaming because you're not connected to wi-fi. But this is the whole point of downloading content. And if you try to exit popup, you have either changed the setting (which I don't want to do - I downloaded the content because I *don't* want to stream over my data plan) or you haven't changed it and playback stops. So I just leave the dialog open and then app eventually crashes once I'm back in wi-fi range. Great... I haven't received a response to any of my recent attempts to contact Customer Service. As a long-time customer of The Teaching Company / The Great Courses (since the time when courses were sent out on cassette tapes) this is disappointing. They used to have very good, responsive customer service. It's a shame because the app and customer service are so bad that I'm ready to cancel.

The app loses all my information llike Favorites or Downloads when it remains dormant for a period of time. I have to kill the app and restart it and it then remembers everything. In the past I had trouble accessing downloaded courses when I did not have an internet connection. It wants to reverify that you are an active member. I have not tested the latest version. Other than that, the app is great!. Finding, accessing and streaming a huge range of courses.

I love the material offered by The Great Courses, but the app has some issues. 1. Several days ago, I downloaded some lectures to listen while on a trip with limited internet access. Upon opening the app, I was greeted with the message "We have made some changes that require you to upgrade to our latest version" with no option to continue until the app was upgraded. Very annoying, and kind of defeats the whole purpose of downloading lectures. 2. During playback of lectures, the player will randomly pause, requiring me to manually restart. 3. No Android Auto support for audio lectures.

I like all the content the app has, however it's a little buggy. If I'm locking my screen , I can pause the app from the lock screen. However, if I click play from the lock screen, Not only does the course I want to listen to play, but also some random course I was listening too previously also starts playing. It's a little frustrating to have to open the app each time I want to resume my course

I love the courses (selection and content), but the platform is terrible. I stream the courses at home and in my car. If I don't remember to open the app before leaving home, it does not recognize my ID and password when I try to use it in the car. When away from home,, I can't close the app because I have the same problem. Some of the older courses don't have an audio only option which uses more data if you stream them in your car. All the courses should have an audio only option.

I LOVE the great courses. However, their apps have been lagged and not well designed. One good example is that I have to click individual episodes and download them. The app designers could have provided an option to download an entire course with just one click. Also, it is hard to know if a download has started or not. Wondrium app is still buggy and laggy. Hope it soon falls into the hands of good developers and designers

Good content. Greatest problem is that you cannot download the audio of a video course. Thus you have to stream it if you are away from wifi; not good if you have a limited data plan. Downloading the video and playing it later would work but for my battery being more quickly depleted by playing the video just to listen, not watch. May quit when my free trial is up.

TL;DR Wonderful learning tool if the audio playback worked consistently. App content has been great so far, but it's good I'm on a free trial because the audio playback is buggy. I drive truck so I want to be able to listen to audio in the background, but I often can't get it to start playing... The loading spinner spins and spins, but no audio. If I choose video, it normally starts in ten seconds or so, but then it stops playing when I send the app to background. It's an irritating Catch 22.

Good content. The app could use some work - it is kind of clunky. The two biggest issues (though other things could use some work): 1. The app shows up in my notifications as if it is downloading something, but it just says "PLUSNOTIFICATION" and 2. When I add one course to my watchlist and go to add a different one, it acts as if the new course has already been added.

The library of courses from The Great Courses is great to have, but this mobile app is lacking in two quality of life features and fixes that would make it great. The first one is playback continuing after turning off the phone or putting the phone on standby. Both audio and video playback stop after pressing the power button to turn the display off. Audio playback continues for a few minutes and then stops. Video playback stops immediately. The second is keeping captions on downloaded videos.

Plenty of great courses in a wide range of subjects. However downloading courses to the phone for on the go use doesn't always work correctly. Once a lecture gets stuck in the downloading process, it won't download anything else until the glitching lecture is removed. You can't remove just that one malfunctioning lecture either--you have to delete the entire course the lecture is in and try to redownload.

The content is excellent but the app is buggy and often has trouble with audio/video/adding shows to watchlist. Plus pages like the watchlist are slow to load. I can't even seem to be able to view the videos in landscape mode! Please improve the mobile app--wouldnt mind paying a few extra bucks per month if it means getting a better app.
Player UI keeps poping up when watching
Dont know why the volume for this app is so low. I have it turn to the highest and can still barely hear
Gd
ok so the app is as shotty as the website. great....(sarcasm sir)

Excellent content, but poor Chromecast support. It used to work okay except that there would be a blank picture-in-picture window when I left the app; now it doesn't Cast at all. Tried reinstalling app and resetting Chromecast device, but no luck. :(

The content on Wondrium is fantastic, and full of a wide range of interesting topics to learn about. However, the app itself does not always work properly. The app will just randomly pause whatever lecture you're listening to, and then when you go back into the lecture to continue, it has you back about 5 mins from where you were. If they can resolve this issue, then I would happily a give them 5 stars because I really love the service. TLDR: Great content, poor app.

The courses on this app is phenomenal, but this app has awful connection. I can have 5G connection, and it will take over a minute of loading to play a lecture. Not only that, but you can't even back a lecture up 10 seconds without the entire thing freezing up. With all the negative feedback they are getting lately, I believe that Wondrium needs to consider the reliability of the app. You would think that a bunch of phd geniuses would at least have an app that doesn't freeze 99.99% of the time.

Keeps stopping. Unable to use this latest update on android 9 phone. No problem with using it on android tablet. Already contacted customer support. Although they were quick to respond, no workable resolution provided. Reluctant to uninstall & then re-install app bc of loss of audio downloads. Downloads go against my monthly allocated data by HughesNet (worst ISP ever!). Unable to stream audio when working outdoors - no wi-fi bc of remote location (rural Central Florida). Follow-up: Thank you for your suggestions but this is an app issue. When I click on the app, I get a pop-up that says the app has stopped working. None of tech support's suggestion made a difference. My only choice was to uninstall the app & re-install. It now works but I lost ALL my downloaded audio. No problem with re-downloading except that it goes against my very limited monthly ISP allocated data. I have since turned off Google auto updates so this does not happen again.

My phone is a Samsung S20 with Android 12. Every time I wake up my phone, the Wondrium app opens. I can not find a setting for this problem in Android or the app. The app works great when using it, but this is so annoying I'm about to cancel and remove the app.

Good content and nice to have audio option for playing in background. App itself has some issues last position is not saved reliably when app is terminated (manually or by OS) and occasional connection issues may cause buffering / playback to stop requiring manual action to resume / restart. Edit: Since 6.1.3 update I get weird effects where the app sometimes apparently (re?)starts automatically (showing loading screen W after unlocking phone screen) this is highly undesirable.

I LOVE the great courses. However, their apps have been lagged and not well designed. One good example is that I have to click individual episodes and download them. The app designers could have provided an option to download an entire course with just one click. Also, it is hard to know if a download has started or not. Wondrium app is still buggy and laggy. Hope it soon falls into the hands of good developers and designers

Lectures skip around instead of following sequentially. Most information in The Great Courses can be found free on You Tube as well as other educational apps such as edx, Harvardx and MIT open courseware. Don't pay hundreds of dollars for these courses of which many are decades old.

Quite good lectures although as always a bit weighted towards the personal psychology stuff. App has a really annoying habit of when you hit continue with next lecture it starts playing the previous one that you have just watched which then takes multiple clicks to sort. I have reported this fault but nothing changed. Edit: despite what they say app still has irritating habit of playing the video you have just watched. Not very impressive. Maybe they need course on how to write software.

The library of courses from The Great Courses is great to have, but this mobile app is lacking in two quality of life features and fixes that would make it great. The first one is playback continuing after turning off the phone or putting the phone on standby. Both audio and video playback stop after pressing the power button to turn the display off. Audio playback continues for a few minutes and then stops. Video playback stops immediately. The second is keeping captions on downloaded videos.

The content is amazing. However your software is garbage. When I lock my phone or leave the app. The audio stops (I only listen to audio) I have hunted through the settings and found no solution. Your content and scope is amazing so please fix it so we can peacefully enjoy your content again

The Great Courses is, well, great. The app is a a bit less so, but it has improved significantly over the past two years and is quite usable now. Audio is no longer a second class citizen, and casting audio works well. My biggest wishes are for Android Auto support for listening in the car, and for Android TV support (they already support Amazon Fire TV).

The fastest playback speed allowed is 2.0X. The content is informative but it's incredibly frustrating for someone who listens to audiobooks at 2.5x+ speed on audible. I feel like I am taking steps backwards trying to learn from this program. Please allow faster playback speeds; I can literally feel myself aging.

It's nice being able to take the courses with you on the go. The audio-only option allows me to listen in the car during my commutes. My only issue is I wish the size of the closed captions was adjustable. It is so teeny tiny on my S9 that it's pointless to try to use them. I don't really use this app as much as I would like because of this. I have a slight auditory processing issue and watching things with captions is very helpful for me.

Update: I added a star. The app is no longer struggling to load and play audio and video. Previous: The app itself is nice. But it really seems to struggle with audio and network interruptions - phone and sms. I've had to go as far as force stopping and purging local content to get it running normally again. It's unfortunate because it makes the product hard to enjoy.

Best new feature: you can now download lectures in audio and listen offline. (Before, you could only download video lectures.) The app now marks your place in each lecture, even if you skip between lectures or courses. It now freezes much less often. If it gets wonky or slow, try restarting your phone. If you need to pause for more than a few minutes, quit the app and restart it when you're back. If you press play after pausing too long, it drops you at a random point in an earlier lecture.

The updated app includes the ability to download audio versions of each lecture, plus the associated guidebook. These are terrific improvements over the former version. Moreover, the functionality and user interface are great. However, I would still like to see the capability to download all lectures in a course with one button instead of clicking on all individually.

The app used to be pretty bad and had a difficult to use UI. Also couldn't delete individual downloaded lectures, you had to delete a whole course of downloaded lectures. All these issues are now gone and the app runs much more smoothly now after an update that came out a late last year. Only thing I can think of that needs to change is making all lectures available for audio download, as I think there are still some that are available for video download only.

If you installed the upgrade that was pushed out on 2/12/2020 and are stalled at the sign in screen (just a spinning circle and the words, "Signing In"), try going first to the "Browse Courses" option at the bottom of the screen and then use the sign in button that is available there. That was the only way I could get past the stalled "Signing In" screen that came up whenever I tried to sign in directly from the starting screen. Love The Great Courses Plus. Still room for improvements to the mobile app, but they're working on it.

The content is genuinely top-notch (I'm often quite surprised by the production quality) and had a wide variety of topics to choose from. The app is a little slow and sometimes buggy, but I expect it'll improve in time. Pricing is kind of expensive, but they're making new courses regularly so it doesn't seem like such a waste to me. I'm overall very happy with Wondrium.

Fantastic but dated. Catalogue is huge and the speakers well selected. My only complaint, and unfortunately it's a big one, is how dated all these lectures are. The ones I've listened to are all from the 2000's. Much has changed and been discovered since than. I'm left to wonder how come these arent being rerecorded every few years. Even once a decade would be in improvement.

The content is fantastic but there are some minor complaints. I wish there was a way to see subcategories of subjects. I also would like it if there was a feature that allowed me to view the introductions to various courses in quick succession, sort of like an educational version of TikTok. It'd be a cool way to explore different courses without having to manually search for everything.

Still the only app on my phone that wont rotate (with or without screen lock but I'm willing to say that may just be a phone issue) and occasionally the app kicks me out of an episode and will tell me I dont have anything on my watch list until I close and reload the app. That being said, there seems to be a wide range of content available, and so far it's all been wonderfully presented.

This app is a trove of quality learning resources, which are well worth the $150 annual cost. The only gripes I have is a few bugs where audio skips back to the beginning of a lecture and how I am able to watch videos on the app. Wondrium/Great Courses Plus offers both audio and video versions of their content, but on my Pixel I am unable to rotate the video to landscape. This keeps the often detailed graphics being shown on screen from being legible. A rotate function for videos would be great.

It finally works!!! And I LOVE the fact that in browse they have "Format" Ex. Lecture, Classic Great Courses, etc. A main reason I continue to pay for the service is to listen to only audio while working or doing other things. I'm only interested in high-quality college level content... I DO NOT want dumbed down infotainment. Internet's already flooded with it. Very frusterating to start a program to find it's only a 10min clip! All their new BULK FILLER CONTENT makes browsing messy & harder :(

Love this service! I wish they would add more content as I am running out of lectures that interest me. New interace now hides info and blocks video with a big pause button when you tap to see progress. Needs a "download entire course" option instead of requiring the user to download each individual lecture. On the upside, video and audio now sync nicely when played at faster speeds.
The search is sometimes glitchy, and the videos don't show in landscape unless your phone is set to autorotate. You can't download both video and audio version.
Great content, but cannot stream to TV at higher speed than 1.5x without there being no sound

The Great Courses is, well, great. The app is a a bit less so, but it has improved significantly over the past two years and is quite usable now. Audio is no longer a second class citizen, and casting audio works well. My biggest wishes are for Android Auto support for listening in the car, and for Android TV support (they already support Amazon Fire TV).
The app is okay. Definitely a little buggy.

The fastest playback speed allowed is 2.0X. The content is informative but it's incredibly frustrating for someone who listens to audiobooks at 2.5x+ speed on audible. I feel like I am taking steps backwards trying to learn from this program. Please allow faster playback speeds; I can literally feel myself aging.
Chromecast is working again (though video quality is down from how it was in the past). Great lecture content at a great price.

The bug that broke Chromecasting got fixed on this latest release. I was told by a rep that the devs said the app wasn't the issue, which didn't make much sense to me, but I see it on the release notes and it is indeed now working, so thanks for figuring it out. ü§ò

Based on one year's use: if you have time for videos, I would recommend. Originally I gave 5 stars for the content; I spent time with the history and philosophy courses mostly, which are excellent. However, the app remains a little buggy and now on 6.14 it still likes to open itself randomly from being entirely closed (to refresh, apparently), although less frequently than 6.13. I am usually audio-only (whilst dog walking) so I have cancelled as it is too expensive for an audio service
We love wondrium, though we usually watch the classes on our rucu i use android app to scan for courses.
Excellent content, but the app is a little cumbersome to use. Would be wonderful to have a dedicated Android TV app.
Absolutely adore the content, but the app has some playback issues (pauses, cuts back to older lectures).
The content is wonderful, the app is clunky to use.
90s actors, and dialogue was killing me. Love the secret societies docs.

The content is fantastic but there are some minor complaints. I wish there was a way to see subcategories of subjects. I also would like it if there was a feature that allowed me to view the introductions to various courses in quick succession, sort of like an educational version of TikTok. It'd be a cool way to explore different courses without having to manually search for everything.
Great app, very helpful ..-------.. solid A---

I was interested in Wondrium, but the low rating put me off. So, I didn't download it. Then I saw a paper brochure that they had sent to someone I know (brilliant idea) and I decided to download it. Literally the only problem I've had with the app is where to start watching! This app is FILLED with amazing, well produced and thoughtful content. I highly recommend it. If you have a curious mind and want to continue learning in a fun way, download Wondrium.

Excellent value for the money. I listen to lectures in audio format when I'm driving for work and watch the videos when I have time at home. Seamless transitions between the two make it possible to keep up no matter what you're doing. I've learned so much thanks to these guys from Great Courses and Wondrium is just a step up in content. The only downside is poor app integration across devices. Don't count on seeing this on flex boxes, game consoles, or some other streaming devices.

There's so much content, and such a wide variety of lectures and courses to choose from along with guidebooks. Another awesome feature that's extremely useful for me is the ability to quickly switch from video format to audio format whenever I have to go somewhere or do something. My only recommended improvement would be to add something like a monthly credit to buy a singular lecture or course, and own it forever. Similar to Audible. All in all, great app. Recommend it a lot. üëç

This app has been amazing, there are so many learning opportunities. I've been listening mainly to history lectures as I work from home but there is so much more I'd love to dive deeper into when I have time. There was recently an issue where my subscription was canceled without my input but they helped me sort that out. Something to do with Google play, not the apps fault. Point being, they have always been very helpful to me when I need it.

I love this app and I was doing a free trial for the quarterly subscription, but I couldn't sign in into my account except by linking to it via email. That's very aggravating. I've created a new account, but I had to cancel my free trial. I want to be able to sign into my account no matter what browser or device I chose to use if I'm going to pay for the service. Update: got a prompt reply to my email and the problem has been fixed! Kudos for excellent customer service!

I love learning new things and I used to scour YouTube for documentaries to watch or listen to on different subjects. I found out about The Great Courses Plus through the Timesuck podcast. I love that I can find anything I can think of to be curious about, and I can get a truly deep dive into any of those topics that you just can't get from a documentary. The ability to stream audio and not just video is amazing since most of my learning time is while I'm working.

**edited** problems with CC was addressed. I really like the content but the new app has major issues. Ive lost track of where I was in my courses because everything reset to lesson one. My biggest issue there are no longer subtitles available. Considering Ive been using subtitles since I subscribed and were available on courses I was watching I'm very unhappy with this change. Playback also frequently stalls out and then jumps forward so things have to be replayed to be able to understand.

Basically gives you free college courses on your own time from home! If you call Wondrium (before signing up) they'll give you a code to pay 1/2 price forever! Works on my Roku, firestick, & Android. When I use on my Android, app gives you choice of video or audio only. Listening with audio allows my screen to go dark while still playing. New courses always being added, a favorite list, & great search option. A+

GREAT APP, HORRIBLE CONTENT. The app works perfectly and I appreciate the ability to switch to audio-only mode. The problem is, I have yet to find a course that isn't hideously outdated, both in sciences and in social courses. Maybe there are some up to date courses there, but I'm done searching and being disappointed. Thank you app developer, your app is great and that's what the 5 stars are for.

Love the services, but wish the app loaded content faster. Sometimes I hit my Watchlist and it's empty, usually have to exit and load it again or just wait a long time. It hasn't been a big enough issue to drop to 4 stars. I also wish there was an option for full screen viewing.

So much to watch. Have music on in the background. Use Closed Captioning. I prefer how the Instructors are aware of the audience, with a few slides shown also. Cheaper than buying each course separately, for darn sure. I don't get the DVDS but I can watch them here. Or audio only.

I've seen some negative reviews but I've been nothing but happy with the app so far. I really like how you can go from video to audio then back again pretty seamlessly. This is great because I was using audible almost exclusively for the great courses and this subscription is almost $5 cheaper per month. All the same courses are here on this app plus you get video. I'm completely happy with this app on my phone and on my Amazon fire stick. Love it.

I like this service. There doesn't seem to be another like it. While other learning apps focus on career advancement, this app is for people who just like to learn new things. I was one of those weird people who enjoyed being in class more than partying while at college, and this service captures what is like to be in class. I really enjoy being engrossed in lectures by professors who are knowledgeable and passionate about what they teach.

What is going on? I have read a lot of the reviews and I am stymied. I have had very little problems other than entire courses not loading to read about individual lectures; but that's been resolved. My interface is through the Kanopy app and all free through my library. All problems are quickly resolved through Kanopy. Yes courses are limited and kind of old but it's over a hundred easily and always adding more. So, some of the courses I would like to see will entail me to buy the steaming.

This is a blessing for anyone who is interested in learning. There are a wide range of subjects to explore. Very good content, taught by the very best teachers . Thanks for creating this wonderful learning platform.

When first engaging with Domestika, it wasn't as obvious as other online apps to make progress through the course. However once I got going I enjoyed the interface and the rich visual experience.
Its frustrating how the downloaded videos don't auto sort into the correct order.

Domestika provides a wide variety of great courses taught by experts in their respective field. Despite any language barriers, the courses are accessible with captions and translations that make it easy to feel as though you are participating with other users in a coherent way. The technical side of the app itself is quite solid with only minimal bugs and crashes. I recommend it to anyone willing to learn a new skill without breaking their budget.
The course is excellent, but the English subtitles are not! There are a couple of places where this presents a problem. The app works well, though I have to periodically (in the same day) re-sign in.
I've been using this app for my 'adulting break' courses, and I love it. The classes are so interesting and the educators make it manageable and fun.

I really enjoy using the app, there's no issue navigating, finding new courses... However, it would be nice to be able to play videos in the background and not have them stopped when not on the course's page. You also can't see your wishlist with the app. Plus, this might just be a me thing, I like/hate the horizontal bar on the lecture's page, guess it's because it keeps me from scrolling üòÖ...

My recommendation would be to include a wishlist feature where learners can keep a catalogue of courses they are interested for the future but not ready to purchase at the moment. Overall the app is simple and straight forward to use. I had no issues with the translation features for courses that were not spoken in English. Love the collection of creative courses to choose from!

I love this app. Very easy to find courses and enrolled through the phone. The only thing I would like is for my courses' content/videos to be displayed in a vertical list instead of a horizontal list. Scrolling horizontally isn't efficient as my phone is very narrow and the screen is curved. Sometimes by accident I hit the phone's gestures while looking for the videos I left on and exit the app by mistake which is very annoying.

One of my courses don't show up on "my courses" tab, although it shows up in my profile tab. When I click the course I just get a blank screen and nothing else happens. Other courses don't have this issue. I also can't find this one course when I search it, so I think there may be something blocking it on the app (coz I don't have any issues on the web version). The course is "daily sketching for creative inspiration" by Sorie Kim.

On android, the videos are of great quality but when watching on iPad 2019 - not so much. I hope dubbing will be done in the future (like how Netflix does it) because instead of focusing what is done in the lessons, I am busy with reading subtitles. And I don't like pausing and pausing every frame. That's why I haven't finish any of the 9 courses I previously purchased but you keep asking for feedback thru emails which I never answered back. Overall, I like this purchase one-time than subs.
it's really good to learn here. Everything is in well mannered position. the only bad thing is the the , discount code for next course expire in 48 hours. it's really bad and disappointing.

Fabulous courses.. but quite hard to find courses to.put in a bundle. Once you find them you can put them in a group, but you can't search for them in the app, you have to scroll down a list to find them. Also I understand a bit of Spanish but I made the mistake of getting a Procreate course in Spanish and of course all the names of the settings are in Spanish which made it quite difficult to guess what the teacher was clicking! Wasn't that much use... thankfully they have an English one now.

love the content, it is especially stimulating to creative/artistic mind,so much to choose from.Each course so tempting,that I want to keep learning. The only issue is when I have to read and reread the English subtitles and in the flow I get distracted and loose intrest. Another issue I faced is that the resources and examples too are from Spain and I don't relate to them as well. but that said I still love Domestika!
I really like the app, the only problem I found until now is that I have been receiving coupon or voucher discount directly to my email and when I try to use them, they don't work.
Please also add a cart feature on mobile app. It's so weird there's no cart icon...

The app makes it easy to download lessons so I can watch them without wifi when I'm in a remote area. The only difficulty is deciding which course to do next. Great selection of craft & career courses. Most classes are in Spanish but the subtitles are pretty good/context clues are easy. I've taken a handful of 'content for Instagram' type courses and some on miniature sewing and have loved everything so far! The classes have been fun and challenging without being overwhelming. Missed my first class because of a player error on Chrome and edge. Tried this app and it didn't work either. I finally tried Chrome on my phone and it worked... After I missed the first quarter of the lesson. Not a good first impression. And the only support option I saw was an ai bot. Oh and God forbid you get a phone call during the session. Plus it says the recording is now available since I missed most of it due to technical issues, but of course it's not. Unbelievable.

Not only do you pay a monthly subscription fee but you pay for class materials as well it is quite a racket they have going. On top of that you are inundated with messages through email and text about EVERYTHING!!!! I easily got at 6 - 7 emails and another 6 -7 texts each and every single day. Plus the app set notifications as well. The information in the classes were just not worth the hassle.

More of a hassle. I was interested in some of the course options. I signed up for the free 4 week trial. I attempted to cancel 3 days into the free trial, it took a survey, multiple questions, and still was directed to call in. Two months later I was charged $69.99 for a service I thought was canceled and never accessed the content. And still am being pushed around about getting my refund.

Very misleading. Was very interested until the immediate "purchase course materials" popped up for $40 along with several other "optional" purchases that seemed essential. The whole point in starting the trial was the fact it was free. If your faced with obstacles that will not allow you to properly take part in the course unless you make a purchase, why do you advertise it as "free"? Further more, after reading comments that others have left, I'm wondering if in fact I will be charged anyway.

Attempted several times to cancel subscription before I was charged seeing that the platform isn't as helpful as it could be. I call to cancel and the automated system sent me through the same list of options several times with no option to speak to a person and my account was still charged, though I was never even able to attend a full class. I am very disappointed at the tedious nature of the cancelation process.

I definitely give a 5 star rating for the courses as they are very detailed informative and helping with my personal growth as well as my lone of work. It's the ongoing system issues that is driving me up the wall. The app is not working for me all I get is a blank scene with a blue circle loading in the middle of the screen but nothing loads just keeps spinning. Some courses I should have completed already but all I get is coming soon the entire module 4.

Not a great app. I never really got to try the courses. It might be ok, but the pricetag is pretty hefty. The free trial is a joke. No one should have to go through four prompts with the option to continue to cancel subscription being grayed out until they ultimately have to call a number to cancel. Not to mention you can only call during business hours even though it's an automated process

The app overall is OK, apart from the fact it keeps pushing pop ups about buying something EVERY TIME you go in it. I don't like their business model, they give you a 1 month free trial which is restricted to the first month of classes (the most basic aspects), you can't browse any of the content of the following month. You also can't start classes right away and you have to schedule all of them, instead of giving you the option to watch them on demand.

They promoted a course for free so I made an account. What they don't tell you is they take 50 cents from you and that you have to pay for tools for the free course. But you don't find that out until afterwards of course. I tried to cancel and their customer service is as bad as Sprint. I had to go through many tabs and keep pressing "cancel course trial" more than once. Then after that you can't even cancel. You have to call a number, which they don't even answer, so either way you're screwed.

Worst experience ever with an Institute. All they want is your money and give you nothing in return. I tried to end my membership for almost 2 months while they still took payment. When I eventually did manage to cancel it, they then took 3 separate payments 2 months later for something I'm still trying to figure out what for and they won't refund me. I haven't used the platform for months but still they charge me after countless attempts to end. I would not recommend anyone to use this.

DONT NOT TRY!!! I made the mistake of trying it out with TMOBILE discount. The always freezes when you go into the membership payment section to cancel. Not only that they still charged me even after I did, they said it hadn't gone through on their end, and I'm still being charged one month later. I've had to make a claim with my bank because "they dont do refund". Instead I'm being offered a one year package valued at about $800. Wow! Shows the value of the courses when they cant refund $70.

Worst courses ever. Not live, even though they say they are. It told me I missed one even though I'd watched it. No replay button if you miss one. You to reschedule since they're "live" The courses aren't fully available without having to purchase pieces as you go- things like study guides and quizes! Even though I tried to cancel, it still charged me, and I still don't even have access to the full course. Complete RIP off and waste of time. There are much better apps out there like Kahn Academy

It just sucks. The issues are many. 1. The app doesn't sync well. At all. Adding a class to your schedule doesn't show up on your learning plan. It does however, register on the back end. This is evident because they send notifications about your next class. Which is my next issue. 2. Intrusive notification. You will get reminders at 12am or later in the evening reminding you about your class. Clicking the link opens up a web browser instead of the app. The link is functional, but innacurate.

[Update: finally successfully canceled. Except now I'm getting spam texts too.] More like a scam than a school. To cancel my free trial, you have to call in with a member ID, that is not in the app, only the webpage. It's an automated system but you still have to call at certain hours. I've canceled twice in 3 days and still get emails. My account still says I'm subscribed. Trying to view help page in app says page doesn't exist. When calling it assumes I'm someone else.

Ridiculous. I purchased a lifetime membership just to get inside and learn that a good portion of the classroom materials cost more. And it isn't a small fee for the whole class, but $35 per module of each class. And the class I wanted had 6 modules. Then, the timing of the classes is required to be scheduled. And the notifications if you miss, are late, or even have an upcoming class is just overwhelming! I do not recommend!!!

It is a completely scam! I have a lifetime membership but now I have to pay hundreds of dollars to be able to see the slides and assignments It is nothing special at all. It is getting from bad to worse.

The app can't be opened and keeps on loading. Quite disappointed because I really wanted to have class using my phone but right now I can't. Seems that I am forced to have class in laptop or in a browser.

Be very careful with this app. I downloaded it 1y ago. An accidental push of the wrong button i got charged $69. Videos of digital marketing and other courses are not playing.

The courses are informative and eye opening but, the bad thing is that the instructor goes really quickly and you cannot pause or stop the session. When the class is done, they say you can "re-watch" the session but that is not the case. I tried doing that because I missed some important notes, but it never let me re watch anything. Please fix that, everyone has different learning styles and paces!

This app sends way too many notifications. And they are mostly to say "you've missed a class, reschedule", even though I was in the class. Occasionally, my classes will also disappear from my class list, too. I've been very happy with how the courses are taught and the amount of information given in them, but the constant bombardment is a bit much, and the phone calls are extremely unnecessary.

I was extremely excited to dive into learning more about data analysis but this course is disappointing at best. The additional packet of information they charge for is NOT worth the purchase. It contains nothing more than the word-for-word script used during "class". I was really hoping for additional information to help me learn. The examples are not easy to follow, as they leave out important steps (I assume they think you already know some of this stuff). I was disappointed to learn I could not get a refund, instead they gave me access to another course. Well, the 1st wasn't easy to navigate, not really sure how much better or useful taking another course would be.

The course looks as if it will be fun and interesting. But I'm very disappointed that it appears the lessons are not kept up to date. In my first lesson there are 2 recommended software downloads. One has been discontinued and the other has quite a few newer versions available from what is listed in the lesson. I'm not sure which version I should download if any and I don't know a replacement for the discontinued one. No support on weekends is another disappointment.

Though there is quite a bit of good information, it is very misleading and full of SPAM. The 4week course to get certified, is actually 1 of 8 segments you need to get the certificate. Once you enroll/sign up, the texts, emails and notifications are endless! At least 2 every hour. And it is not linked to your actual account. While in the class I got a notification that I had missed the class and need to reschedule...? And from what I've read I'm not looking forward to the cancellation process...

My experience over the past year was great, so much so that I became a lifetime member. The courses and the instructors were excellent. My problem is this now, I got a new phone and a chromebook and am unable to download and open the course on either device. I am still able to access the app and courses on my PC, but, not on the aforementioned, new devices that would allow me to access my courses and materials on the go.

Sadly free doesn't mean free anymore these days. All course material requires payment during the "free trial" and canceling was pretty difficult. The cancelation team was quite rude when I turned down their offers for more "free trials". I just wanted to cancel so I don't get charged, not hung up on. I'll file a charge back with my bank if I get charged. Don't say I didn't try.

When I saw this on facebook it sounded really cool, but when I started using it I found that the lesson didn't even play, and would glitch out part way through, leading me to not "finishing" a class. To the developers, Doesn't it make more sense to allow students to watch lessons ahead of schedule, if you can already watch them later, just seems to me like a moot point to disable watching a video, days, or even minutes before you had scheduled it. If you change that I would def try again.‚úå

I've had an awful time trying to attend class. Each time the hour came at count down, the screen would appear and freeze with no sound. When I tried dialing back in, the class was only available to watch as a recording or reschedule for the NEXT day or so!! Exasperating to say the least!! I got through 3 lessons which were interesting and informative, however, the continuous need to reschedule was infuriating!!

There were too much advertising and promoting. I signed up for 1 course, 4 weeks and received a LOT of notifications and emails before the course even started!ü§¶ When you miss a class, you should be able to just click on a replay vs reschedule as that would delay it longer. It wasn't very easy to navigate through the app to either start the new class or view the one missed.

The classes are good, you can only access the recording after your scheduled class, you can't skip ahead if the class is covering something you already know, notifications are very annoying, the subscription is difficult to cancel. They make canceling your subscription extraordinarily difficult. You have to hit continue about 5 times and then you end up having to call. I ended up just putting a stop payment through my bank because that was easier than trying to deal with canceling through Shaw

The marketing team for this marketing education company emails their customers like no other. Content is passable but it's not worth the number of spam pop-ups. They want you to buy a digital certificate when you complete each module and it's all one click buy. Oh and the fact you have to watch a pre recorded class at a certain time is super inconvenient. You also can't pause the video... You can go back and rewatch videos after you've sat through the class but your first pass is a no go.

- while the recording is being played on the phone, it cannot change orientation to landscape - recording is more than 2yrs old. Too much pleasantries at the beginning of the lesson - recording is locked. Cannot move back or forward if you missed something or want to be sure if you heards the right word 10sec before - cant seem to make the video cannot go full screen on phone - if you accidentally close the video on the phone, you have to start all over again with the recording

Not a great app, really needs work considering they have an entire class on mobile app development. Doesn't alert you to classes like it used to, rarely plays the class videos or recordings, you can't contact the teachers during class or at all on the app, cannot get into tests, only assignments, and you can't get the video to go to full screen; really I just expected better.

Misleading! Was told my free trial was for the course also. Just figuring out, It's not free! There is a price per module. (4 Module's for this course.) I kept getting alerts to buy a e-certificate first. While I was waiting to begin module 2 it just never happened. So In my slight confusion I sent an email for help, to no avail., no responses. Sucks. Although I liked my first thoughts on it better, App is well designed.

Can you please update your app!? It hasnt been working for awhile now and from reading the reviews it seems like 90% of the people trying are also not able to get it to work! The website is not the same as the app and it would be really convenient if you could just get it to work properly again!

the quality of education is not good
