The pros for sololearn is that it's easy to digest the material in small blocks, and it makes it possible to learn when you have time. The cons are that in the free version if you lose your hearts you're locked out until they refill or you spend blocks. Also, if you fail to meet a case that is locked to paid teir then you are unable to examine it. I probably would have gotten a subscription, but seeing how you are punished on the free teir I don't find this very conducive to learning.

Major bugs! Multiple users experience a variety of bugs including but not limiting to issues with compiling code or answers being wrong when they are correct (reselecting the same answer after getting it wrong then says it's correct), issues also include not being able to click on notifications to go to the actual thing being notified of (warning message pops up saying to update to latest version of the app even when app is freshly installed and updated fully.) When you email them they dontreply

I accept that this app is probably great for some but it isn't the tool for everyone. Not everyone learns the same way and the tutorials can be extremely confusing. This is possibly because I learn different than the way it teaches. The layout is easy to manage but it really makes me have to read multiple useless comments before I find someone that actually explains it the way I understand. By the time I find it, I then have to go back and reread what I was trying to learn. Interest lost..

This a great app for learning but it doesnt recognize your level for the player vs player challenges. So the program ends up asking questions that you haven't covered yet. It would also be nice of it told you the correct answers when you get them wrong. Then it throws Javascript at you in the HTML5 course. This makes it impossible to try and understand what its referring to since that's covered in a later section.

Although this is a good app for learning, it doesn't explain some of the things its teaching better nor give good examples. It feels like it's built for those who have experience. There is the comment section but that doesn't help much either. What also discouraged me from investing is the fact I was told I was getting bits for the streaks for logging on daily but did not receive anything. And this happened twice.

This app used to feel a lot less intrusive, but there has been more accidental clicks on ads, as well as requests to fill out this very review. Your content is good, just understand that the constant attack of ads doesnt make some people buy the subscription, especially when they are so many other apps doing this very thing, with less garbage.

This app is very easy to use and functions similarly to Duolingo for language. Unfortunately, its major weakness is that it is very easy to get through and entire course and feel like you've learned nothing. The app isn't engaging in that regard, but it is very user friendly and has a good system for color coding and separating code to practice with.

I am only giving this 3 stars because of the inability to compare and contrast your progress. Despite being able to restart a course, there's no way to know if you have made any progress with your learning. Learning computer coding languages are difficult. It would be nice to see how much I improve on my ability to complete a course per restart.

so far I have been using app for about 1 week and I have not had any problem with app. some of the lessons do not seem to have clear instructions but I think this might be from my lack of experience with the subject or that I am not naturely someone who pays attention to small details. I use Duolingo and the format reminds me if that. I would like the app to make suggestions for writing a code that does something similar to the example without all the lines there. practices makes progress

Really bad challenge questions that really are super random difficulty and should only ask questions based on what YOU have covered. I will have quizzes that bounce between what does HTML stand for in the same quiz as defining a fieldset which wasn't even in any of the lessons yet. On top of that, the lessons are easy to follow only sometimes, otherwise I find myself going and looking up information on w3 schools or another site. Overall this app seems to have some good info but it's not great.

I have used Sololearn to learn the basics of new languages for a few years now, and it is still a good app to learn with. However, at some point full screen video ads were added that play after you complete a lesson. Normally I would be fine with this since it is a free app, however lessons are very short, so these videos play constantly and are very much a nuisance. This, along with practice lessons for certain languages being locked behind a paywall, have lessoned my opinion of this app.

ONLINE ONLY. Free version allows one practice per course, paid version allows more practice, but no explanation to help you through them. Information sections are short with only one example per idea, so it is hard to solidify the syntax order on complex topics. Overall, it will help you understand, but supplemental practice/courses WILL be needed for fluency.

I was at first please with the App & it's approach with teaching coding.. Until I quickly realized. That the"Tap to Try", feature, Only allows you to try another Add Sign-Up option... Is this the way it was tended to be? No opportunity for full use of App's learning capability, In the hands on experience level? If so, my opinion is that it is not enough to convince me to purchase anything. If anything it seems like a gimmick, to allow some thing then remove access without a heads-up, or notice

14 day free trial is actually 4 days. Pretty shady. I wish there were more practices for each topic. You get one real coding practice per topic so nothing really sticks. You end up having to go back and review a lot of the syntax before you can finish the coding portions. It's not that I don't know how to go about doing the task, I just don't remember the syntax or function name since I only read it once or twice before the coding test. Needs more repetition to actually learn to code.

I'm not impressed. This app gives information that valuable for a learner but just barely. It is not my Idea of a well developed tutorial on any subject. Maybe I'm not being fair... it just seems to me like each lesson on any given subject is so shallow because I already know the subject matter and because I also study subject's using other apps that allow a much more in-depth learning experience. For example: each lesson could offer the learner speciallittleachievementsorscorefor redoinglessons

I haven't really used the app that long, but it's pretty solid so far. Especially since I have no coding experience at all. I think it's pretty fun. The only annoyance I have is that for some reason my authenticator on my Android phone wants to save every session as a password which is weird but is what it is. I have to have my authenticator though for my job and emails.

It's pretty helpful and take things at a nice place, while the online courses I looked at, while helpful, we're a flood of info and it was hard to digest. One complaint I have is every time I close and open the app again, I have to go through the process of choosing what I want to learn, how I learned before, age, etc, every time... Even though once I get past that all my details are the same and my progress remains. It gets annoying.

Good but the premium features make the app almost unusable (what I mean by this is at no point did I feel the premium features were ever needed, but instead felt more like a pop-up ad if you don't let apps collect data. I feel this is simply inconvenient) Sololearn does offer a variety of options and it is a good platform. I don't want to leave behind a negative impression or anything.

I was looking for a place to practice what I was learning in C from other sources, and found it suitable. As a stand alone learning platform I am not sure it is entirely sufficient. As a supplement, it seems to be a good addition to someone's arsenal for learning programming. The ability to freely practice on a mobile device and learn from others examples is great.

Out of all of the coding teaching apps I've used, this one seems to have the most options available to learn. The practice challenges can be a struggle at times. I've seen some challenges that started off with syntax errors and sometimes the IDE doesn't work as well as visiting this site on a computer. But overall, this is a great app to keep practicing on the go. I recommend using a computer for solo learn whenever able. Though would like there to be a way to test our excercises.

Very helpful for learning basics! And the Comments of every exercise are a treasure trove of people helping each other with further tips, tricks, and pointers. To play around with the code on your own it seems that you have to have the paid "Pro," so you might have to find another free program for sandboxing or experimenting, but all in all this is an amazing resource. Just go slow and steady and DON'T try to race through, and take notes while you go.

I feel like I'm learning a lot and retaining it b/c the info is presented in small, easy to understand chunks with short examples, quizzes, and a practice problem to do right after learning the info. It makes sense! It would be helpful if there were more practice problems that were optional, but available to the learner if they want to do them.

Thos is probably the best way to organize an immersive learning experience on your phone. For me, it would be better if the lesson and the "try it yourself" appeared in separate panes on the same page rather than linking to it and going back and forth, but the fact that you actually get the oppportunity ro try it rather than rolling through lessons and passing multiple choice tests aids in retention much better than most training apps in the same field.

I'm impressed with how smoothly I'm progressing through the lessons. I've noticed a few things that seem to be minor typos, and I haven't encountered a feature that explains the correct answers for each exercise between lessons. But I can see myself using this for a long time. I appreciate the bookmark feature. And I'm impressed with the degree of instruction achieved in each short lesson.

The app is useful to reinforce the basics. Lessons are short and concise which makes it great for passing time and exploring different languages. It loses a star based on the fact that it asks you to upgrade(not a problem), but does not list what you get with the upgrade. All in all, a fun easy distraction.

SoloLearn has some excellent starting points to get one into understanding a language and its structure. Some of the continuing content is monotonous as it is community based. There are many individuals who want to stand out in the crowd but basically copy what someone else has already done and call it there own. I would still recommend it base courses.

EDIT: it IS free, my apologies. Later modules have a lock icon and can't be clicked, which makes it look like you need to have a membership in order to access them. You just need to complete the prior module. Lots of apps use a lock icon to indicate premium content that isn't free. My mistake. There is an opportunity here for the developer to improve the UX.

4* only because it explains the system But it doesn't go into detail. all my answers i found through the community. it is essential for progress and should not be considered a self learning app. you can learn alone but though Q&A and research. Overall a good app but confusing for a beginner like me. Still, worth the money. There is more than a single program here and it has trophies and badges to keep you motivated and on track. This is a community and not just an app with text.

Used the free version to almost complete C, and then used it again to get about 75% through python core. If this is all your using to learn, then you'll definitely need pro. If you pair it with a book or two, you can get away with just using the free version, by doing the exercises in the book. They added way more ads recently, which sucks. It's very annoying. Just purchased pro yesterday and it's way better than the free version was last year. Use the free version for a while then go pro.

none of the ?s or quizzes have you code from scratch so it's not very challenging. I strongly recommend checking the comments after each section, even the easy ones. fellow programmers share much more useful practical information. treat this app as a replacement for solitair while waiting in line for groceries, not a replacement for actual courses.
A pretty alright playground for beginners
I'm really enjoying the experience so far so good.

I am pleased to have found this app. I'm using the free version and it's much more informative and detailed than other apps I've tried and hardly any ads! If i had the money, I would invest in and suggest the pro version as I think it would offer deeper understanding. If i would change anything it would only be how the comments box bounces. Its probably just me but I find it difficult to focus with it jumping as it does. Thanks guys

While, I havent used it for long This made it suuper easy for me to start learning C#. On top of that it tries to make sure you understand all the concepts. You do have to stick with it tho to be able to learn effectively. Overall, great app. Especiallyfor people like me, that cant learn with some guy in our face talking about a float or a double like we know the pure basics. Or reading a book that makes no sense. Also, I havent really experienced any ads. Not yet anyway.

The interface is theme-appropriate and easy to navigate. The content is fabulous and it demystifies the world of coding. It feels like someone is holding my hand through all of this. Plus it has some playful aesthetic elements and features similar to Duolingo. Fantastic app for total beginners and beyond!

Good for refreshing or practicing fundamental skills in a decent enough selection of languages. This wont make you a programmer on it's own, but it can get you started. Has easy to follow lessons, a good amount of them in the free version and it's simple to use. Alongside real programming practice and classes it's a great tool.

Very accessible, instructive lessons. Have only just started but the free version is enough for my needs thus far. Perhaps if I were relying on this as a primary education method I would pay the subscription, but for an entrant such as myself, this is perfect. Update: I am now using Sololearn to prepare for a coding bootcamp, and have subscribed to the service. It has been very helpful so far, and (compared to the bootcamp) the subscription is very affordable. Has bumped up a 4 to a 5 star.

Small bite sized lessons that are easy to absorb. You can always go back and review lessons you've already completed if you need to. Lessons need to be completed in order to unlock the next one to keep you from getting ahead of yourself and getting overwhelmed and quitting. The try it yourself code playground text editor in each lesson is fun to test what you've learned. Didn't think learning to code could be this easy, convenient and enjoyable! Awsome app! Loving it!!! üëçüòä

I usually don't leave reviews, but this app has been so helpful and educational. I've learned so much in a short period of time. The lessons are simple and condensed, and make it super easy to learn small bits throughout the day, or a lot at once in a binge. It organizes the lessons in a sensible way, and where most textbooks would make the lessons overwhelming to look at, this app breaks everything into pieces and makes it easy as possible to learn. Highly recommended.

Short lesson and review is extremely helpful for those with a busy life. I can hop on, run through 2 or 3 sections and learn the basics. The competition portion helps to keep people motivated and makes it more entertaining to learn. The amount of languages is very impressive for a free app that is stable and easy to read through. The community is fantastic. If you don't understand the material based on the way the app explains it, go to the comments section for a better explanation! Love it!

This app reminds me of a coding version of duolingo. However that doesn't do it justice. This app makes me feel more motivated to continue onto the next set of studying because each block is relatively short (approx 3-5 questions per) and you can see the next blocks that you have left. It doesn't feel overwhelming or make you feel like you're not getting anywhere. That's what I think this app has over the other ones. And if you do have to pause, you can easily bookmark it. 5/5

It is a good stepwise learning experience, presented in small bit size pieces. As it is easy to step your way through the tutorial, I will personally need to revisit the the various sections and practice a great deal for information retention. I have had a good deal of experience in some older languages. This makes it easier to grasp most of the concepts, but it appears to be presented in a way that should make it useful to new students also.

Great app so far, very well laid out courses that won't leave you hanging, there is a chat that people can post in specifically for that section of the lesson, and there is a ton of great information on there too, everything is in the app, the ads a little confusing at first, and so is the course layout, but once you get through it it's fine, the ads between courses are short and give you a small breather between lessons. I did the HTML, and I'm almost done with CSS, then JavaScript next...

I love this app, I 100% recommend it to anyone that is getting into programming. This app has tons of programming languages to learn, it's amazing. It's been only a few hours and my understanding of c# is much much better! The ads aren't even annoying, you don't get many ads at all, and when you do you either have to wait 5 seconds, or you can close it instantly. Amazing app, definitely use it if your trying to learn any programming language.

I love this App. I have been working on programming for a little while and I finally started taking formal classes Thanks to this app, I have a lot of experience and I am learning that I already knew the majority of the skills. There are a few shortcomings: certain lessons such as the algorithm lesson are incomplete, that is to say, they don't present concrete examples of how to implement the algorithms which left me fairly confused. There also seems to be a stigma that beginners are capable of creating somewhat complicated programs such as the challenge to turn a string of a date into a date that references a day of the week. Even with all the formal lessons and Solo Learn lessons, so still can't figure out that one. While it's probably simple but it probably isn't incredibly simple.

By far the best way to learn coding that i've found so far. It's core features are free, they teach a wide variety of languages, and it's functional on mobile. Their lessons are sometimes a little confusing, but i think that just has to do with the difficulty of the subject taught. But that's not an issue because each lesson has a comment section below it that will explain things even better than the lesson did. Overall, 10/10 app. I've recommended it to many people already

I've tried a few programming education apps over the last year, and uninstalled half of them. This one has stood the test of time with me. Tons of lessons and exercises available on a free plan, which I've been using most of the time. Recently got a trial of the Pro plan, which has even more. Plenty of community explanations available when stuck.

My kids' school encouraged it's use at one point, but I've never been impressed by it. We tried it for a while, but it has a LOT of bugs that make it unusable, irritating, time-concerning, and expensive. As a SW Architect/Developer of many years, I sum it up as "great concept but VERY poor execution". Interviewed for a job with them, hoping to make it better, but what I learned during the interview turned me off COMPLETELY. Glad it is an epic tool for some, but it's an epic fail in my book.

Wonderful app. My daughter loves it. However, I upgraded to Unlimited through Google Play but the upgrade is not reflected in the app. She still can't access what she wants, and it still shows up as Epic Free. I submitted a support request days ago with a copy of the receipt and I haven't heard a word. No one gets back to you. My advice is to stay on the free side until they fix the upgrade issue and until they have the capacity to deal with their support tickets.

They must be about to shut this app down. There is no other reason for the rapid decline of this service. When we first signed up ~ 1 year ago, it was good. All books were good & age-appropriate for my 4 yo. She liked the badges & seeing the progress bar really motivated her to keep reading. Now it's a real piece. Most of the time it gets stuck on the loading screen, she's capped out at level 23. Progress bar is grayed out & there are no more badges to earn. Thereare no quality books anymore.

Epic app never works! On tablet or phone it forces you to download the app. Once downloaded it is sooooooo slow that it crashes every time. Epic free doesn't seem to be available anymore even though they said it's available. I am so disappointed with this company. Thanks for wasting our time.

User interface needs some work since you're unable to search by age range. You can only filter the search results after picking a topic. It would be far more useful to browse by appropriate material rather than topic alone. I LOVE this app. My daughter loves this app. The books are adorable, and there's even some of her favorites. However, I gave it 3 stars because there has been a handful of times we start listening to a Read To Me book and the narration stops completely or starts and stops. If that could be fixed I would absolutely give 5 stars AND purchase the unlimited membership!

I'm going to split my review into two parts: Epic's content: We originally got Epic through school. We have access to 6 different services for our kids to read. Of all of them Epic is the best so we decided to subscribe. It's easy to use and the kids are actually excited to read on Epic. The Android app: It works fine but is missing some key features. No way to download books or audio books for offline usage in the car. Also when playing an audiobook you can't use the phone for navigation.

I would have given this a 5 star before the last update. But since then, you can no longer turn your phone screen off! You have to leave it on the entire time! In the old version you could turn the screen off & continue to listen. But now my son is concerned about screen burn. He used to listen to them ALL THE TIME! But since he can no longer turn off the screen, he hates using it. The book selection is great but for $8 a month I should still be able to turn off my screen. Considering canceling

Updated review- We were very happy with the app at first, but it has a lot of bugs. Customer service is friendly,and tried to help, but the problems still persist. The app uses your 2 hours of after school time even though it says you have switched over to school time and then doesn't work for the week. Now it's not recording what books we have already read. Great concept, but needs a bit of work.

I wish this app would work for us, I installed it for my kids 3 year old and 5 year old. Both are learning to read, and could not read on their own yet. The problem is, this app shows all sorts of books, and doesn't label the books according to their appropriate age category. I don't see any option for filtering the books according to age, level of difficulty, or level of reading proficiency. So finding an appropriate book to read for my preschooler is a hit and miss. Also, the read to me option is not interactive at all, its like watching a video, not a reading experience. I want my kids to be able to read along, ie they should be able to follow the reader verbatim, and then flip the page at their own pace. I guess this app is not so suitable for early readers (pre-K or grade K).

We like this app, however, there are issues with it. Sometimes when we save books for offline, they don't save. The app closes and freezes alot. This gets frustrating. We love the audio books but really prefer the "read to me" section. It reads to them as well as lets them follow along with the story. Quizzes really help make sure they are paying attention. We also really love the added music/sounds that help bring the words to life and helps paint a clear picture in your mind of what is happening in the story. I have the unlimited and have an account for myself (30) , my oldest (9), my middle (3), and the youngest (2). We all LOVE epic reading!

I've been using Epic! with my now 4 year old for over a year. It's awesome. There are a plethora of great books. They miss many of my absolute favorites, but the ones they have are very good and we've found new favorites. And tons of audiobooks! Those are fantastic to have. However, finding all the books in a reading level is impossible, and I very much wish that was MUCH easier. I create lists myself and have found workarounds, but it's annoying and I wish we could search by reading level only.

This app is great! I like the variety of books available, though I hope the library continues to expand. The user interface is easy to navigate and I love being able to download for offline reading. Two things I'd like to see added are a repeat button so the littlest readers can easily replay the same book again and again. Add the ability to download the book from the non grid style list along with the available options, collection and/or favorite.

The best feature of this app by far is the appearance of the digital books, as compared with books on Amazon Freetime, which download slowly, and are hard to read until you double click the paragraphs, which is difficult to get right with a child, etc. Even the digital books on Libby are sometimes frustrating to read. Every book, audiobook, read-to-me books, and videos play seamlessly. The selection is excellent including books in Spanish! I also love that it's free to educators.

I Love this app! It's very fun for the kids have a list of their favorites and the "read to me" option is also good help, when I've got to help another child with their school work. Kids also get to change their profile pictures as they earn higher achievements. The only issue we've had... is that I can't seem to be able to link our already existing account, to his teachers group, with all of his classmates.

Love this app! A world of books for kids to read including old favorites and new books you would find on the shelves and in Scholastic. Read to me section is great and let's kids explore on their own even when you can't be there to read to them. I feel confident that when my kids watch the videos available that it is all kid friendly content.Truly wonderful and I reccomend it to all. *Please add a heart to each book on the menu so that we can press to add to favorites without opening the book.

This app has been a game-changer in my Pre-K classrooms. Not only do students have options for books that can be read to them, they also have access to relevant educational songs and learning videos (which teachers can also disable if they so choose). I love the ability to create Collections and send them to students based on interests, or reading levels. Students as young as mine also benefit from the class code sign in process.

Absolutely wonderful app for young readers! It has a wide selection of the best storybooks for children beginning with picture books and on. There are quite a few readers as well...honestly you must check it out to believe it. The illustrations in the books are beautiful and the readers for the Read with Me books and the audiobooks are absolutely excellent! Thanks for such a wonderful app for reading!

Love it!! I am a mother and all 4 of my kids use it. It's awesome that some of 4he hooks are read to you and the words are highlighted. It helps so much with my little ones and it has other books that you can read on your own. My kids use it when we are in the car and they just go from book to book. The app is easy to use for any kid and it's just a great amount of book options for many age groups.

Incredible way for my kids to enjoy reading and learning on the go no matter what we are doing they can read or be read to. They enjoy searching through the videos to watch something new. And most importantly I know they are safe with what they are reading/watching. They now easily read more then an hour a day. Not including listening to or reading stories while driving, brushing teeth, or while we are out and about shopping. We love the human voices and the dialogue is fun to listen too.

This app is amazing. My daughter is finishing kindergarten and its perfect for helping her read. She can try on her own, the app can read it to her while magnifying the word that it's speaking or of course I can read it with her. Some books have quizzes at the end while everything gives you points towards a level and unlocking achievement badges. On a galaxy s10 or even the desktop website, it's very user friendly. After school ends I will definitely be signing up again.

We love Epic! My kids have been using Epic at school and at home for a few years now, and it's been amazing. So convenient and they absolutely love earning new badges. That is great for me because it motivates them. They can also take the quiz's after reading, which prepares them for their A.R. tests at school! It's a win for everyone!

Amazing app. I only downloaded this app like two weeks ago but I'm loving all the stories and the narration and the little fox animal that gives a high five after each book completed. I have no problems using it and I hope it stays that way

It has been a great experience in epic books . It is a very fun digital reading app. It has just the perfect taste of which book you might like . I like it because it has any category I would ever want to read and it has books for any age level .

It's amazing you have a so many books to choose from and you can do read to me I could say it's a 5 star for are the mom and dads this is great for you child it has all the books but the thing is you have to pay if it's not in school hours so at the end of 2:45 you can not read anymore but it's very fun your kids will love it so for me I'm a kid and this is amazing my school has this and I really think you should get it there's not any add so I hope you anjoy your time it great u could try!!!!!

I lobe epic so much I can read books and waxh videos
is a wonderful app incressis reading skills love how t can read it to u

UI looks like cheap bargain bin, the first lesson got exited because I thought it was an ad. "Free now, pay later" vibe without getting to preview. Thanks for sending my data through the roof with a dozen tiny videos every lesson. Nope! Edit. Dude replying is probably an algorithm because I didn't even complain about the ads. Good job, idiot.

I don't get the high rating. The layout is poorly designed and you're bombarded with offers to upgrade. Because of the design, its difficult to even figure out how to continue for free past three words/phrases. Maybe that's on purpose. Then about a dozen words/phrases in, the on screenini keyboard wouldnt accept any typing anymore to type the answer, so it's stuck. Thats a bug, I assume. I think I could do better learning from websites.

This used to be my favorite language learning app, and I recently wanted to download it to work on some skills that have gotten rusty only to see that its completely changed. It used to have a super cute space theme amd learning new words grew flowers. It made me want to learn more, and it was visually appealing. This new app just looks bad and like it was thrown together. You guys had something good and completely ruined it.

This used to be a great app. The timing interval, and changing of that interval was (is) a great learning tool. But the new GUI is hideous! It HAS to go! What's the point of a great learning method if one can't find anything on the screen? Absolutely wretched. Guess I have to go back to Duolongo. At least until Memrise fires the new hot-to-trot MBA who came in thinking he/she knew how to spur growth. Great job. You're fired.

Okay so I had this app before, and when I switched phones it didn't transfer. So I got it again: the new version is utter nonsense. It requires a payment to learn anything at all. I was all the way through 3 courses on my old phone and I can't even catch up past one lesson. They changed the set up and the availability, and they killed ziggy. If your not planning on buying a subscription don't waste your time.

i've used this program in the past, about a couple of years ago, and it was great! i was able to access all lessons and i was even able to move up to the second level of the language i was learning. however, two years later, the app has suddenly become unavailable to anyone who doesn't have the means of paying. i attempted to use this app alongside my boyfriend to learn the same language together, however all but the first lesson for me has been locked, telling me that "a subscription is required" to continue. his lessons have remained unlocked, despite him not having a subscription. i wish to bring this up with customer support and get to the bottom of this. however, until then, i would suggest not downloading this app, especially if you don't have sufficient funds in their eyes

I loved the app, but the color change is uncomfortable to look at. the prompt for the full membership covers a significant portion of the screen and will not go away. I'm not going to give this app any money if it looks so unappealing. also? why is the flower animation so trash now? its low resolution and honestly just looks awful. I can't imagine looking at the old design and going through the process to make it look like this absolute eyesore. Disgusting.

I sort of like this app compared to Busuu, but Busuu has native teachers correcting grammar and pronunciation. This app has more repetition, which is good, but it is terribly confusing and I have no idea what is happening and what is free and what isn't. Basically, a good concept with very poor design. People want to learn a language! Not play games.

You have to spend money to progress/learn. After the first couple of levels you are pay walled. Pointless to use unless you are going to buy a subscription, but I guess that is the strategy behind marketing the app as "free." The layout of the app is cluttered, and the method of learning is not very dynamic. I'm going back to duolingo and busuu.

Fix your bugs or at LEAST give us the option to turn off pieces which aren't working. It's insane that you'd build this with no ability to turn off functions that don't work. Yeah, bugs happen in every piece of software and they are hard to figure out, but being constantly reminded to use the modules that have the bugs? Build that part better while you troubleshoot

Been using for around 3 years, liked the previous version better. Current 'reinvented' version is appalling and doesn't help concentrate on learning the language. You guys did a great job if your target audience is 10 year olds. Way to ruin the app by replacing all those good backgrounds and icons with blank backgrounds and children's drawings for icons It would be great if you could give the option to let the user choose the old theme. I will cancel my premium subscription if it doesn't improve

I keep seeing reviews that 90% of this app is free and yet I can't seem to access very much. All I can do is repeat the same 5 or 6 phrases and I'd really like to learn more! Not sure if there's a problem or if they changed their free content. I do like the real human pronunciation versus computer generated content that Duolingo uses.

Came back after a break, can't "learn" words I forgot only review. I need to straight up relearn them, the review system doesn't give the tools needed it's just a test. I reset my progress on each part of the BEST Irish course from the site, app still keeps my words learned. Deleted course and added it again, same deal. I can no longer progress with learning the language because the app just does not let me treat it as if I am a new learner. Unusable, would not recommend.

1st--the updated look is harsh and ugly, its actually unpleasant to use the app. 2nd-- It is not a deleted course or anything of the like. My progress in 3 levels of a language was lost and I have to start them over almost completely or skip the words, even though I want to be able to review those levels at times. It also keeps losing track of my streaks too, but that's not such a big deal, just noting another bug.

Bait and switch scam. The first level had videos and a lot of content. I had to pay to move up. I paid, and the next level was nothing but a little highly repetitive vocabulary. Of course they're keeping the money. Go else where, there are better apps that don't only have a good free level.
Is this a scam? I got auto-deducted $99.98 for an annual subscription. However, the app says I'm on a free version and there's a lifetime subscription that would cost me $99.98. Pls refund my money.
Everything about this is broken. It's trash. I want my thirty dollars back.

UI looks like cheap bargain bin, the first lesson got exited because I thought it was an ad. "Free now, pay later" vibe without getting to preview. Thanks for sending my data through the roof with a dozen tiny videos every lesson. Nope! Edit. Dude replying is probably an algorithm because I didn't even complain about the ads. Good job, idiot.
garbage, don't install it.
Full course was paid.. not batter than Duolingo..
I bought the pro version of this software, but none of the features were activated. Unfortunatelyüòûü•≤

It doesn't work anymore. Most of the time, cannot log in, if occasionally I managed to log in, it takes ages to load. The few times I managed to actually do some lessons, the audio doesn't work. This issue only occurs on the mobile app, but couldn't find any solutions. Used to be the best app to learn Icelandic, now impossible to use at all :(
Dosent have pashto
Unclear which courses are available in the app and those available exclusively on a browser.
No arabic.
The app is actively hiding most available languages from just the app. Why the hell am I only allowed to study my language of choice by first going through the website, and then the app?

I find all the recent reviews hard to understand/believe given a couple months ago they dropped the only feature the app had going for it (mems). Paid fake reviews? The app is only half of what it was, gladly this happened near the end of my language learning, but for all language students out there, go somewhere else.
No chatting with other people. The descrip gives the impression it could be possible, but absolutely no option for it. Deleted. Rewrite the descrip better, Memrise. AND DELETE MY ACCOUNT.
There was a much better version of this one, so I was very disappointed in the new oneüòêüòï
This app is very good My Spanish speaking is improving

Subscriber since 2020, unable to use app or see history now. My account was set to auto-renew in Jan '21 & '22 and I was charged. I hadn't used the app since 2022 renewal, but now, in September, all of my progress and history is gone... doesn't even show which language I was learning. Contacted support, they say can't find acct. Sent them pdf receipt for payment. Then they say 'all is good', but no, it's not. Sent screenshot of app with zero history or progress showing. Hopefully they'll fix.

Requested a refund after completing the first level as it's impossible to restart a level if you don't understand it. This is a basic function of a language learning course. Cannot believe you don't offer it. Going back to Duolingo where I can restart a level as many times as it takes me to understand it.

I tried intermediate Japanese. (I'm halfway through the duolingo course.) Memrise was too easy, there was no way to test out, and the choice of material seemed random. One good thing is how spaced repetition is implemented, that seemed effective. On day 4 i found an error in one of the videos that it was hard to believe a native speaker would make, and that was the last straw for me.

Used Memrise several years back (browser and app), decided to check it out again. The app is completely intolerable now because of the fullscreen video ads. However, if you are interested in Memrise I recommend checking out the browser version. There you can also search and enroll in user-made courses which you can use in the app.

I've had a subscription for two years now, but haven't been using the app much. I finally decided to jump back in and the new theme was a huge shock. Very loud colors on all white, in stark contrast to the old, relaxing space theme. Even the animations are more jarring, much less smooth than before. I want to say that I could get past this, but, going through the lessons is no longer enjoyable, so I may have to go back to Duolingo. An option to choose themes (or revert versiona) would be great!

I liked the app itself and am a subscriber. That said, the redesign is really bad. It might be fashionable, but it distracts from the learning process, it makes it hard to read the text, and it makes precious seconds in timed tasks get lost in trying to visually parse design elements. It is not good when your UI undermines the very reason your application is there. If I just tried MemRise out for the first time, I would not have stuck with it.

While the learning function is excellent, I'm changing my review from 5 to 2 stars because the new design is absolutley terrible. It's a huge step backwards from its previous charming spaceship theme that made the journey of learning languages feel so fun. The new design looks like a boring app that tried to be cool with the kids. If the intention was to be more "grown-up", it has failed spectacularly. At least make it so that the users have the option of switching back to the "classic" design.

App says it's free, but not even close. It only gives a very short intro to courses. my thing is, why am I going to pay ($30 BUT IT'S ONLY GOOD FOR TODAY!) however much it's supposed to go up to a year when I can't even preview the premium services? even one or two examples of each would make the sale. There is plenty of competition out there. uninstalled.

I really like the app, and although I'm not a huge fan of the all the design changes, I'm sure I'll get used to it. But, the new screen for introducing words/phrase for the 1st time is terrible. It's such a big change from the last layout that I no longer properly take note of the words because its a not consistent with the layouts of subsequent pages. My eyes now have to hunt for the translation of the word. As someone who's been using the app a lot, this is almost a breaking change. Please fix

Like other reviewers I'm sorry to be finally writing a review like this after cancelling my subscription.  I used to really like Memrise as a handy and fun learning toll to keep my brain active by learning some Japanese and Spanish. It looked nice and I liked the space theme and calming blue colours. There were some things I'd have liked to see improved, e.g. more grammar, a list of all the content for a course instead of just each module, the ability to make your own modules from the words in the course rather than just flag difficult words, the ability to adjust the speed of the timed questions and time to review the response to your answer before it disappeared. But it was good. The new update is (a) hideous, and (b) broken. The black and yellow theme is awful and subconsciously aversive (like wasps). Some of the content is also now broken: you cannot scroll down the video on my phone to reach the letters you need to answer the question, which was not a problem before, so I just have to skip it! Some videos/questions also just don't load at all!  And it's going up in price?! No thank you.

This app has been getting worse and worse. Offline barely works. You need to open the app with an internet connection for it to boot. Then you can go offline. Once offline stuby sessions take a long time to load. And sometimes you get stuck on a problem because the audio will not load. Even when online to sometimes takes a minute to load the audio for a question. Recently the app will not mark missed questions as missed and will not unmark then once you review them. Also some of the menu and summary screens take a few seconds to load every time you open them. This app is starting to really waste my time.

Everything works fine till you don't have internet. You get an offline mode if you pay for pro, which I did, but the offline mode doesn't ever work when I am in a place with low cell connectivity. The app works perfectly fine when I have internet though. But I paid for an offline mode and that is basically unusable. It get stuck at the loading screen. I don't even know what there is to load, my courses have been downloaded and are offline.

I've been a long term user user of this app, and the recent redesign of the ui is terrible in my opinion. The focus on yellows and blob shapes reshapes the atmosphere into one of a child's mind, with immaculate immaturity. As well as overbearing crowdedness. The focus on blues and greens before the "update" was great, it kept me coming back for more as the ui exuded spaciousness, erudition and exploration with the cool, dark undertones. I want this fixed, or at the very least a settings option.

It's not bad. I used it for about a few days, missed a day or two. Do like the idea of the little clips - it's nice to hear conversations in German. Just subscribed so we'll see what that's like. ETA I knocked down a couple stars. Probably doing something wrong but am not noticing any difference between the free version and having a subscription. All the content/features seems to be the exact same.

Memrise used to be my favorite language learning app. After learning French for months on Memrise, here is my feedback: 1) The app redesign is horrible. Color pallette is bad and the theme also not cohesive. Previous theme was easy to understand. If all you did is change the visuals, add an option for the user to switch them back. 2) A lot of the sentences or words in higher courses (French) are EXACTLY the same ones as basic levels. I keep leveling up but I'm not learning anything new.

Offline mode requires internet connection, which is frustrating when it advertised its premium version as something you can download courses with and access offline... If the app itself won't start without internet, it shouldn't advertise its premium version as working as without it, it was the primary reason I bought it.
Why the English language isn't available??

Requested a refund after completing the first level as it's impossible to restart a level if you don't understand it. This is a basic function of a language learning course. Cannot believe you don't offer it. Going back to Duolingo where I can restart a level as many times as it takes me to understand it.
It was a good app, Memrise are deleted the mems from the community courses. The mems helped a lot to memorise the difficult Chinese characters.

I cant decide if this is worse or Duolingo. Duolingo is just bad and sad cause its trying to teach you with the punishment way be removing a heart and then its trying to persuade you to pay them to get more hearts. This app does not seem to have this same punishment system but its lacking a lot, a tone, of features. Some words are wrong and you cant even report the mistake or propose the correct one...
Very disappointing I'm not able to learn Norwegian from Spanish
They got rid of one of the really cool key feature: mems. It was such a valuable learning asset! What a shame. :(
Not bad

I paid the subscription for the year because it says it has videos to learn, but it turns out that for the language I want to learn it doesn't have them. should let people know, because even if you pay The membership will not give you the premium options
Unfortunately the app is not very user-friendly.
I had the app for less than 1 minute because it didnt have the language i wanted to learn. If you could add ukrainian that'd be helpful :)
it seemed nice, but you have to unlock the full course. an ad-revenue model would be better.
I love this app
Too hard to understand, and no lead up in text to know what I might be hearing. Does not seem to be organized in any way I can follow with much ease. I will be deleting this one. I went with Wlingua.

there are spelling mistakes for example instead of 'january' it spelt it like 'janruy' and i had no idea what it was on about also if you press escape by accident you lose points which is annoying also you can be set homework which is never nice

I miss the "mem" feature, the language lesson I'm working on has some words spelled wrong, I liked being able to write the corrections. I mostly use the app, I wish there was a way to have it always open the keyboard. It displays a few letters and I can guess the spelling, which isn't conducive to actually learning the word. There should be a way to make only certain words appear in the same guessing game. When it asks for a suffix and only one of the words is a suffix it makes it too easy.

It's good, I like how it works. I just think that instead of having two options for "beginner" or "intermediate" there should be more. There should also be a test to see where our knowledge of the language is and then we can learn from there. The "intermediate" was a bit hard and a huge step forward for me, but "beginner" was too easy and I knew everything, I will edit my review to be higher if I see more as I use the app

I wanted to preface my review by saying this app is awesome, on ios, but not on android. My issue lies with custom courses. On custom courses, my photos show up as a link instead of the actual photo. Plus, transparent photos aren't transparent on the app. I wanted to like this app because the ios version is excellent but I just can't recommend it. I still use it, but not as my primary flashcard app for vocabulary.

Got this app for European Portuguese, the free version is useless and doesn't even preview all the features of this app. If you're willing to pay for it, the app is quite good, though it does not show you many of it's useful features (like marking a word as difficult manually) which make it much more useful. This is great for vocab and phrases and the learning w locals (video and audio of native speakers) is especially appreciated. Doesn't cover grammar or conjugation at all.

When you take away the new look Memrise is an awesome app for language learning. Being able the amount each lesson is extremely helpful if you're feeling overwhelmed. Enjoying features like the Locals, and being able to focus on difficult words or pronunciation. However, like I've seen already, the new look is a big turnoff for most people. Personally, it's too white and the green doesn't fit wherever you put it. Maybe try putting in a dark theme, that works well. Also change the flowers, yuck.

The material seems good, but it's not user friendly. I'm having a very hard time following the menus and understanding how the lessons progress and what needs to be done or redone to advance. It's very busy visually and lacks organization and clarity. Duolingo is waaay more user friendly and organized. Too bad Memrise is so hard to follow because it sounds like it's better for building vocab. Unfortunately I'm too frazzled by the disorganization, so I won't likely be using it.

I am a long time user of this app and love it a lot. It's fantastic at getting you to memorise whatever you need. However, I took a break from the app for a few months and when I came back, I found that I couldn't add from your wide variety of user-made courses. I can't add science and math courses or even fictional language courses. The only way I've found to do it so far is to login to the desktop wedsite and add courses through there. Am I missing something or has this feature really been removed from the app?

After the 7 day free trial, I bought the annual subscription. I am mostly satisfied with the app, but I do have two complaints. My favorite feature of the app is "learn with locals." It's super disappointing that once you move past the first level (and after the free trial period is up) that feature is no longer available. My second issue is that when I make a pronunciation mistake, the "difficult words" feature only has me spell, translate, and listen rather than pronounce.

Update: Very sad to see that I have to pay for a ton of options that used to be free to users. I've been on the app for over 4 years and enjoyed how much I have been learning, but now I have to move on to something that I can have the full experience of :( Old rating: 5‚≠êI do miss the old layout with the pretty colors and rocket ships. It felt more comfortable, but those don't matter! This app is awesome and I learn so much from it. The best üíúüíôüíö

App functions as a useful learning aid yet has its fair share of bugs. Some of it has to do with the UI, such as overlapping possible answer choices over the "Next" button. This leads to undesireable input often causing inaccurately labeled "difficut words" which you must manually deselect. There are more frustrating bugs, some that prevent access to Premium features. This is deeply troubling as Premium is not cheap. However, this app is one of the best, but probably not worth paying money for as long as Duolingo is around.

I like the app, but it is unconscionably stupid that the app doesn't allow you to change the language you're learning. On duolingo, you can hop back and forth or change whenever you want with ease. With Memrise, you have to go desktop, then change the language, then go back to the app. It's insane and has been like this forever. I'm docking a full two stars because this is such an egregious oversight.

Great language learning experience with a few caveats. A bit too many pop-ups asking to buy premium. Also a little glitchy for me. Often times I need to close and reopen the app to see all of my lessons in certain courses. Also, the app has still not integrated the Android 10 gesture navigation bar properly; it has a huge and ugly black bar across the bottom of the screen rather than being transparent or at the very least a color matching the background.

This is/was a fantastic app for learning languages. In particular, the Learning with Locals feature is great as the robotic AI voices in language apps can sometimes be hard to decipher. However, the new UI is hideous. It really does take away from the experience, and makes me want to put down the app for good and go back to Duolingo. Especially since this app costs money when Duolingo is free. I'm heavily considering it at this point.

With these new updates there is no longer a definition for Kanji when you are learning a new character, so you have to randomly guess the answers to find out what they mean. Also, I have been having problems for about a year now with the app randomly losing my streak even though I'm on every day. This isn't a huge deal, but it is motivating to see that number climb up and it's frustrating to go back to zero through no fault of my own. I'm also supposed to be getting notifications but I'm not

Lots of great features, easy to use anywhere, but multiple choice isn't the best way to learn. And after months of playing the same multiple choice game over and over with little variety, I got too sick of looking at it to keep learning! Also word association is actually a bad way to try to learn a new language- it's more work...
I find it difficult to learn Japanese language and Kanji at the same time. Learning in Hiragana and Katakana would have been easier before Kanji
Useful and has relevant vocabulary and sentences. Free version can stop proceeding sometimes...reported.

Hi! There used to be an option in courses (others not mine) that we could add our example/samples to the words. I can't see it anymore :( I usually added my example in a sentence to the word and it really helped me to learn the word better. Please help me!

Plus, transparent photos aren't transparent on the app. I wanted to like this app because the ios version is excellent but I just can't recommend it. I still use it, but not as my primary flashcard app for vocabulary.
The app is really good, but man, the UI is sooo counterintuitive I don't even know what I'm tapping

It's been a while since I used Memrise, I really miss the "mem" feature that you guys had, it wad a key selling point..

Good for vocab. Not great for verb conjugation or putting words learnt into conversation.

Good app, covers some bits thoroughly. It doesn't give any good reference info to revisit items that you've learned. There's a major bug with the 'tap to answer' sections which prevents you from removing your incorrect answer, forcing you to quit the session.

Wow, exceptional app to learn Spanish, the short videos and conversations has really helped.

When I first opened the Portugu√™se (Brazil) 2 course, i had access to the verb learning and testing. But now it reverted to the classical flash cards and I can't find all of the verb overviews!! Very frustrated because I know all the vocabulary but just need the conjugation!!! I will increase to 5 stars if I can choose what I want to learn. Now it makes me go through hundreds of words I already know without the ability to focus on verbs!
Good to hear natives speaking but the UI definitely needs improvement ‚Äì my progression path is just not clear enough. Whereas on D√∫o it's crystal clear.

The app is exceptional for its content, though that drops off in quality further in. It's the best Japanese learning resource I've found for growing intuition. Unfortunately, I'm now in the Japanese 3 module and it feels like a totally different person was in charge of creating this module. The words and phrases are now often unnatural, the recordings of native speech have dropped in quality, and some of the content contradicts the earlier lessons (like ‰ºöË®à vs ÊÑüÊÉÖ). Still highly recommend, though.

I've tried several language apps and this is one of my favorites. There are multiple ways of learning each new word or phrase, and my favorite is being offered a literal translation. I do wish it would give me the *meaning* of a word when i misremember it, and not just the literal translation, but that is a minor annoyance in an otherwise pleasant and useful set of tools. Memrise offers me the most control over what i learn and when, which is important to me!

Please read me. Not a bot. I recommend this app to a lot of people. It works, but don't think that you don't have to practice. I've gotten better with French, Spanish and now I'm working on Portuguese (Brazil). If you are serious about learning then the free version is perfect to start. Keep reviewing vocab until done and get compliments on your accent in no time. Just do these as well and your good. 1 watch videos on speaking/movies 2 listen to music in language 3 learn lyrics and you're good.

Having fun learning Japanese. Only criticism is that the word repeating exercises tend to not pick up what I'm saying if I speak as fast as the examples. You have to speak slowly and deliberately for the longer sentences it seems. Slightly frustrating. Aside from that small issue, the learning with locals and little skits they do are well done and funny.

Memrise offers the Portugal dialect of Portuguese, which has some differences from Brazilian Portuguese. Another app I've been using only offers Brazilian Portuguese but I'm studying for a trip to Portugal so it's nice to learn the language as it's spoken there. It's also great to hear native speakers as opposed to the computer generated voices the other app uses.

Overall a very impressive app! I enjoy all the different approaches to teaching all put into one place. Crazy lag on audio files (mostly when practicing pronunciation) and the non-functional offline mode. I'm not sure if anything actually downloaded, but the app won't function without data. The layout makes accidental skips and answers very easy, but that's more the fault of my being impatient.

This is a really good study tool, especially if you'rea beginner who wants a taste of a language before going deeper. The range of game modes makes it easy for me to motivate myself to study in various situations/moods, the premium vocab lists are fun, and the free courses are useful and plentiful. The app has areas it could improve still, like adding course search tools, and it's far from being the only study tool you need conversational skills. But it's a good app.

I got the app to help me learn vocabulary in my Korean course and it is helping a lot. I really enjoy some of the memes, they do help me remember the words. I also use duolingo, but it isn't connected to the howtolearnkorean course, so the vocabulary doesn't match, which is helpful for variety, but I'm really appreciating not having to keep track of the words I'm learning. The only bug is that every time I start up the app, it says that something went wrong. But I can work around it.

The introduction to Japanese was amazingly clear and organized, they removed a lot of user created lessons though which I think was due to the lack of organization in them. Other than that, the price is a little steep if you don't catch a special offer, but if the lessons went even further and more in depth than a brushing of the surface that I've experienced, it might be considerable. If you're looking for a full immersion, you might as well pay full price for a legit course instead of an app.

Pretty great overall as a learning platform, definitely one of the best if you go PRO. The free version will limit the level to which you learn a course, which is frustrating if you are trying to use this as a teacher with a classroom. Creating new courses still feels a bit primitive, but isn't too hard. One thing I would like to see change is the ability to browse and select courses in the app. Currently there is only a list of languages to choose from, and you need to visit the webpage to search through all subjects.

Currently the only issues I'm having with this app is not being able to replay audio in the planting memories portion (it plays after I've "Continued" tho). Also, when given three audio options to choose from, only one option actually plays an audio file. My partner also has these issues. Otherwise, love the app. I've used Memrise for several years and have never been disappointed. The new look isn't my favorite but its not bad.

For the most part I like the app but i do switch between my computer and phone a lot. Luckily I haven't had a problems with data transfer as some others have but I do wish all of the features worked on both. For instance (on the computer) when you spell a word wrong it'll have you spell it correctly before you continue. If they could add that to the app i believe it would prove useful to the mobile learning experience.

It's not a bad language app as language apps go. However one of its key lackings is the fact that you don't hear the words so often. Very few words have audio. This may be a teaser to get him to buy the full version which is really quite expensive. Also there are number of errors in vocabulary which are exposed via inconsistencies, but these are not so many as to make it not worth your while. I am using this app to learn Estonian.

The app is really good, the videos, repetition, complexity of the words, spelling, all if it is really strong. The PC interface is also really strong and we'll built. The downside is that while I am trying to determine if I have the ability to settle in and really learn a language I am constantly bombarded with "BUY THIS APP!!!!!" messages which make me want to dump it.

I love it! Very effective! But I have encountered one issue. I purchased the premium not that long ago, but it seems to have caused a problem. For some reason when I'm on the app for an extended period of time (20 minutes or more) the audio clips either take a really long time to play, or they don't play at all. I'll exit out of the app and come back in but often the issue is still there. I have a Moto g6 phone, if that helps at all. Great app besides that!
Fun, creative and simple app for learning the basics to different languages.
One of the best language apps in you pay for the subscription, but after certain lessons you can't continue if you don't pay, not like Duolingo which is free
really easy to use

I think this is a good app to add into your language learning journey as it has multiple people saying the same phrases so you get used to identifying sounds but some of the audio clips aren't as good as the rest, in that the audio volume of the clips is too low and some too high to find a happy medium volume. Would be a much nicer experience if all of the clips had the same audio level. But other than that, a good app.

I've been learning a lot through this app. It's so easy and fun. I love how there is a feature for us to practice our pronunciation by recording ourselves. But there is a slight problem that I've been facing. The feature Comprehension Test is absolutely wonderful and it could have been even better if we could save them for later. Just so I can practice listening to them more effectively. Please consider Saving Comprehension Tests as a feature, it would be very helpful!

Me ha gustado porque aprendo la pronunciaci√≥n de las palabras poco a poco asi como su traducci√≥n, frases en las que se aplican, ritmo, enfasis y gram√°tica. Ser√≠a excelente si tuviera tambien im√°genes :)

I love the fact that this app features real people saying the words and phrases and also love the listening exercise where you hear a short conversation between 2 people and then go back and listen to the conversation with either French or English subtitles. I decided to do the paid option as I wanted to get the most that I could out of the app, but I think the free version would be good practice too. Thank you!

I love the use of random responses need to flashcards. Some are tapping the matching tile w the correct word. Others may require typing. It uses a weighted scale on correct answers, and words you know, you'll see less and less but those will still come up, just not as frequently. I also like that I can mark words as previously known ti eliminate 'hola' for example from appearing at all.

Love this app! I cant put it down! I like how there are options for different geographic dialects and native speakers with real life accents. It's very engaging and the learning system is very efficient. I'm learning so much everyday and remembering it! Plus, the words I'm learning are words I can use in real life situations! Love this app. I'm addicted.

I've tried most of the language apps in my quest to learn Polish. They all have their pros and cons. I like Memrise a lot! Concept is fun and well-executed, puzzles are engaging, and has a unique feel. Price is reasonable. Strengths: teaching vocab and phrases, uses native speakers for pronunciation/listening skills, good pacing for learning curve, has literal translations. Weaknesses: Doesn't teach language mechanics, exercises are not custom-tailored to language. Overall: Recommended!

I love this app. Regular usage really helps make a difference. I was assigned particular courses in German by my professors years ago and I still use it regularly to help keep my broad vocabulary. I recently chose to begin learning Spanish with it and it's going quite well. I'm still learning Spanish, but I'm already able to bridge language barriers. I've been using the free version (with occasional ads) for years, but I use this so often that soon I am going to pay for premium.

Fun and effective way to learn European Portuguese (which differs from Brazilian). Multiple learning/teaching styles deeply reinforce vocabulary and grammar, and help form language patterns quickly. I recommend to all my friends. I've used the paid app for 3 years and although I'm not *fully* fluent, I can communicate with Portuguese on many different topics. Best if used daily, if for only 15-30 minutes. Awaiting a new level specifically teaching verb tenses/conjugations.

Fantastic. Besides the excellent lesson plans. The best thing about this app is they use real people's voices with different accents ,so you really understand how to make the sounds of each letter in each word. This os my favorite language app so far and I have a lot! It is a paid subscription, though you can try it for free. Up to like 33 learned words, I think.

I have used a lot of German learning apps: DuoLingo, Lingvist, Pimsleur, Grammatisch, Deutsche Welle, and a couple others. Each of them does certain things well and each has their weaknesses. I've gotten near fluent in reading German but can barely understand a thing when I turn on a German show and speaking it is even harder. Memrise is very good at getting you to understand phrases as they're spoken by native speakers at different speeds and different accents.

Amazing way to learn Portuguese. I've been with this app for YEARS. They get better every year and I'm thrilled about the new content that has been added. I love that you can hear locals, practice pronunciation (and can listen to yourself back) as well work on listening and associating words. I hope they add grammar, but if not it's okay. This jam packs a lot to just move forward to speak with and communicate with natives.

I recently started the European Portuguese course and am enjoying it. I especially appreciate the videos of native speakers, as they don't always speak with the same clarity as the stylized, perfectly accented audio clips. The listening practice clips took a bit to get the hang of, with one actor playing all the parts, but that forces you to really focus on the dialogue and not rely too much on visual cues for context.

I love Memrise. Duolingo is fine, but it's a bit more obnoxious. For example, after you choose the answer, you push the button to check, then you have to push another button to continue, even though you can't stop at that time anyway. It just throws me off and interrupts my rhythm. Memrise is more helpful to me with the efficiency of learning, the short bursts of lessons that I can do at my leisure and the memes, since I am very visual. It's less condescending to me, and more fun. üíóüëç

I like this app. I think it's a great addition to my daily study routine. I like that it has real people speaking in the video clips as opposed to the generated voices of other apps. I mimic the video each time, so I can get some good shadowing exercises in. I hope that it improves my accent when speaking to natives. I also like the spacing in repetition of vocabulary.

Just getting started learning (European) Portuguese with Memrise. Hearing native speakers say phrases I'm learning has really helped. Moreover, they do not use the same inflection so you can get a better real life sense of the words and phrases as they are being used. Another helpful feature is the ability to mark words as difficult so you can see them more often. You can also add notes to help you remember them. Overall, my experience has been enjoyable and I'm excited to learn!

The best app for learning a language. I haven't used it in a while and wanted to get back into it. The prices are much cheaper than when I originally signed up which was the reason I came back here and didn't sub to another, and that's excluding the deal. And I know it works because I just got everyone right on my first test in 6 8+ months. It definitely sticks. Thanks for the great app. Worth every penny.

Seriously worth the buy! There are tons of courses, and each uses amazing techniques for teaching. You can hone your listening skills by watching/listening to native speakers, and learn grammar visually. Lots of repetition - a necessity for learners. I'm so glad I found this app!
